HTML:
The successful candidate will join the Business Intelligence team in the data analyst role with the following responsibilities:

  • Requirements collection from business users and analysis of necessary information to be integrated into the DWH
  • Evolution of DWH data model in accordance with Group guidelines
  • ETL procedure management and development with azure data factory tool
  • Monitoring of data quality for appropriate use in business reporting
  • Setting and monitoring business KPIs to improve business performance
  • Develop reports and dashboards with Business Intelligence tools
  • Support users to perform analysis on DWH data and functional support for data navigation

Key Requirements/Skills/Experience

  • Proven experience (e.g. 2-3 years) as a Data Analyst or Data Engineer
  • University degree in scientific-technological studies
  • Strong Experience with cloud based infrastructures, Microsoft Azure platform will be preferred.
  • Knowledge of scripting languages, such as Python, R.
  • Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL language and MS SQL Server)
  • Experience in design, implementation, maintenance of ETL pipelines in cloud environments to collect data from different sources
  • Strong knowledge of and experience of Azure Data Factory
  • Knowledge and experience of messaging system (Kafka)
  • Experience in data manipulation and Business Intelligence tools , Power BI will be preferred
  • Knowledge and experience of Azure Databricks
  • Communication and Interpersonal Skills
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Accuracy and attention to detail
  • Fluent in Italian and English
  • Work Experience in the insurance industry will be preferred

Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.

We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.

We therefore welcome applications regardless of race, ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation, or any other characteristics protected under applicable local laws and regulations.

Join us. Let's care for tomorrow.

Both genders may apply in accordance with the L. 903/77 (s.m.i).

Title: Data Scientist Analyst
Description:
Company Description.

Moviri started as a research spinoff at Politecnico of Milan and was incubated at its startup accelerator.

Data and experimentation are part of our DNA: it is for this reason that we continuously focus on research, emerging ideas, and new technologies, routinely partnering with top academic and engineering research institutions.

Moviri Consulting is the first company of Moviri and its foundation. Moviri’s professionals use data, software, and insights to solve substantial business challenges for Fortune 500 corporations, multinational banks, global media conglomerates and some of the most respected brands in a variety of industries. The Moviri Consulting Performance Engineering team optimizes performance of IT systems to make them responsive, infinitely scalable, reliable, resilient and cost-effective.




Job Description.

As a Junior Data Scientist in the Moviri Consulting Analytics team, you will be involved in a project related to:

Have the ability to work autonomously, solve complex data science problems, design and code scalable, maintainable solutions.
Leverage machine learning and statistical methods to develop, train, optimize, and evaluate models in the areas of Advanced Analytics, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, and Generative AI.
Own the process of data collection, extraction, and aggregation from various sources using main Big Data paradigms, ensuring data is properly formatted, synthesized, and validated for accuracy.
Deploy AI models and systems into production environments, ensuring smooth integration with existing infrastructures and workflows.
Enhance algorithms and models for optimal performance, efficiency, and reliability in real-world applications.




Full-time position at the Milan Office on Hybrid Mode.




Qualifications:

If you share our passion for consulting in the Data & AI field and possess the following characteristics, we are waiting for you:

Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Physics or STEM related field;
Experience on software development and programming (e.g., Python, C++, Java, R); experience on Data Science libraries (Pandas, Scikit Learn, Keras, TensorFlow, Matplotlib, fastAPI);
Familiarity with GIT, AGILE methodology, and Continuous Integration and Delivery;
Familiarity with data management and related languages/tools, database programming in SQL and NoSQL;
Familiarity with Cloud Platforms (e.g. AWS, GCP, or Azure) and Big Data Domains (e.g. Hadoop, Spark);
Familiarity with Cloud Orchestration tools to automate deployment, scaling, and management of containers (e. g. Kubernetes) and containerization technologies (e. g. Docker);
Passionate about development of Machine Learning models (e.g. Time Series Analysis, Clustering, Classification, Anomaly Detection), Computer Vision, NLP, and Generative AI.




Compensation & Benefits

Make a Real Impact joining Moviri: we're on the lookout for dynamic individuals who want to be a driving force in their field, making a significant difference from day one.
Flexibility and Trust: from the moment you step in, you're not just an employee, but you're part of the team of talented colleagues. Moviri value freedom and responsibility, giving you the autonomy to excel and contribute your best in Hybrid mode
Competitive Salary and Company Welfare: Your hard work deserves recognition! Enjoy a competitive salary that reflects your skills and dedication. As a part of our team, you'll also receive a company welfare package of €600, useful for fuel, bills, as well as wellness and well-being!
Sustainability: in our office, you will always have access to fresh fruit thanks to Cortilia. In Moviri, we are committed to connecting conscious customers with local products and producers, all while prioritizing environmental and social responsibility.
Tech Your Way: choose your weapon in the tech battle! Whether you're team Mac or team Windows, we believe in equipping you with the tools that spark joy. After all, the only thing better than coding your next big idea is doing it on a laptop that suits your style!




Join our team

We cannot realize any of our ambitions or achieve any of our goals without the right talent. If this sounds like you, please apply now. It may be the start of your next chapter!

Title: Team Lead Data Analytics
Description:
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

🚀 Join us as a Team Lead Data Analytics and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Team Lead Data Analytics, you will join the Growth Intelligence team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product Marketing, CRM, Business Development and Engineering teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission


Coordinate and lead. Manage a team of 4+ skilled data analysts, coordinating their work to ensure alignment with business goals and maximizing the value they bring to the company.
Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the Growth team and business line through analysis and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions. Analytics, revenue forecasting, budgeting, customer insights will be part of the main projects you will manage using data solutions.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability. Create and maintain descriptive outcomes. Track key metrics and coordinate the creation of visual representations (dashboards, maps) to communicate analytical insights effectively.
Partner with data engineering. Work closely with data engineers to define and improve Satispay’s data structure, pipelines, and visualization layers, ensuring that analytics can scale and support business decisions effectively.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.


Your Ideal Profile


Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 5+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios.
Team leadership. You have at least 1+ years of experience in a leadership role, with a demonstrated ability to guide, motivate, and grow a team of analysts.
Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.


Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

🙆🏻 Join an international team to grow with

🏡 Hybrid working policy

🍽️ Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

🌐 Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

⭐ Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

🚀 Own part of Satispay’s success with our Stock Option Plan

👩🏻‍💻 Gear up with our tech equipment

🥳 Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a remote technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us

Curious about our core values? Explore them here.

Title: EMEA Marketing Operations Specialist and Data Analyst
Description:
We are Lenovo. We do what we say. We own what we do. We WOW our customers.

Lenovo is a US$57 billion revenue global technology powerhouse, ranked #248 in the Fortune Global 500, and serving millions of customers every day in 180 markets. Focused on a bold vision to deliver Smarter Technology for All, Lenovo has built on its success as the world’s largest PC company with a full-stack portfolio of AI-enabled, AI-ready, and AI-optimized devices (PCs, workstations, smartphones, tablets), infrastructure (server, storage, edge, high performance computing and software defined infrastructure), software, solutions, and services. Lenovo’s continued investment in world-changing innovation is building a more equitable, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. Lenovo is listed on the Hong Kong stock exchange under Lenovo Group Limited (HKSE: 992) (ADR: LNVGY).

This transformation together with Lenovo’s world-changing innovation is building a more inclusive, trustworthy, and smarter future for everyone, everywhere. To find out more visit www.lenovo.com, and read about the latest news via our StoryHub.

The Position will support Marketing Operations Director and Marketing Management Team at EMEA Level, with real time data and investment analysis to provide a clear view of the investment status and base for decisions.

These Are Your Detailed Responsibilities


Set Up and maintenance of Business and Marketing related Dashboards
Budgets Loading in systems and related Control for all Business Units in Lenovo EMEA
Budget Allocation Tracker Updating
Budget Review for all EMEA HQ Functions with Weekly/Bi-Weekly calls
EMEA HQ Activities Management in Marketing Systems
Management of Business Partners Payments Processes
Management of EMEA Alliances Claims Tracker
Communication of details of budget usage with Alliances
Marketing DATA Validation
KPI Set Up and Measurement
Support the Company beyond the current understanding of our marketing ROI and in defining proper KPI Structure
Develop positive relationships within the marketing leadership team and across critical cross-functional teams
Support annual and quarterly planning for Marketing and Revenue operations
Implementation of AI solution for Marketing and Business Planning within EMEA Marketing Organization


Position Requirements


Ability to develop/deliver solutions to complex problems where analytics, process change/development are keys to success
1-3 years of related experience in an analytics, consulting, or strategy role
Past experience engaging with executives; including preparing strategic analysis, crafting recommendations, and implementing the proposed solutions
Experience running mid-to-large cross-functional projects with varying degrees of complexity
A strong collaborator and communicator capable of working in a cross-functional environment to achieve success
A person with the energy, drive, passion, and enthusiasm to do and be motivated, creative, results-oriented, and possess the ability to communicate complex ideas in ways that are simple to understand
Strong attention to detail
Very high level of usage of Microsoft tools + capability of working with complex IT systems
Fluency in both written and spoken English is essential


What Do We Offer


Life Insurance
Pension/ Retirement Plan
Health Coverage Plan
Meal Vouchers
Employee Referral Bonus
Children of Lenovo Employees Scholarship Program
Lenovo and Motorola Product Discounts
Employee Assistance Program, e.g., for health, legal financial consultancy
Internal E-learning Development Platform Available for Employees


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Silbing is working with a leading organisation in Brussels looking for a Data Analyst to join on a 6-month contract (with likely extension). A great chance to shape high-impact projects in a fast-paced, international setting.




The role:




You’ll work with large datasets, build dashboards, and deliver insights that directly support strategic decisions




Key responsibilities:




Analyse complex data to uncover trends and insights
Build and optimise dashboards (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Work closely with stakeholders to understand requirements
Translate data into clear recommendations
Support data quality initiatives




Requirements




3+ years as a Data Analyst
Strong SQL and Excel
Experience with modern BI tools
Excellent communication – English essential, Dutch/French a bonus
Proactive and independent mindset

Title: Data Analyst - Power BI
Description:
Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!




Over LACO

LACO is een toonaangevend Belgisch data-intelligencebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring in business intelligence en data-analyse. Als trotse Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner beschikken we over diepgaande expertise in Microsoft BI, Data Governance en meer.




Met een team van meer dan 120 gepassioneerde consultants ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun volledige datatraject — van strategie tot implementatie. Wat ons uniek maakt? Onze focus op langetermijnrelaties en een bedrijfscultuur waar plezier en professionaliteit hand in hand gaan.




Door de groei van ons klantenportfolio en nieuwe boeiende projecten zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven Power BI-professional die samen met ons team impactvolle end-to-end dataoplossingen wil realiseren.




Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.




Jouw vaardigheden

Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in (toegepaste) informatica of een verwante richting.
Je hebt een analytische geest en denkt oplossingsgericht.
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of een vergelijkbare functie.
Je bent vertrouwd met SQL, DAX en Python.
Je hebt kennis van datamodelleringstechnieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen: je beheerst DAX, datamodellering én custom visuals.




Bonuspunten als je …

Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory en/of Databricks.
Weet hoe je efficiënt werkt met verschillende soorten datastorage.
Sterk communiceert en graag samenwerkt in teamverband.
Vloeiend bent in zowel Nederlands als Engels.




Ons aanbod

Of je nu werknemer of freelancer bent, wij staan open voor samenwerking.
Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met uitstekende extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfwagen etc.
Je krijgt ruimte voor persoonlijke en professionele groei via opleidingen en certificeringen.
Je werkt aan uitdagende en innovatieve projecten binnen het Microsoft-ecosysteem.
Je wordt deel van een warme en dynamische bedrijfscultuur, met aandacht voor fun: van familiedagen en sportactiviteiten tot onze jaarlijkse skitrip en gezellige spelavonden.




Klaar om jouw carrière naar een hoger niveau te tillen?

Solliciteer vandaag nog en geef je datatalent de ruimte die het verdient.

Ons Talent Acquisition-team kijkt ernaar uit om jou te leren kennen!

Show more

Wij zoeken een Data Analyst / Power BI-expert om ons Microsoft-team te versterken!


Over LACO

LACO is een toonaangevend Belgisch data-intelligencebedrijf met meer dan 35 jaar ervaring in business intelligence en data-analyse. Als trotse Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner beschikken we over diepgaande expertise in Microsoft BI, Data Governance en meer.


Met een team van meer dan 120 gepassioneerde consultants ondersteunen we bedrijven in hun volledige datatraject — van strategie tot implementatie. Wat ons uniek maakt? Onze focus op langetermijnrelaties en een bedrijfscultuur waar plezier en professionaliteit hand in hand gaan.


Door de groei van ons klantenportfolio en nieuwe boeiende projecten zijn we op zoek naar een gedreven Power BI-professional die samen met ons team impactvolle end-to-end dataoplossingen wil realiseren.


Jouw rol

Als Data Analyst/Power BI-expert bij LACO ben je verantwoordelijk voor:

  • Het begrijpen en in kaart brengen van de bedrijfsvereisten.
  • Het verzamelen, opschonen en voorbewerken van gegevens uit diverse bronnen.
  • Het nauw samenwerken met multifunctionele teams en je expertise in Power BI inzetten om overtuigende visualisaties en rapporten te maken.
  • Het ontwerpen, optimaliseren en ontwikkelen van Power BI-rapporten en dashboards die voldoen aan de bedrijfsbehoeften en -vereisten.
  • Het samenwerken met stakeholders om gegevensvereisten te verzamelen en te begrijpen, en zorgen voor nauwkeurige en consistente data.
  • Het oplossen van problemen met Power BI-rapporten en het omzetten van complexe datasets in bruikbare inzichten door middel van datavisualisaties.
  • Het up-to-date blijven met de nieuwste Power BI- en Microsoft Fabric-functionaliteiten en best practices om uit te blinken in deze rol.


Jouw vaardigheden

  • Je hebt een bachelor- of masterdiploma in (toegepaste) informatica of een verwante richting.
  • Je hebt een analytische geest en denkt oplossingsgericht.
  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Power BI Developer of een vergelijkbare functie.
  • Je bent vertrouwd met SQL, DAX en Python.
  • Je hebt kennis van datamodelleringstechnieken zoals Kimball, Dimensional Modelling en Data Vault.
  • Power BI kent voor jou geen geheimen: je beheerst DAX, datamodellering én custom visuals.


Bonuspunten als je …

  • Ervaring hebt met Azure Synapse, Data Factory en/of Databricks.
  • Weet hoe je efficiënt werkt met verschillende soorten datastorage.
  • Sterk communiceert en graag samenwerkt in teamverband.
  • Vloeiend bent in zowel Nederlands als Engels.


Ons aanbod

  • Of je nu werknemer of freelancer bent, wij staan open voor samenwerking.
  • Je krijgt een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met uitstekende extralegale voordelen zoals o.a. 32 vakantiedagen, bedrijfwagen etc.
  • Je krijgt ruimte voor persoonlijke en professionele groei via opleidingen en certificeringen.
  • Je werkt aan uitdagende en innovatieve projecten binnen het Microsoft-ecosysteem.
  • Je wordt deel van een warme en dynamische bedrijfscultuur, met aandacht voor fun: van familiedagen en sportactiviteiten tot onze jaarlijkse skitrip en gezellige spelavonden.


Klaar om jouw carrière naar een hoger niveau te tillen?

Solliciteer vandaag nog en geef je datatalent de ruimte die het verdient.

Ons Talent Acquisition-team kijkt ernaar uit om jou te leren kennen!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to step up as a Data Analyst and truly make a difference?

Do you have around 3 years of experience, but even more drive to grow? At darwind, we’re looking for people like you: professionals with some experience, but plenty of ambition to keep building their future.




Here, you don’t just get assigned to a project – we work with you to shape your ideal career path based on your talents and aspirations.




What will you do?

You source data from diverse channels such as databases, surveys, and external datasets.
You ensure data accuracy and relevance by filtering and cleaning it.
You use statistical methods to analyze data and identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
You create reports and dashboards to present findings to stakeholders.
You develop graphs, charts, and infographics to visualize data insights.
You work with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide solutions.




Who are we looking for?

You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role.
You're fluent in SQL and comfortable scripting in Python or R.
You have hands-on experience with Power BI and/or Tableau – from exploration to storytelling. You have in-depth knowledge of data modeling, relational databases, and ETL processes.
You're experienced in statistical analysis, including regression and advanced modeling (SPSS, SAS or similar).
You can clearly explain complex data topics to both technical teams and non-technical stakeholders.
You're fluent in Dutch, with good command of French and English.
You're curious, proactive, and passionate about solving complex data challenges.







What's in it for you?

Challenging projects tailored to your interests and expertise across industries.
A say in your career path, with coaching, training, and regular feedback.
An attractive salary package with hospitalization and group insurance, plus a mobility budget or company car with fuel card.
A flexible, hybrid work environment where autonomy is the norm.
A team that supports and inspires each other – no egos, just impact.
The chance to work with data that actually gets used to drive decisions, not just reports that end up in someone’s inbox.




Ready for a fresh wind in your career? Apply today and let’s grow together!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
!Join a Dynamic and Exciting Team at Cleeven!




Are you ready to be part of a fast-growing, ambitious company where innovation meets impact? Do you want to take part in cutting-edge data projects and accelerate your career in a collaborative, energetic environment?




At Cleeven, we believe that your growth drives our success. Join us and become a key player in projects that matter — in a company that invests in your development every step of the way.




WHO ARE WE ?




Cleeven is an international engineering consulting firm built on two core principles:

OUR MISSION: To enhance self-awareness and the awareness of those around us.
OUR BELIEF: The excellence of European engineers and data professionals should power Europe’s leadership in technology and innovation.




We work hand-in-hand with our clients to deliver data-driven insights, cutting-edge technologies, and sustainable performance improvements.




YOUR ROLE AS A DATA ANALYST




As a Data Analyst at Cleeven, you will contribute to high-impact data initiatives across financial and industrial sectors. You’ll play a crucial role in transforming data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:

Requirement analysis: Understand and synthesize functional and technical needs.
Data asset analysis: Evaluate available datasets, identify gaps, and define data strategies.
Statistical modeling: Define models (PCA, logistic regression, random forest, etc.) tailored to business challenges.
Data sourcing: Collect, structure, and consolidate data from various internal and external sources.
Tool implementation: Work with tools and languages such as R, Python, SAS, SPSS to implement models.
Performance optimization: Fine-tune algorithms for accuracy and efficiency.
Result interpretation: Present findings in a clear, actionable manner for stakeholders.
Tech watch: Stay current on Big Data, machine learning, and statistical innovation.
Solution qualification: Participate in validating data-driven solutions for production deployment.




WHO YOU ARE




You’re curious, analytical, and solution-oriented — and ready to put data at the heart of decision-making.

Your ideal profile:

Master’s degree in a relevant field
Fluent in English + Dutch and/or French (trilingual is a major asset)
Experience with data tools such as Python, R, SQL, SAS, Power BI, Tableau...
Familiar with statistical methods and machine learning fundamentals
Autonomous, adaptable, and a collaborative team player
A first experience in the financial sector is a plus




WHAT’S HAPPENING AT CLEEVEN?




Your journey at Cleeven is more than a project — it’s a path to your potential. Here’s how we support you:

Cleeven Coaching Program: Optional one-on-one coaching tailored to your development goals
Monthly Project Follow-Ups: Regular discussions with your manager to track progress and provide support
Boost Your Skills: Bi-monthly expert sessions to build your technical and analytical skills
Social Events: From networking evenings to off-site gatherings, we foster connection and community




"With Cleeven, become who you are!"

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📊 Vacature: Freelance Data Analyst




Wat?

Je analyseert complexe datasets en vertaalt deze naar heldere inzichten.
Je ontwikkelt dashboards en rapporten in Power BI en/of Tableau die stakeholders ondersteunen in hun beslissingen.
Je werkt nauw samen met collega’s uit verschillende teams om data-driven strategieën te ondersteunen.
Je optimaliseert datastromen en schrijft efficiënte SQL-query’s om de juiste informatie boven te halen.




Wie ben jij?

Je hebt ervaring als Data Analyst of in een gelijkaardige functie.
Je bent sterk in SQL en weet hoe je data uit verschillende bronnen efficiënt kunt combineren.
Je hebt ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau.
Je werkt zelfstandig, maar bent ook een teamplayer.
Je spreekt vlot Engels. Kennis van Nederlands en/of Frans is een plus.




Voor jou:

Hybride werkmodel: een mooie balans tussen werken op kantoor (regio Zaventem) en van thuis uit.
Dynamische en maatschappelijk relevante sector: je komt terecht in een organisatie die een cruciale rol speelt in nationale en internationale connectiviteit.
Innovatie en duurzaamheid staan centraal in de bedrijfsstrategie.
Je werkt in een moderne werkomgeving met veel aandacht voor persoonlijke groei, opleiding en samenwerking.
Snelle opstart mogelijk – we zoeken iemand die op korte termijn beschikbaar is.




Interesse? buna@recurv.be

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a Data Analyst for one of our clients in the banking sector to support data-driven decision-making. The candidate will work closely with business units to gather, interpret, and translate data into insights that improve processes, support regulatory reporting, and inform strategic initiatives.







Responsibilities:




Collect, clean, and validate structured and unstructured data from internal and external sources.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and data visualisations to support business analysis and performance monitoring.
Work closely with business stakeholders to define reporting needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Perform data mining and statistical analysis to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Support regulatory and compliance reporting through accurate and timely data provision.
Collaborate with IT, risk, finance, and compliance teams to ensure alignment on data governance and quality standards.
Contribute to the development and documentation of data models and data dictionaries.
Assist in the implementation of data quality controls and data lineage tracking.







Profile:




Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Min 3 years of proven experience in a data analytics role, preferably within the banking or financial services sector.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Qlik).
Experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Solid understanding of data management principles, including data governance and data quality.
Experience working with large datasets and relational databases.
Strong analytical mindset with attention to detail.
Knowledge of banking products, financial regulations, or risk management is considered an asset.
Fluent in English and able to communicate professionally in Dutch.













About Dynafin Consulting




DynaFin Consulting is a human-sized, flexible consulting company delivering services in the Financial Services Industry. Our company consists of more than 160 committed consultants in several business domains: Invest – Payments – Credits – Insurance – Data - Risk & Compliance.

In 14 years, we have become a reference in the Belgian Financial Services landscape. In July 2017, we joined the Alan Allman Associates ecosystem, adding the international dimension to our ambitions.




What we offer :

- An attractive salary package (a competitive fixed salary with benefits: car (models in line with our "green fleet mobility" - net allowances - smartphone budget - full insurance & hospitalization insurances …).

- The opportunity to optimize your work-life balance.

- A team of dynamic and passionate colleagues, recognized for their expertise.

- An excellent collaborative working environment: One Team & One Dream

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 51.000 colleagues in nearly 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

As a Data Analyst at Sopra Steria, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients from various industries through their dynamic data journey. You will assist clients in transforming their data processes. By thoroughly analysing and understanding customer needs, you’ll match their requirements with meaningful data solutions. Your innovative approach will enable you to generate impactful analyses that deliver efficient, user-focused solutions. Through your expertise and advice across the data value chain, you’ll ensure the successful implementation and support of Sopra Steria’s diverse portfolio of data services.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


At least 3 years of experience as a Data Engineer or Data Analyst.
You help customers in their data transformation, focusing on data architecture, data strategy and governance, data transformation, data foundation, and more
Based on your advice across the entire data value chain, you ensure that Sopra Steria’s portfolio of relevant data services is implemented and supported
You collect, analyze and match customer demand with meaningful data
You have knowledge and experience with databases and data modeling
You have good knowledge and experience with SQL
Knowledge of a programming language like Python is a plus
You have analytical thinking, communication skills and a practical attitude.
You are proficient in English; knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a must.


What We Can Offer You

Become part of a major Tech player in Europe that is recognised for consulting, digital services and software development. Work among high-level professionals who dare to make bold choices to deliver results.

Additionally, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.  

Additional Information

Are you ready to further develop your career? Then we’d love to point you in the right direction. With offices in more than 30 countries, that direction might lead you to places you’ve never been to before. Would you prefer to grow internally? That’s possible, too. We challenge you to keep pushing yourself to become the best you can be.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


Ready to take the next step?

We’re here to support you all the way and we are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Ben jij er klaar voor om als Data Analist echt het verschil te maken?

Heb je meer dan 3 jaar ervaring, maar nog meer zin om te groeien? Bij darwind zijn we op zoek naar mensen zoals jij: professionals met enige ervaring, maar met veel ambitie om aan hun toekomst te blijven bouwen.




Hier krijg je niet zomaar een project toegewezen - we werken met je samen om jouw ideale carrièrepad vorm te geven op basis van jouw talenten en ambities.




Wat ga je doen?

Je haalt gegevens uit verschillende kanalen, zoals databases, enquêtes en externe datasets.
Je zorgt ervoor dat gegevens accuraat en relevant zijn.
Je gebruikt statistische methoden om gegevens te analyseren en trends, patronen en correlaties te identificeren.
Je maakt rapporten en dashboards om bevindingen te presenteren aan belanghebbenden.
Je ontwikkelt grafieken, diagrammen en infographics om gegevens te visualiseren.
Je werkt samen met cross-functionele teams om hun databehoeften te begrijpen en oplossingen te bieden.




Wie zoeken we?

Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een gelijkaardige analytische rol.
Je spreekt vloeiend SQL en bent vlot in het schrijven van scripts in Python of R.
Je hebt hands-on ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau - van exploratie tot storytelling.
Je hebt diepgaande kennis van datamodellering en ETL-processen.
Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden, een gestructureerde mindset en kritisch denkvermogen.
Je kunt complexe data duidelijk uitleggen aan zowel technische teams als niet-technische stakeholders.
Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands, met een goede kennis van Frans en Engels.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, proactief en gepassioneerd over het oplossen van complexe data-uitdagingen.




Wat zit er voor jou in?

Uitdagende projecten op maat van jouw interesses en expertise in verschillende sectoren.
Inspraak in je loopbaan, met coaching, training en regelmatige feedback.
Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie en groepsverzekering, plus een mobiliteitsbudget of bedrijfswagen met EU tankkaart.
Een flexibele, hybride werkomgeving waar autonomie de norm is.
Een team dat elkaar steunt en inspireert geen ego's, alleen impact.
De kans om te werken met gegevens die daadwerkelijk worden gebruikt om beslissingen te nemen, niet alleen rapporten die in iemands inbox belanden.

Show more
HTML:
Ben jij er klaar voor om als Data Analist echt het verschil te maken?

Heb je meer dan 3 jaar ervaring, maar nog meer zin om te groeien? Bij darwind zijn we op zoek naar mensen zoals jij: professionals met enige ervaring, maar met veel ambitie om aan hun toekomst te blijven bouwen.


Hier krijg je niet zomaar een project toegewezen - we werken met je samen om jouw ideale carrièrepad vorm te geven op basis van jouw talenten en ambities.


Wat ga je doen?

  • Je haalt gegevens uit verschillende kanalen, zoals databases, enquêtes en externe datasets.
  • Je zorgt ervoor dat gegevens accuraat en relevant zijn.
  • Je gebruikt statistische methoden om gegevens te analyseren en trends, patronen en correlaties te identificeren.
  • Je maakt rapporten en dashboards om bevindingen te presenteren aan belanghebbenden.
  • Je ontwikkelt grafieken, diagrammen en infographics om gegevens te visualiseren.
  • Je werkt samen met cross-functionele teams om hun databehoeften te begrijpen en oplossingen te bieden.


Wie zoeken we?

  • Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring als Data Analist of in een gelijkaardige analytische rol.
  • Je spreekt vloeiend SQL en bent vlot in het schrijven van scripts in Python of R.
  • Je hebt hands-on ervaring met Power BI en/of Tableau - van exploratie tot storytelling.
  • Je hebt diepgaande kennis van datamodellering en ETL-processen.
  • Je beschikt over sterke analytische vaardigheden, een gestructureerde mindset en kritisch denkvermogen.
  • Je kunt complexe data duidelijk uitleggen aan zowel technische teams als niet-technische stakeholders.
  • Je spreekt vloeiend Nederlands, met een goede kennis van Frans en Engels.
  • Je bent nieuwsgierig, proactief en gepassioneerd over het oplossen van complexe data-uitdagingen.


Wat zit er voor jou in?

  • Uitdagende projecten op maat van jouw interesses en expertise in verschillende sectoren.
  • Inspraak in je loopbaan, met coaching, training en regelmatige feedback.
  • Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket met hospitalisatie en groepsverzekering, plus een mobiliteitsbudget of bedrijfswagen met EU tankkaart.
  • Een flexibele, hybride werkomgeving waar autonomie de norm is.
  • Een team dat elkaar steunt en inspireert geen ego's, alleen impact.
  • De kans om te werken met gegevens die daadwerkelijk worden gebruikt om beslissingen te nemen, niet alleen rapporten die in iemands inbox belanden.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Leuven who work in the Pharmaceutical sector are looking for a Data Analyst to work on multiple active projects. The selected consultant will be working with existing data, gathering it from various applications and transforming it into structured datasets that can be analysed and used for reporting and decision-making across the organization.

Key skills

Data gathering & cleansing experience
Data Analysis & Reporting experience
Advanced SQL
ETL & Data Modeling
English speaking

Logistics

Hybrid
Freelance
English Speaking

This role is a long-term freelance mission with a hybrid set up with only 2 day per week on-site required. We are hosting interviews for this position over the next two weeks so please get in touch if you are interested.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the company:

As a total solution provider of medical devices and pharmaceutical packaging, Nipro Europe Group Companies is continuously committed to improving patient outcomes and quality of life. We are part of a large global network headed by Nipro Corporation Japan, an industry-leading healthcare company with over 38,000 employees worldwide. Our European headquarters in Mechelen, Belgium covers a wide geographical reach (Europe, Africa, India, the Americas) and is home to Nipro Medical EMEA, Nipro PharmaPackaging International, and the Institute for Medical Practice (iMEP) Belgium.




To accommodate our growth, Nipro EMEA is looking for a BI Analyst/Engineer who is dynamic, hands-on, and collaborative to join us in our Data Analytics team, based in our European headquarters office in Mechelen, Belgium.




About the role

You will be working in a team that designs, develops, and maintains data warehouses and data lakes. You will integrate various data sources, develop interactive dashboards, and analyse large datasets to provide valuable business insights.




What you’ll do

Design, develop, and maintain data warehouses and data lakes.
Integrate various data sources ensuring accuracy and integrity.
Develop interactive dashboards and reports to visualize insights.
Analyse large datasets to identify trends and opportunities.
Collaborate with departments to understand data needs.
Document data processes and support data-related queries.




What you’ll need

Bachelor's or master's degree in Computer Science or related field.
5+ years of experience as a BI analyst/engineer.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of SQL and/or Python.
Experience with Azure, Snowflake, and PowerBI.
Hands-on mentality and proactive mindset.




Why you should apply

Join a global leader in healthcare with a commitment to improving patient outcomes.
Be part of a dynamic and growing team in a supportive work environment.
Opportunity to make a significant impact on data strategies and operations.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Career growth and development opportunities within a global network.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Location: Remote

Employment Type: Contract

Monthly Salary: $3k-$4k

Timezone: 2pm cest - 10pm cest




We’re looking for a detail-oriented Data/Business Analyst with strong marketing analytics expertise to join our growing team. You’ll play a pivotal role in optimizing marketing campaigns and sales performance by building insightful dashboards, integrating data from multiple platforms, and enforcing data governance best practices. Your work will directly inform strategic decisions across the business.

What You’ll Do

Develop and maintain dynamic Tableau dashboards to provide actionable insights to marketing and sales teams.
Build and manage data pipelines that integrate data from Martech and CRM platforms (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo).
Implement and oversee UTM governance, campaign tracking frameworks, and attribution modeling to accurately assess performance.
Partner with marketing and sales stakeholders to define KPIs and translate business needs into technical requirements.
Enforce data quality standards and ensure consistency across reporting sources.
Perform advanced Excel-based analysis, creating reports and models to support campaign and sales strategy decisions.
Continuously optimize reporting processes and recommend improvements to the marketing tech stack.

What We’re Looking For

4+ years of experience in a data/business analyst role focused on marketing or sales.
Strong proficiency in Tableau for data visualization and storytelling.
Proven experience with Martech and CRM data integration (e.g., Salesforce, HubSpot, Marketo, Pardot).
Deep understanding of campaign tracking, UTM governance, and multi-touch attribution.
Advanced Excel skills – including pivot tables, lookups, data modeling, and automation techniques.
Experience with SQL and working knowledge of ETL processes a strong plus.
Strong communication skills with the ability to translate complex data into clear insights.

Title: Intership Data Analyst - Personalization
Description:
Join our team as a personalization Data analyst intern!

Are you passionate about data and customer engagement? As an intern in our personalization product team, you'll be an integral part of the cockpit squad, responsible for managing interactions with our customers through both inbound and outbound channels.

What You'll Do


Analyze customer behavior: Use data-driven insights to understand and engage with our customers effectively.
Build dashboards: Create and maintain dashboards in Cognos or Power BI to track and follow up on current actions.
Guide stakeholders: Assist in navigating our communications process to ensure smooth and effective interactions.


Why join us?


Hands-on experience: Gain practical experience in data analysis and customer engagement.
Collaborative environment: Work with a dynamic team dedicated to innovation and excellence.
Professional growth: Develop your skills and build a strong foundation for your career.


Interested? Apply now!

, ING Bank

Title: Data Analyst / Data Consultant
Description:
Data Analyst / Data consultant

Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?

Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?

Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.

We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.

In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.

You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.

Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.

We Are Looking For Talent With The Following


Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis


Skills & Expertise


Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English


What We Offer You


The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals
An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers
Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A hybrid (on-site/remote) work environment
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients
A diverse, inclusive, meritocratic culture

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
SII Belgium is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Big Data to join our team. As a Big Data Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing big data solutions to support business objectives. You will work with large, complex data sets and be responsible for analyzing and interpreting data to identify trends and insights. . You would join various teams working in the Energy, Retail, Banking or Telecom sectors.

SII is a European digital and engineering services company of 16,000 experts. SII Belgium supports large businesses in adopting new technologies and innovation management. SII values empowerment and entrepreneurship, providing a fulfilling work environment for employees. Our mission is to contribute to the design and development of future products and services for customers. SII is committed to a sustainable digital world and is recognized as a Great Workplace.  

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and maintain big data solutions to support business objectives
Analyze and interpret large, complex data sets to identify trends and insights
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and implement data-driven solutions
Create and maintain data visualization and reporting tools to support decision-making
Integration between enterprise architecture and data collection.
Stay up to date with industry trends and technologies to identify new opportunities for data analysis


Qualifications:


You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in IT.
Minimum of 3 years of experience working with data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, Hive…
Strong analytical skills and experience using statistical techniques to interpret data
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau and Power BI
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French, and fluent in English.


We offer:


A challenging and varied role in a growing company
Opportunity to work with the latest technologies
Competitive salary and benefits
Opportunity to improve your skills and knowledge through training and education
Warm and open company culture, supported by an international group


If you are passionate about Data and want to work in a dynamic and fast-paced environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity at SII Belgium.

Title: Data Analyst M/F
Description:
At LittleBigCode, a fast-growing and dynamic company, we push the boundaries of data and artificial intelligence to deliver cutting-edge solutions to today’s technological challenges. Our talented team is committed to innovation, knowledge sharing, and leveraging the power of data to drive meaningful insights and impactful decisions. If you're passionate about data analysis, business intelligence, and turning complex datasets into actionable strategies — and want to play a key role in a pioneering team — this opportunity is made for you.




What will be your tasks with us ?




You will work in Agile mode and you will support our client on their challenges related to Data analysis:




Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure data accuracy and reliability

Analyze datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decisions

Create detailed reports and dashboards to visualize findings and communicate results effectively to stakeholders

Conduct exploratory data analysis (EDA) to understand data distributions, outliers, and potential issues

Develop and maintain queries, scripts, and automation for data extraction and reporting purposes

Work closely with clients or internal teams to understand business objectives and translate them into actionable data insights

Perform statistical analysis to validate hypotheses and make data-driven recommendations

Support decision-making by providing actionable insights that inform business strategy and operations




Profile

You have a Master in Engineering (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics) and you have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst

You are comfortable working with both technical & business stakeholders, thanks to your nice communication skills

You are fully proficient in Data Visualization (PowerBI, Tableau) and SQL, Python is considered as a real +

You master the creation of dashboards & visualization solutions in order to bring business teams valuable & dynamic insights

You have experiences with Data services of at least one the major Cloud Provider (Azure, AWS, GCP)

Support Data Scientists & Data Engineers on deployment of AI applications

Ensure a technological watch in order to propose innovations

Fluent in English and Dutch and/or French

Title: Game Data Analyst
Description:
Department: Data

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Remote

Description

We are looking for a talented Game Data Analyst to join our dynamic analytics team. You'll work closely with game teams, using data to drive player retention, improve monetization strategies, and optimize user experience. If you’re excited by data and games, this is the role for you.

All The Responsibilities We'll Trust You With


You’ll collaborate with game development teams to analyze player behavior, identify trends, and provide actionable insights to drive game performance and player engagement.
You’ll create dashboards and visualizations that support key business decisions by presenting clear and data-driven recommendations to senior stakeholders.
You’ll design, implement, and analyze A/B tests to measure the effectiveness of new game features and mechanics.
You’ll work on projects related to the blockchain, analyzing how players engage with decentralized features and in-game economies.
You’ll contribute to advanced analytics projects, including game economy analysis, to enhance monetization strategies and game progression.
You’ll build out new ways to map in-game events, such as stunts, crashes, and progression to optimize player experience.
You’ll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.


What You'll Bring To The Team


At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.


Why You'll Love Working With Us


We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
We offer unlimited holidays. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

  • You’ll continuously drive data literacy within the company, helping stakeholders leverage data effectively for decision-making.

What You'll Bring To The Team

  • At least 2-3 years of experience in data analytics, preferably within a gaming environment.
  • Proficient in SQL and Python (or R) for data exploration and analysis.
  • Strong experience with A/B testing and applied statistics (bonus if familiar with Bayesian statistics).
  • Experience building dashboards using tools like Metabase, Looker, or Tableau.
  • Strong analytical skills and a proactive mindset.
  • A fast learner, able to balance immediate needs with long-term projects.
  • A collaborative team player, comfortable working with cross-functional teams.

Why You'll Love Working With Us

  • We’re 100% remote, work wherever you want forever!
  • We offer unlimited holidays. Take as much time off as you need, to spend time with your family and friends or just because you feel like playing games all day. We trust our team and want to offer a modern work life balance that allows you to thrive both at work and in your personal life.
  • You’ll be able to make an impact, to work closely with the rest of the team and its leads to work on one of the most promising upcoming games in the mobile gaming industry and the Web3 space.
  • You’ll have a comfortable work schedule and stable workload. With a variety of tasks that will allow your constant professional development.
  • We want our team to grow personally and professionally and support learning opportunities, especially with a focus around new AI tools and methods.
  • We have a culture that puts our people first. We believe in open communication, creativity and the value of unique contributions from everyone in the team.
  • We offer a competitive salary in addition to equity option plans.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
En tant qu'analyste de données au sein de notre équipe Data Analytics & Insights, vous jouez un rôle crucial dans la traduction des données en informations exploitables.

Vous intégrez ces informations dans des solutions basées sur les données ayant un impact direct, utilisées de manière ciblée par les parties prenantes.

Quelles seront vos responsabilités ?


Vous collaborez étroitement avec différentes équipes (opérations, ventes, marketing, contrôle, etc.) pour bien comprendre leurs besoins et développez des solutions basées sur les données ayant un impact stratégique ou opérationnel concret.
Vous concevez, développez et maintenez des tableaux de bord et des rapports pour rendre visibles les KPI importants et les processus d'affaires.
Vous analysez des données opérationnelles, financières et commerciales complexes afin d'identifier des tendances, des écarts et des opportunités d'optimisation, et vous les traduisez en informations concrètes pour diverses parties prenantes.
Vous vous assurez que vos solutions basées sur les données répondent aux besoins des utilisateurs, tout en garantissant qu'elles sont utilisées de manière efficace et ciblée, en impliquant et formant correctement les utilisateurs.
Vous utilisez des outils comme Power Query, Power Automate et SQL pour automatiser les processus de données et optimiser les flux de travail.


Vous retrouvez-vous dans le profil suivant ?


Vous avez 3 à 5 ans d'expérience dans un domaine pertinent (analyse de données, BI, reporting et création de tableaux de bord).
Vous êtes capable de convertir des données complexes en informations claires et exploitables, avec de solides compétences dans l'utilisation d'outils d'analyse de données/langages comme Excel et Python, et des outils de visualisation tels que Power BI.
Une expérience en SQL est un atout, tout comme des connaissances des outils Microsoft Power Apps, Power Automate et Power Query.
Vous êtes proactif avec un bon sens de l'organisation et capable de mener un sujet de manière autonome.
Vous avez d'excellentes compétences en communication pour collaborer efficacement avec les équipes techniques et commerciales.
Vous parlez couramment le néerlandais ou le français, avec une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais.


Que pouvez-vous attendre si vous rejoignez Volkswagen D’Ieteren Finance?


Un package salarial complet basé sur vos compétences et performances, un bonus annuel, 11 jours de congés supplémentaires, des chèques-repas, un plan de pension, une assurance hospitalisation et ambulance, etc.
Choix parmi diverses solutions de mobilité adaptées à votre style de vie. Que ce soit une voiture de société, un abonnement aux transports publics, la location de vélos ou de voitures pour vous et votre famille, le choix vous appartient !
Profitez de la possibilité de travailler efficacement depuis chez vous, avec une indemnité de télétravail et d'internet, ainsi qu'un équipement informatique complet pour garantir votre confort.
Développez vos talents grâce à des formations proposées par notre D'Ieteren Academy.
Large éventail d'opportunités de carrière : avec plus de 31 marques, nous offrons une multitude de possibilités pour favoriser votre développement professionnel.


Qu’est-ce qui se cache derrière le nom de Volkswagen D’Ieteren Finance?

Volkswagen D'Ieteren Finance est le leader incontesté et partenaire de mobilité pour les clients particuliers et professionnels. Nous créons des synergies avec le réseau de distribution étendu de nos marques Volkswagen, Audi, Seat, Skoda, Porsche et MAN. Notre objectif ? Garantir la mobilité de nos clients en offrant des solutions flexibles (financement et leasing, ainsi que des solutions complètes pour la conduite électrique), un service de qualité, un suivi minutieux et des conseils personnalisés.

Travailler pour D'Ieteren? Ils en parlent!

Travailler chez D’Ieteren combine la passion pour l'automobile avec de nouvelles solutions de mobilité, une technologie de pointe et une atmosphère familiale. D’Ieteren résonne avec de nombreux projets et parties prenantes, nous permettant de grandir.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst focusing on BASE data reporting & analysis and guiding decision makers by providing domain specific insights. You are the first contact person for all business analytical questions related to your domain and act as a liaison between the domain’s business stakeholders and the data (or data teams).

Your Tasks As a Data Analyst


You develop curiosity and understanding of your domain’s business context and processes which positions you as a perfect data partner to your stakeholders
You collect, query, clean, validate and manipulate the data you need from different sources
You define, build and automate reporting dashboards relevant for the business topic you are working on
You develop a proactive partnership with your stakeholders
You perform descriptive ad hoc analyses
You occasionally perform deep-dive analyses on specific insights requests that lead to actionable recommendations for the business colleagues
You take an active role in the community of data professionals within Telenet, through sharing sessions


Our Ideal Data Analyst


You have strong analytical skills
You have a hands-on mentality to really dive into the data and find the answers
You have a constructive mindset and can collaborate effectively with colleagues from various teams, both from a business and a more analytical background
You can manage an analytics initiative end to end, including strong communication & presentation skills and stakeholder management
You have experience in commercial reporting
You have a solid knowledge of one of the main dashboard tools (Qlik Sense, Power BI or Tableau); previous Qlik Sense experience is a big plus
You have a knowledge of SQL. Experience with Snowflake is a nice to have
You have a relevant degree and experience
Master's degree in a quantitative field (commercial engineering, TEW, computer science, information management ...) or equivalent through experience
Min. 3 years relevant work experience
Fluent in English and French, knowledge of Dutch is a bonus

What We Have To Offer


A varied job in which you produce tangible results and make your mark
An agile working environment, giving you significant responsibility and autonomy
All the space you need to further develop your expertise. We stimulate your personal growth with internal mobility opportunities and extensive learning opportunities
Opportunity to work from home 60% of your time
A competitive gross monthly salary that we complement with a lot of fringe benefits (meal vouchers, mobile phone, mobility budget, hospitalization insurance, telephone subscription, discounts on Telenet products, etc.)
The company of passionate colleagues. Join a team of young, dynamic, enthusiastic, and results-driven data profiles, with fun team buildings, on-site padel games and the occasional afterwork drinks
Telenet is a leading company in the field of Data and creating impact using Data & AI. We recently won the Data Maturity Award by Madison Partners & Delaware

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Vacature Ervaren Data Analist




Geo Solutions is een Belgisch bedrijf dat organisaties helpt om de kracht van locatiedata ten volle te benutten. Wij ontwerpen en ontwikkelen slimme GEO-ICT oplossingen op maat. Onze innovatieve en flexibele dienstverlening ondersteunt klanten in de overheid, nutsbedrijven, industrie en constructie bij strategische en operationele beslissingen.




Waar je ons terugvindt? Wel, ons hoofdkantoor is gelegen in Edegem, maar we bieden ook flexplekken aan in onze hubs in Gent, Leuven en Namen. Daarnaast zal je ook op wekelijkse basis ter plaatse op je toegewezen project bij je klant werken.




Zo ziet jouw rol als Data Analist eruit:

Werkplek: bij je klant, Geo-kantoor/hub, thuis




Als Data Analist bij Geo Solutions maak je locatiedata inzichtelijk voor onze klanten. Een achtergrond in de brede wereld van geo is niet noodzakelijk, maar je hart mag wel een slagje sneller slaan bij het zien van X, Y en Z’s.




Een greep uit je takenpakket:

Je vertaalt businessnoden naar datavereisten, en je kan daar helder over communiceren.
Je voert diepgaande en kwalitatieve analyses uit op complexe datasets en zet de bevindingen om naar heldere rapporten.
Je schat het potentieel van use cases in door een eerste exploratieve screening. Daarbij zet je zowel een sceptische als opportunistische bril op.
Je volgt technologische ontwikkelingen op en deelt actief je kennis met interne en externe collega’s.




Jouw profiel:

Bachelor- of masterdiploma in IT of een wetenschappelijke richting
Minstens 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of een vergelijkbare rol
Sterk in Python met ervaring in (Geo)Pandas, NumPy, Folium, DuckDB, Polars, …
Ervaren in SQL en ETL-processen
Vaardig met BI- tools (Power BI, Tableau, Qlik, Superset) bij voorkeur met geografische data
Ervaring met big data (Hadoop, Spark, Databricks) en cloudplatformen (Azure, GCP, AWS)
Kennis van AI/ML (TensorFlow, Torch, Keras) is een plus
Vloeiend Nederlands en Engels zijn een evidentie




Dit krijg je van ons

In ruil voor je inzet en leergierigheid bieden we je een boeiende job met toffe collega’s. En dat in een bedrijfscultuur die persoonlijke ontwikkeling en vernieuwing sterk aanmoedigt.




Bij Geo Solutions mag je rekenen op:

Een aantrekkelijk salarispakket: een brutoloon (rekening houden met je ervaring en diploma), aangevuld met bedrijfswagen en tankkaart (of laadkaart), maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatie- en groepsverzekering, maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding.
Een gezonde werk-life balans: zo willen wij plezier binnen en buiten de werkuren motivering door flexibele werktijden aan te bieden
Aandacht voor nieuwe ideeën: hier ben je geen nummer, wel een belangrijke aanwinst voor het team. We horen graag hoe jij bepaalde projecten ziet en hoe jij het zou aanpakken
Doorgroeimogelijkheden: we juichen met veel plezier je leergierigheid toe en bieden je toegang tot onze Geo Academy. Wil je graag een extra training volgen, een certificaat behalen of een externe opleiding volgen, dat kan allemaal!
State of the art technologieën: je bouwt ze niet alleen, je werkt er ook mee!




Kan je niet wachten om ons team te versterken? Stuur je cv en een korte motivatie naar jobs@geosolutions.be




Diversiteit, inclusie en gelijkheid

Bij ons draait het om mensen. We willen een plek zijn waar je jezelf kunt zijn, ongeacht wie je bent of hoe je in het leven staat. Verschillen maken ons sterker, en we geloven dat iedereen iets waardevols bijdraagt. Daarom zorgen we ervoor dat je je bij ons gerespecteerd voelt, en dat je met plezier je talenten kunt inzetten.

Show more
