Title: Data Strategist
Description:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Your role as a Data Strategist lies in guiding our clients to become increasingly data-driven. You strive to connect (top) management, data teams and analytical teams with your analytical translation skills. You would build the business case for data & AI use cases and ensure that value creation is top priority in data roadmaps and throughout data projects execution. In addition, you work towards an improved organizational setup around data and install scalable data processes. Moreover, you contribute to creating a data-driven culture where people embrace data and its possibilities. In this role, you will operate with our current clients in rapidly changing environments on a medium to long-term basis or would develop the data strategy of organizations that prioritize their investments in data for the foreseeable future.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:


You have 3 or more years of relevant experiences in data & analytics domain. Strategic or management consulting background is a big plus
You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information and to turn this information into value
You are not necessarily a data scientist by background, but have reasonable high-level knowledge of different data-related domains such as business intelligence, analytics, data science, information management and data infrastructure. This includes understanding of market trends in tooling, data engineering and governance best practices and basic statistical knowledge
You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results
You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
You create easy connections with stakeholders throughout organization
Experience with leading data projects is a plus.
All candidates need very good knowledge of English. Knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus


What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:


A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.


People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe’s leading digital solutions provider. Some of the most successful companies in Europe rely on our technology due to our commitment to innovation, collaboration, and value in business development.

The world is how we shape it. Let’s shape it together.

Job Description

Your role as a Data Strategist lies in guiding our clients to become increasingly data-driven. You strive to connect (top) management, data teams and analytical teams with your analytical translation skills. You would build the business case for data & AI use cases and ensure that value creation is top priority in data roadmaps and throughout data projects execution. In addition, you work towards an improved organizational setup around data and install scalable data processes. Moreover, you contribute to creating a data-driven culture where people embrace data and its possibilities. In this role, you will operate with our current clients in rapidly changing environments on a medium to long-term basis or would develop the data strategy of organizations that prioritize their investments in data for the foreseeable future.

Qualifications

We’re seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you’ll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!

You’ll have knowledge and experience of the following:

  • You have 3 or more years of relevant experiences in data & analytics domain. Strategic or management consulting background is a big plus
  • You understand that organizations today should make the most of the available information and to turn this information into value
  • You are not necessarily a data scientist by background, but have reasonable high-level knowledge of different data-related domains such as business intelligence, analytics, data science, information management and data infrastructure. This includes understanding of market trends in tooling, data engineering and governance best practices and basic statistical knowledge
  • You are motivated by obtaining concrete deliverables and results
  • You want to make a difference for the organizations you work for, and you like to be recognized for your input
  • You create easy connections with stakeholders throughout organization
  • Experience with leading data projects is a plus.
  • All candidates need very good knowledge of English. Knowledge of French or Dutch is a plus

What We Can Offer You

As a member of one of Europe’s largest digital solutions providers, you’ll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you’ll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You’ll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you’ll join our Data & AI team, where we support enterprises and institutions to become more data driven, and assist our clients to increase business efficiency and create impact with data. We offer a complete portfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden organisations in every step of their transition: from defining and executing the data strategy and governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards and applying the latest data science and artificial intelligence methodologies.

Additional Information

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe’s Leading Digital Service Provider.

We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:

  • A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
  • Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
  • The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.

People are the cornerstone of our success. That’s why we aspire to be bolder together. Our goal is to build high-functioning teams and healthy team environments that inspire and help each other to deliver excellence for each of our customers.

Excited about this job opportunity? Ready to shape the world with us? Great! We are looking forward to your application!

______

Sopra Steria is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, ancestry, nationality, color, family or medical leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. We foster a work environment that is inclusive and respectful of all differences.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Company: Clear Edge International Search & Selection Ltd
Description:
BI Analyst

Location: Kyiv, Poland, Czechia, Malta, or Armenia | Hybrid Working Available




Join a fast-growing international gaming and entertainment company as a BI Analyst, where data plays a central role in shaping business strategy and performance. With operations in over 120 countries and more than 20 years of industry expertise, this company is on a mission to provide exceptional, secure betting and gaming experiences worldwide.




About the Role

As a BI Analyst, you’ll work closely with stakeholders across the business to turn complex data into clear insights. You’ll be responsible for delivering powerful dashboards, maintaining high-quality datasets, and helping teams make informed decisions through data-driven recommendations.

This is a hybrid role with flexible location options, including Kyiv, Poland, Czechia, Malta, or Armenia.




Key Responsibilities

Analyze large datasets to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for improvement
Build and maintain dashboards and reports using BI tools like Metabase or Tableau
Translate business needs into effective BI solutions through close stakeholder collaboration
Ensure data quality and consistency across systems
Develop and optimize data workflows and integration pipelines
Track and report on KPIs, offering actionable insights to improve business performance
Contribute to broader analytics projects and support senior team members as needed




Requirements

Degree in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field
2+ years of experience in BI, preferably within iGaming, e-commerce, or digital products
Solid SQL skills and experience working with BI tools such as Tableau or Metabase
Strong understanding of online business metrics (web, CRM, product, financial)
Upper-intermediate English proficiency (spoken and written)
Confident communicator, comfortable presenting findings to technical and non-technical audiences
Able to work both independently and collaboratively in cross-functional teams




What We Value

Analytical Thinking: Ability to extract clear insights from complex data
Attention to Detail: High standards for accuracy and reliability
Collaboration: Team-oriented, proactive communicator
Adaptability: Comfortable working in dynamic, fast-moving environments
Business Awareness: Understanding how data connects to strategy
Proactivity: Willing to take initiative and drive improvements




What’s in It for You

Competitive salary based on experience
Health insurance coverage for you and your family
Upskilling and reskilling programs
Team events and corporate gatherings
4 additional personal days off per year

Title: Regional Data Analyst
Description:
Zoetis Zaventem is currently looking for a Regional Data Analyst.

As the Data Analyst at Zoetis Benelux, Nordics & Ireland, you will be responsible for transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive business growth and innovation for the whole region.

By analysing and interpreting data trends, patterns, and anomalies, you will provide valuable insights and recommendations to stakeholders across the region, enabling data-driven decision-making and strategic planning for the regional Lead and the General Managers.

The Data Analyst plays a crucial role in building comprehensive reports and dashboards that visualize key metrics and performance indicators, empowering stakeholders to monitor progress, identify areas for improvement, and make informed decisions based on real-time data analysis.

Your work will directly contribute to improving processes, optimizing performance, and ultimately enhancing the overall competitiveness and success of Zoetis BNNI region.

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

Data Analysis

Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate key insights and findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and develop analytical solutions to address business challenges.
Conduct ad hoc analysis and research to answer specific business questions and support decision-making.
Stay updated on emerging trends and best practices in data analytics and continuously seek opportunities to improve processes and methodologies.
Translate analytical findings into clear, concise, and actionable recommendations for all stakeholders.

Relationships

Develop mutually beneficial long-term partnerships with local, regional and international teams based on high quality interactions and exceptional provision of service
Implement bespoke solutions for all stakeholders in the region, utilising all available resources and tools
Work effectively at all levels in the teams from Vice President, General Manager to Marketing and Sales Managers.
Contribute to the success of your team by sharing best practice with colleagues across the region and proactively introducing ideas

Compliance

Maintain high standards of business conduct and compliance, adhering particularly to Pharmacovigilance Policy, Global vet Policy, Zoetis values, travel & expenses policy and local codes of practice.

KEY SKILLS

Capability in, or potential to develop

Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, etc.) and the ability to create visually compelling reports and dashboards
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to extract insights from complex datasets and identify actionable recommendations
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively communicate findings to all stakeholders
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy and integrity
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and prioritize tasks effectively in a fast-paced environment
Strong collaborative skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and deliver impactful solutions

BEHAVIOURS

Our Colleagues make the difference

Keep your analytical skills sharp. Train, and retrain
Be an expert on your domain - know them inside and out, and continue to learn
Use the experience from setbacks and failure to drive your future success

Always do the right thing

Sell what you know your stakeholders need; what you know will work for our business
Uphold the highest standards of professionalism, honesty and integrity with the stakeholders
Help build the reputation of our brand by understanding and supporting the things that we stand for

Customer obsessed

Know your stakeholders. Know more than just their names, know their business
Establish effective and lasting relationships with customers that build loyalty to our brand

Run it like you own it

Ground all data quality plans in commercially sound thinking
Make realistic and achievable commitments to stakeholders that work for our business whilst benefiting theirs

We are one Zoetis

Show the stakeholders a united team that speak with one voice
Give the team timely information and support that helps them to deliver their role
Know what's going on around the business and talk about it to your customers

TRAINING & QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related field; advanced degree preferred
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or related role, with a minimum of 5 years of experience

EXPERIENCE

Experience in a commercial industry
Experience in a data analyst role
Professional experiences gained in industries or sectors outside of Animal & Human Health are welcomed

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS

Limited frequency of travel.


About Zoetis

At Zoetis, our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.







Global Job Applicant Privacy Notice

Title: Data Analyst Reporting Automotive
Description:
Fonction




En tant que Data Analyst, vous avez, au sein du département Reporting Automotive, la charge de comparer des données (Clients, Compagnies, Internes), d’analyser et interpréter les résultats afin d’établir des rapports personnalisés pour nos clients ou partenaires. Vous jouez un rôle clé car vous serez garant de la qualité des données et serez souvent amené à travailler avec plusieurs équipes (Sinistres, IT, Production, Clients Manager, Comptabilité)




Vos tâches sont diversifiées:




Vous créez, administrez et modélisez les rapports et vous vous assurez de livrer les données nécessaires selon les deadlines fixées.
Vous avez la charge du traitement, de l’exploitation des données dans notre système interne.
Vous traitez des données provenant de systèmes partenaires (Ubench, Fixico)
Vous aidez à la mise en place des nouveaux process et vous assurez le maintien à jour des process existants
Vous utilisez ou gérez le planning de l’équipe
Vous assurez la livraison des différents jobs opérationnels




Profil




Vous avez obtenu un Bachelier (ou équivalent par expérience).
Vous avez de préférence une première expérience en assurance Automobile.
Vous parlez couramment le français et avez une bonne maitrise du néerlandais. L’anglais est un atout.
Vous maitrisez bien la suite Office et en particulier Excel (Niveau avancé).
Vous connaissez et pouvez utiliser les outils « Power Tools ».
Vous avez un esprit analytique, vous êtes à l'aise avec les chiffres et le traitement des données.
Vous pouvez travailler seul ou en équipe.
Vous êtes organisé(e) et avez une bonne gestion des priorités.




Intéressé(e) ?




Voulez-vous en savoir plus sur Aon et ce poste ? Postulez chez le leader du marché pour un emploi dynamique avec des opportunités d'apprentissage et de croissance ainsi qu'un package salarial compétitif.




-----




Functie




Als Data Analyst binnen de afdeling Reporting Automotive ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergelijken van gegevens (klanten, bedrijven, intern), het analyseren en interpreteren van de resultaten om gepersonaliseerde rapporten op te stellen voor onze klanten of partners. Je speelt een sleutelrol omdat je verantwoordelijk bent voor de kwaliteit van de gegevens en vaak zal samenwerken met verschillende teams (Claims, IT, Productie, Client Manager, Boekhouding).




Je taken zijn gevarieerd:




Je maakt, beheert en modelleert rapporten en zorgt ervoor dat de benodigde gegevens volgens de vastgestelde deadlines worden geleverd.
Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de verwerking en exploitatie van gegevens in ons interne systeem.
Je verwerkt gegevens afkomstig van partnersystemen (Ubench, Fixico).
Je helpt bij het implementeren van nieuwe processen en zorgt voor het up-to-date houden van bestaande processen.
Je gebruikt of beheert de planning van het team.
Je zorgt voor de levering van verschillende operationele taken.




Profiel




Je hebt een Bachelor diploma (of gelijkwaardig door ervaring).
Je hebt idealiter een eerste ervaring in autoverzekeringen.
Je spreekt vloeiend Frans of Nederlands en hebt een goede beheersing van de tweede taal. Engels is een pluspunt.
Je beheerst de Office-suite goed, vooral Excel (gevorderd niveau).
Je kent en kunt de "Power Tools" gebruiken.
Je hebt een analytische geest, bent goed met cijfers en gegevensverwerking.
Je kan zelfstandig of in teamverband werken.
Je bent georganiseerd en je kan goed je prioriteiten stellen.




Interesse?




Wil je meer weten over Aon en deze vacature? Solliciteer bij de marktleider naar een dynamische baan met leer-en groeimogelijkheden en een competitief salarispakket.







2559877

Title: Sales Data Analyst (m/f/*)
Description:
Job Description

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch®, Scotch Blue™, Command™, Scotch-Brite™, Post-it®, 3M, Futuro™, Nexcare™, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Here, You Will Make An Impact By



Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.
Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.
Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.
Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.



Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:



Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.



Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:



Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.



Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page.



At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. If you want to discover more about D&I at 3M, please visit http://go.3M.com/4i9C



At 3M, we believe diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race/ethnicity, nationality, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy/maternity-related matters, age or disability, or any other relevant characteristic protected under applicable local law.

Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.

3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement

Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application, you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.
Show more
HTML:
Job Description

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World

Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with curious, creative 3Mers.

The Impact You’ll Make in this Role

As a Business Analyst, you will be part of the Consumer Business Group, responsible for the commercialization of worldwide leading brands including Scotch®, Scotch Blue™, Command™, Scotch-Brite™, Post-it®, 3M, Futuro™, Nexcare™, among others and you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world.

Here, You Will Make An Impact By


  • Determining Advanced Analysis and Insight Generation: Leveraging retailers and distributors' point of sales (POS) data, syndicated data, and shopper data to generate actionable insights.
  • Driving POS Growth and Mitigating Declines: Utilize your analytical expertise to develop strategies that enhance POS growth, while identifying and addressing potential declines through effective category management.
  • Playing a pivotal role in executing category management strategies. This involves deep dives into category performance, identifying growth opportunities, optimizing product assortment, and providing guidance on pricing and promotional strategies.
  • Influencing Partnership with Key Accounts: Build and maintain strong relationships with retailer/distributor key accounts within EMEA, influencing decision-making through data-driven insights and category management expertise.
  • Collaborating with all business analysts to implement Consumer Business Group global analytic strategies and tactics, ensuring alignment with overall business objectives.


Your Skills And Expertise

To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M is looking for candidates who must have the following qualifications:


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree or higher from an accredited institution preferably in Business, Economics, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field.
  • Expert Experience in business analytics or a related relevant customer market with a preference for experience in the FMCG industry.
  • Category Management demonstrated expertise and data-driven decision making.
  • Language Proficiency: Fluent in French AND English is a must
  • Communication Skills: Excellent storytelling and presentation skills, capable of translating complex data into actionable insights. Proficiency in presenting to clients.


Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:


  • Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and data interpretation skills, with proficiency in Microsoft Power BI.
  • Technical Proficiency: Familiarity with planogramming software (e.g., JDA Space Planner), and an understanding of data modeling techniques.
  • Leadership Qualities: Proven leadership skills with the ability to influence key stakeholders and drive implementation of strategic initiatives.


Supporting Your Well-being

3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.

Resources for You

For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers. If you have further questions please reach out to Max (our AI Virtual Assistant) via our Career Page.


  • At 3M, diversity & inclusion are essential to innovation. We seek and value differences in people! This Job ad is addressed to all potential candidates. As an equal opportunity employer 3M will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability. If you want to discover more about D&I at 3M, please visit http://go.3M.com/4i9C

Title: Power BI Specialist
Description:
Who are we?

CFE is a multidisciplinary group (listed on Euronext Brussels) active in Belgium, Luxembourg and Poland in 4 businesses segments with high growth potential because they have the opportunity to shape the world of tomorrow:

Real Estate Development
Multitechnical
Construction & Renovation
Sustainable Investments

With more than 3100 employees and a long experience and expertise acquired since its foundation in 1880, the CFE Group aims to challenge the status quo and create positive change by successfully addressing environmental and social challenges for the well-being of future generations. The CFE Group achieves this ambition by placing sustainability, innovation and respect for employees at the heart of its strategy and by offering its customers end-to-end solutions.




Your Role & Responsabilities

Promote and integrate dashboards: Take an active role in the promotion, definition, and introduction of various dashboards to make data a strategic part of the organization's activities.
Create and maintain dashboards: Use your technical expertise to design and maintain dashboards based on data from different sources.
Translate business needs: Collaborate with business partners to define and translate their requirements into user-friendly dashboards and reports.
Coordinate with stakeholders: Guide internal and external partners in developing necessary interfaces, extractors, and reports.
Dashboard governance: Establish reporting governance to ensure dashboards are consistent in design, methodology, and use a "single version of the truth."
Train and support users: Empower key users with training and support to help them become self-sufficient in creating and maintaining dashboards and reports.
Lead projects and initiatives: Oversee projects, initiatives, and tasks related to reporting, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget.
Documentation and reporting: Keep functional and technical documentation up-to-date and report regularly on project progress to stakeholders.
Risk management: Identify and proactively escalate issues, risks, and concerns when necessary.
Standardization and optimization: Stay informed about industry best practices and propose functional improvements and standardizations.
Manage external consultants: Supervise external consultants assigned to your projects, initiatives, and tasks.
Provide technical assistance: Offer support to end users when required, while promoting standard application setups.




Your Profile

You hold a bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
You have at least 5 years of experience in reporting and dashboarding, as well as 3 years of project management experience in a complex organization.
You are an expert in Power BI, with solid expertise in Power Automate, Power Apps, MS SQL, MS SharePoint, and MS Dataverse, along with knowledge of ETL processes. Familiarity with tools such as Tableau, Qlik Sense, IBM Cognos, SAS BI, and Google Data is a plus.
You have high-level knowledge of industry best practices.
You are fluent in Dutch, French, and English, enabling seamless communication across diverse teams.
You demonstrate strong technical expertise in data modeling, ITIL frameworks, and technical design, with a focus on delivering actionable insights and impactful solutions.
You excel in problem-solving and analytical thinking, tackling challenges effectively while maintaining a strategic perspective.
You possess excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills, facilitating collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
You are proactive, accountable, and detail-oriented, with a focus on achieving results and driving productivity.
You thrive in a team environment while being able to work autonomously, encouraging collaboration and knowledge sharing.
You stay updated on emerging technological trends and demonstrate a passion for innovation and self-development.




What’s in it for you?

Come as You Are: At CFE, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. Our company culture embraces and celebrates individuality, fostering a workplace that is completely free from any form of harassment, bias, or discrimination. We encourage all qualified applicants, regardless of gender, to apply.




What We Offer: Besides great colleagues and a fantastic new wooden HQ in Brussels, you will be offered a competitive compensation & benefits package including:

A full-time position with the possibility of hybrid working and the ability to flex your hours as you need.
An attractive remuneration package with many advantages such as a competitive base pay, a range of extralegal benefits as: sustainable transport options (mobility budget or lease car), lunch vouchers, a pension savings scheme and affiliation at a hospitalization insurance plan.
Opportunities for professional growth and development in various areas.
A collaborative and supportive team culture.
A challenging and dynamic work environment.

Show more

  • A full-time position with the possibility of hybrid working and the ability to flex your hours as you need.
  • An attractive remuneration package with many advantages such as a competitive base pay, a range of extralegal benefits as: sustainable transport options (mobility budget or lease car), lunch vouchers, a pension savings scheme and affiliation at a hospitalization insurance plan.

  • A collaborative and supportive team culture.
  • A challenging and dynamic work environment.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Company: Hôpital Universitaire de Bruxelles (H.U.B) - Academisch Ziekenhuis Brussel (H.U.B)
Description:
À propos de l'entreprise




La société L’Hôpital Universitaire de Bruxelles (H.U.B) regroupe l’Hôpital Académique Erasme, l’Institut Jules Bordet et l’Hôpital Universitaire des Enfants Reine Fabiola (HUDERF). Créé en 2021 à l’initiative de la Ville de Bruxelles et de l’Université Libre de Bruxelles (ULB), ce grand pôle hospitalier universitaire garantit à la fois des soins de santé de haute qualité et accessibles à tous ainsi que l’excellence dans la formation et la recherche.




L'H.U.B compte 1.420 lits d’hospitalisation et plus de 6.000 membres du personnel, dont 841 ETP médecins et 3.975 ETP non médicaux. L'institution a pour ambition d’offrir à l’ensemble de ses équipes un cadre de travail épanouissant et attractif, avec des possibilités de formation et d’évolution professionnelle, tout en garantissant la pérennité et donc la viabilité financière de l’ensemble.




À propos du rôle




Afin de renforcer l’équipe Business Intelligence Business Center de l’H.U.B, nous recherchons un(e) Business Intelligence Business Analyst pour jouer un rôle clé dans l’analyse et la gestion de projets BI et data en vue de soutenir la stratégie et répondre aux objectifs de de l’institution.




Vous serez l’intermédiaire essentiel entre les unités opérationnelles, la direction de l’institution et les BI Engineers du Département des Systèmes d’Information, afin de traduire les besoins métiers en solutions BI concrètes ; solutions de modélisation, d’analyse et de visualisation de données.




Sous la responsabilité du coordinateur Business Intelligence Competence Center (BICC), vos principales missions seront de :

Analyser les besoins métiers : Travailler avec les parties prenantes pour recueillir les besoins en matière de données et traduire ces exigences en spécifications fonctionnelles et techniques pour les solutions BI.
Gestion de projets BI et data : Piloter les projets de données (récolte, analyse, qualité), de la définition des besoins à la mise en place des solutions, en assurant la coordination entre les équipes métiers, IT et techniques.
Optimiser les processus de données : Identifier des opportunités d’amélioration pour la collecte, l’analyse et la gestion des données, et proposer des recommandations pour améliorer la prise de décision.
Développement et gestion des outils BI : Élaborer des rapports, tableaux de bord et autres outils d’aide à la décision, permettant aux responsables de départements et aux analystes terrain de prendre des décisions éclairées.
Suivi de la qualité des données : Garantir la cohérence et la qualité des données et des rapports produits, en assurant une documentation claire et précise.




Responsabilités




Recueil des besoins métiers : Collaborer avec les parties prenantes pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et recueillir les spécifications nécessaires au développement de solutions BI.
Coordination de projets BI : Élaborer les plannings de projet, structurer les étapes clés, et assurer la bonne coordination entre les équipes métiers, IT et techniques.
Analyse des processus opérationnels : Identifier et analyser les opportunités d'amélioration des processus opérationnels à travers l'exploitation des données.
Création et gestion des outils BI : Créer des rapports visuels, des tableaux de bord et des outils d’analyse permettant de soutenir la stratégie de l’institution.
Formation et accompagnement des utilisateurs : Former les utilisateurs à l’utilisation des outils BI et à l’interprétation des données, en garantissant une prise en main optimale des solutions développées.
Suivi des KPIs : Mettre en place des mécanismes de suivi automatique des indicateurs clés liés à la qualité, la performance et d’autres critères stratégiques.




Votre Profil




Master (ou équivalent par expérience) en économie, sciences de gestion, informatique, data science ou un domaine connexe
Expérience professionnelle significative en Business Intelligence ou dans un rôle similaire.
Maîtrise des outils BI : Connaissances approfondies des outils et technologies BI (Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, etc.).
Compétences en analyse de données : Expertise dans l’utilisation du langage SQL et dans les techniques d’analyse des données.
Gestion des processus et des projets : Connaissance des processus métiers, ainsi que des outils et pratiques de gestion de projet.
Excellentes capacités interpersonnelles : Solides compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles, permettant d’interagir efficacement avec les directeurs de département, les utilisateurs professionnels et les équipes techniques.
Compétences analytiques : Capacité à analyser des données complexes et à proposer des solutions pratiques pour résoudre des problématiques métiers.
Vision technique : Forte capacité à aborder les problématiques avec une vision technique globale et à traduire les exigences du business en spécifications techniques.




Notre Offre




Dans le contexte d’un groupement hospitalier de grande envergure, nous vous proposons une fonction possédant un champ de responsabilités variées, l’accès à des techniques innovantes et un travail au sein d’équipes pluridisciplinaires.

Un contrat temps plein à durée indéterminée.
Une rémunération attractive, assortie d’avantages extra-légaux (chèques repas, assurance de groupe, tarifs préférentiels en matière de soins de santé, jours de congés extra-légaux).
L’hôpital est facilement accessible en métro avec un remboursement partiel des frais de transport, et le parking est gratuit.
Crèche à proximité.




Intéressé(e) ?

Veuillez déposer votre curriculum vitae et lettre de motivation via notre formulaire en ligne.

Votre Profil

  • Gestion des processus et des projets : Connaissance des processus métiers, ainsi que des outils et pratiques de gestion de projet.
  • Excellentes capacités interpersonnelles : Solides compétences en communication et en relations interpersonnelles, permettant d’interagir efficacement avec les directeurs de département, les utilisateurs professionnels et les équipes techniques.
  • Compétences analytiques : Capacité à analyser des données complexes et à proposer des solutions pratiques pour résoudre des problématiques métiers.

Dans le contexte d’un groupement hospitalier de grande envergure, nous vous proposons une fonction possédant un champ de responsabilités variées, l’accès à des techniques innovantes et un travail au sein d’équipes pluridisciplinaires.

  • Un contrat temps plein à durée indéterminée.
  • Une rémunération attractive, assortie d’avantages extra-légaux (chèques repas, assurance de groupe, tarifs préférentiels en matière de soins de santé, jours de congés extra-légaux).

Title: Data Analyst Confirmé (H/F)
Description:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui


Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous


Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :


Comprendre les problématiques métier,
Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises


PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :


Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.


PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT


Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence


Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

LES PETITS PLUS

Show more
HTML:
Vous souhaitez rejoindre une entreprise qui place l’humain au cœur de ses préoccupations ? On vous attend chez Extia !

Société de conseil spécialisée dans les métiers de l’IT et du digital, Extia privilégie depuis sa création en 2007 une approche qui allie performance et bien-être au travail. Une vision de l’entreprise partagée aujourd’hui par plus de 2 500 Extiens en France et à l'international et récompensée par le label Great Place to Work® depuis 13 ans !

Nous croyons en l'égalité des chances et nous offrons à chaque candidat la possibilité de révéler son potentiel, sans distinction et de quelque nature qu'elle soit. Chez Extia, c’est « D’abord qui, ensuite quoi » alors, allons-y !

D'abord qui

  • Créatif, vous avez toujours une solution inédite mais adéquate à proposer
  • Curieux, poser des questions est votre seconde nature
  • Analytique, vous avez une âme d’enquêteur et les énigmes n’ont aucun secret pour vous

Ensuite quoi

Description Du Poste

Vous serez intégré(e) dans une équipe de consultants innovants et motivés, composée de Business Analysts, Data Scientists et Data Engineers spécialisés sur les problématiques Data Analytics. À ce titre, vous interviendrez de façon opérationnelle sur des missions de conseil autour des sujets de transformation Data Analytics, de retraitement et modélisation de données et de représentation visuelle de la donnée pour adresser des problématiques métiers.

Vous serez notamment en charge de :

  • Comprendre les problématiques métier,
  • Collecter et traiter les données en vue de l'analyse, incluant notamment la création de variables agrégées et complémentaires aux données brutes,
  • Automatiser et d’industrialiser les retraitements effectués sur les données,
  • Représenter les résultats dans un outil de restitution visuelle de façon ergonomique et intuitive,
  • Restituer les analyses au client notamment pas la création d’indicateurs pertinents pour les questions stratégiques des entreprises

PROFIL RECHERCHE

Diplômé d'une école d'ingénieurs ou équivalent (Bac +5), vous justifiez d’a minima 2 ans d’expérience réussis en tant que data analyst :

  • Vous possédez une bonne connaissance des outils et méthodologies de Data Analytics, incluant notamment des bases techniques (modèles de données, langage SQL, …) mais également méthodologiques,
  • Vous possédez une connaissance approfondie d'Excel et maitrisez les langages statistiques tels que R, Python ou SAS,
  • Une connaissance d'un logiciel ou langage dédié à la Data Visualization (Tableau, Qliksense ou Qlickview, Microsoft Power BI…) ainsi que des compétences en automatisation (VBA par exemple) seraient un plus.

PROCESSUS DE RECRUTEMENT

  • Échangez avec un ou une chargée de recrutement pour un premier contact téléphonique
  • Rencontrez un ou une Ingénieure d’Affaires (Business Manager) sur vos souhaits d’évolution
  • Approfondissez avec nos responsables et directeurs d’agence pour connaître la vision de l'agence

Selon votre profil, des tests ou entretiens techniques pourront vous être demandés. Tout au long du processus, vous pourrez échanger avec nos consultants pour en savoir + sur leur quotidien chez nous !

PACKAGE SALARIAL

Chez Extia Belgique IT, la transparence fait partie intégrante de l'expérience positive, voici un aperçu des éléments de package salarial dont peuvent profiter nos collaborateurs, sous réserve d'éligibilité

👛 Voiture de société ou budget mobilité ✨ Chèques repas & Ecocheque 🎁 Assurance groupe 🎉 Frais de représentation 📈 Plan cafétéria / Flex Income Plan 🚀 Primes d'apport d'affaire, de cooptation et de formation 🌍 20 jours de congés légaux + 12 jours de récupération

Ces informations sont communiquées à titre indicatif et seront abordées plus en détails lors du processus de recrutement.

Title: Junior Clinical Data Analyst (BE)
Description:
CluePoints is an innovative, fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Monitoring and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products enable both risk planning and operational risk monitoring, and utilize advanced statistical algorithms to determine the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. CluePoints is seeking outstanding candidates with strong data analytics aptitude and a passion for delivery excellence, to help drive customer success and broad adoption of the CluePoints solution.




Responsibilities:

Perform the technical configuration of the CluePoints solution for clinical studies based on customer requirements
Perform analyses using the CluePoints Central Monitoring Platform – diagnosing and explaining anomalies identified in the clinical study data
Summarize findings and support the communication of results to customers (both written report and oral presentation)
Participate in the continuous improvement and development of our product solutions and operational processes
Provide consultation and related operational support to customers as needed, with the help of more senior Data Analysts and/or the CluePoints Project Lead
Ensure that appropriate documentation is produced and maintained for each study
Assist Business Development and Quality Assurance teams in responding to client questions and requests (e.g., RFP responses, audits, etc.)




Qualifications:

College degree, preferably in a scientific or technical discipline
0-2 years of experience in a clinical research environment.
Experience with one or more programming languages (preferably SAS)
At least one first experience in clinical trials (data management or CRA)
Aptitude for mathematical and statistical concepts
Excellent English oral and written communication skills
Experience and ability to work well in a team environment
Ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment, under time and resource constraints
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Experience with CDISC databases is a plus













Top Reasons to Work with Us

Flexibility is part of our DNA

Hybrid role (2-3 days per week at the office)
Our offices provide a fun atmosphere: PS4, foosball, and our newly added dartboard
Many activities are organized during the year such as team lunches, happy hours, team buildings, holiday parties and many other celebrations!
At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you’ll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You’ll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You’ll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards.
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits !

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Freelance Senior Data Analyst (7+ Years)




Location: Brussels (Hybrid)

Duration: 18-Month Contract

Industry: Technology

Start Date: ASAP / Flexible




About the Opportunity

We are looking for a Freelance Senior Data Analyst to support our data-driven transformation. Based in Brussels, our technology company is growing fast, and data is at the heart of every strategic decision. This freelance role offers the freedom of flexible work, combined with the opportunity to influence real business outcomes from day one.




As part of a cross-functional initiative to improve user retention, you’ll analyse behavioural data across the platform to identify key drop-off points, usage trends, and content engagement levels. Your work will help shape a new data model to better predict churn and inform the roadmap for personalized user journeys. You'll collaborate with product managers and customer success teams to turn these insights into concrete feature updates and communication strategies.




Responsibilities

Partner with teams across Product, Marketing, and Engineering to define metrics, track performance, and identify areas for improvement
Build and maintain dashboards and reports to enable stakeholders to make informed, data-backed decisions
Lead deep-dive analyses on customer behaviour, product performance, and operational efficiency
Develop predictive models and clustering techniques to support business forecasting and segmentation
Support data governance efforts and contribute to best practices in data quality, accessibility, and documentation
Present insights and strategic recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences




Qualifications

7+ years of experience in data analysis, ideally in a fast-paced tech environment
Strong skills in SQL and Python or R, with a solid understanding of statistical methods
Proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Looker
Experience with cloud-based data environments (BigQuery, Snowflake, AWS, or Azure)
Excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive, analytical mindset
Strong communication skills in English; knowledge of Dutch or French is a plus

Title: Data analyst Qliksense (Freelance)
Description:
As data analytics & reporting specialist you will be the connection between strategy, business and technology. As such were looking for talent who can structure requests associated with overarching projects. Facilitate where needed the translation of business requirements through mock ups and design thinking. You will focus on creating reports from these inputs and collaborates with stakeholders to derive data insight through analysis as they continue to drive adoption.

The role balances coordinating, analysing and execution subject to the experience level of the hire. You will work closely with various business units and transversal strategic initiatives.

Key responsibilities;


Be a catalyst to structure BI-processes in collaboration with the BI manager.
Ensure our data products and reports are properly documented.
Facilitate the application of ITIL and SDLC processes with a key focus on practical real world application.
Collect, analyse and advise on business requirements
Build prototypes, reports & dashboards in Qlik.
Create clear story lines for insight throughout our reporting portfolio.
Analyse data sets and contribute to the improvement of data quality across the organisation.
Test data, reports and dashboards as a means to driving trust in our products.
Facilitate the adoption of reporting products.



Practical information:


Minimum 1 day / week onsite to work with business partners is expected.
Multiple locations are applicable for the role; Brussel, Gent, Leuven amongst which youll alternate. Brussel being the main office.
Dutch or French is required, English is the working language.
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical profiles.
High affinity with agile principles is a plus.
Work well in dynamic team structure with many different sources of work.



Key differentiator: youre pro-active and like to take initiative whilst reporting back on your learnings.

Title: Senior Analyst Report
Description:
The Role

We are looking for a Senior Analyst – Reporting to provide analytical support and ensure accurate, high-quality reporting to meet business needs. This role involves interpreting complex data, optimizing data quality, and delivering insightful reports while ensuring compliance with governance standards. You will work closely with stakeholders to refine reporting requirements and drive automation initiatives.

Key Responsibilities


Produce and manage detailed reports, ensuring data accuracy and timely distribution.
Communicate reporting needs, clarify requests, and validate results with stakeholders.
Standardize reports and oversee automation processes in line with company standards.
Identify and resolve data inconsistencies, optimizing data quality and integrity.
Analyze trends, detect recurring issues, and propose process improvements.
Develop complex calculations and simulation models for in-depth data analysis.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal guidelines.
Prioritize internal reporting needs and oversee functional validation (UAT) of reports.
Provide support in creating user guides and educating stakeholders on governance rules.


What You Bring


Education: Bachelor's or Master’s degree.
Experience: At least 3 years in reporting, data analysis, or business intelligence.
Languages: Strong proficiency in English and a second national language.


Technical Skills


Advanced data processing and analysis capabilities.
Strong understanding of business data and operational challenges.
Proficiency in Power BI, SQL, and office applications.
Knowledge of project management principles.


Why Join Us?


Be part of a dynamic team driving data-driven decision-making.
Work on impactful projects that improve reporting efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.


If you have a passion for data, reporting, and process optimization, we’d love to hear from you!

#Analyst #reporting #LandmarkGlobal #bpostgroup

Title: Power BI Expert
Description:
Are you a Power BI Expert with at least 5 years of professional experience?




Then this would be a great opportunity for you to join an international and multicultural company like Synechron. We are a global consulting and technology organization providing innovative solutions to the financial services industry.




In order to pursue our growth in Luxembourg, we are looking for a new talent:




Power BI Expert




What would be your mission?

As Power BI Expert, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining interactive dashboards and reports. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in Power BI, and the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights. You will work as a Power BI Expert within the Cash development team.




What would be your tasks?

Migrating the data from the CashSSP datawarehouse to the cloud.
Converting a large number of static PDF reports (SAP BO) into Power BI reports that meet the same business requirements.
This new data warehouse will be leveraged by 12 European countries, making it a crucial tool for strategic decision-making and operational efficiency.
Coaching & Mentoring
Data Modeling & Report Development: Designing, implementing, and maintaining robust semantic models to support scalable, performant, consistent reporting — including support for self-service analytics by business users; Developing and optimizing Power BI reports and dashboards that deliver clear insights aligned with business requirements.
Collaborating with stakeholders to ensure the alignment of technical solutions with business objectives.




What kind of profile are we looking for?

At least 5 years of experience as a Power BI Expert in a complex, enterprise environment
Expertise in DAX, Power Query, and Power BI Desktop/Service
Solid experience in data modeling, data transformation, and data integration
Ability to design semantic layers that ensure data consistency and performance
Knowledge of Row-Level Security (RLS) implementation in a multi-country, multi-user environment
Understanding of different data connectivity modes (Import, DirectQuery, Live Connection) and when to use them
Experience with Power BI deployment pipelines, workspace structuring, and lifecycle management
Strong understanding of data visualization best practices, including layout, user experience, and accessibility
Ability to translate business requirements into impactful dashboards and visuals
Strong communication and mentoring skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences
Team-oriented mindset and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams
Fluency in English and French




An asset:

Power BI certification
Experience in creating paginated reports
Familiarity with Azure or other cloud platforms
Knowledge of SAP BO to analyze existing reports
Experience working directly with business stakeholders to gather and refine reporting needs




Why join Synechron?

We are always looking for new talents, ready to immerse themselves in challenging projects with continuous learning opportunities.

We are offering you:

- A specialization in Finance: we can assist you in planning your career and offer all the necessary training and opportunities for development. (IT, Finance, coaching, personal development).

- We customize your training to fit your career path!

- An international presence: we encourage your mobility projects within our subsidiaries.

- Careful selection and support of our consultants: we engage in duration.

- A true spirit of conviviality in a dynamic and collaborative environment punctuated by regular events.

- An attractive salary package including a fixed and variable compensation as well as extra-legal advantages.

Title: V.I.E -Junior Marketing Data & AI analyst
Description:
Nous recherchons un profil junior curieux, motivé et doté d'un bon esprit analytique pour rejoindre l'équipe Operationnal Marketing en étroite collaboration avec le directeur du département. Dans ce rôle, vous contribuerez à la création de tableaux de bord pertinents, à l'exploitation des données issues de notre CRM et de nos canaux digitaux, et à l'exploration de l'apport de l'intelligence artificielle pour améliorer la performance marketing.

Ce poste s'adresse à un(e) jeune diplômé(e) maîtrisant Excel, ayant une bonne compréhension de Power BI (ou désireux(se) d'apprendre), et capable de comprendre des systèmes complexes. Vous évoluerez dans un environnement basé sur les outils Microsoft et collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes média, CRM et digitales. Au quotidien, vous travaillerez avec les équipes du département Operationnal Marketing avec l'agence locale et les équipes marketing des marques pour optimiser les insights générés par nos campagnes de communication. Tout cela avec l'ambition d'impacter le business, d'augmenter la part de marché, d'améliorer la satisfaction des clients, d'accroître la rentabilité des marques et de suivre la transition énergétique.

Plus précisément, voici les différentes missions qui vous seront confiées :


Participer à la création et à l'évolution de tableaux de bord (principalement dans Power BI) pour suivre les indicateurs marketing et business.
Collecter, structurer et analyser les données provenant des systèmes CRM, des sites web, des outils marketing et des rapports de l'agence.
Réaliser des analyses de données afin d'identifier des tendances, des insights et des opportunités d'optimisation.
Tester et explorer des outils d'IA susceptibles de soutenir l'automatisation, la segmentation ou la personnalisation.
Soutenir les équipes internes en traduisant les données en actions concrètes.
Contribuer à la documentation et à la compréhension des flux de données et des systèmes complexes.
Servir de lien entre les équipes centrales de Stellantis pour amener des best practices à la filiale Belux


Profil


Diplômé(e) récemment d'un master en marketing, business, statistiques, data ou discipline apparentée.
Maîtrise avancée de Microsoft Excel (formules complexes, tableaux croisés dynamiques, etc.).
Connaissances de base en Power BI ou volonté affirmée d'apprendre rapidement.
Esprit analytique structuré et orientation solution.
Capacité à comprendre des écosystèmes marketing & data complexes.
Curiosité, proactivité et envie d'évoluer dans un environnement marketing orienté data.
Excellent. communicante


Compétences bonus (non obligatoires)


Stage ou projet académique dans un rôle lié à la data, au CRM ou à la performance marketing.
Familiarité avec Microsoft Dynamics, HubSpot ou d'autres outils CRM.
Intérêt pour l'usage de l'IA en marketing (outils GPT, scoring prédictif, moteurs de personnalisation…).


Compétences Techniques

Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point…). Très bonnes connaissances en Excel


Maîtrise orale et écrite de FR + ENG


Chez Stellantis, nous évaluons les candidats selon leurs qualifications, leurs mérites et les besoins du métier. Nous accueillons les candidatures des personnes de tout genre, âge, ethnie, nationalité, religion, orientation sexuelle, et handicap. La diversité de nos équipes nous permettra de mieux appréhender l'évolution des besoins de nos clients et de notre environnement futur.

Durée du contrat

24 mois

Poste à pourvoir le

01/03/2025

HTML:
Nous recherchons un profil junior curieux, motivé et doté d'un bon esprit analytique pour rejoindre l'équipe Operationnal Marketing en étroite collaboration avec le directeur du département. Dans ce rôle, vous contribuerez à la création de tableaux de bord pertinents, à l'exploitation des données issues de notre CRM et de nos canaux digitaux, et à l'exploration de l'apport de l'intelligence artificielle pour améliorer la performance marketing.

Ce poste s'adresse à un(e) jeune diplômé(e) maîtrisant Excel, ayant une bonne compréhension de Power BI (ou désireux(se) d'apprendre), et capable de comprendre des systèmes complexes. Vous évoluerez dans un environnement basé sur les outils Microsoft et collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes média, CRM et digitales. Au quotidien, vous travaillerez avec les équipes du département Operationnal Marketing avec l'agence locale et les équipes marketing des marques pour optimiser les insights générés par nos campagnes de communication. Tout cela avec l'ambition d'impacter le business, d'augmenter la part de marché, d'améliorer la satisfaction des clients, d'accroître la rentabilité des marques et de suivre la transition énergétique.

Plus précisément, voici les différentes missions qui vous seront confiées :

  • Participer à la création et à l'évolution de tableaux de bord (principalement dans Power BI) pour suivre les indicateurs marketing et business.
  • Collecter, structurer et analyser les données provenant des systèmes CRM, des sites web, des outils marketing et des rapports de l'agence.
  • Réaliser des analyses de données afin d'identifier des tendances, des insights et des opportunités d'optimisation.
  • Tester et explorer des outils d'IA susceptibles de soutenir l'automatisation, la segmentation ou la personnalisation.
  • Soutenir les équipes internes en traduisant les données en actions concrètes.
  • Contribuer à la documentation et à la compréhension des flux de données et des systèmes complexes.
  • Servir de lien entre les équipes centrales de Stellantis pour amener des best practices à la filiale Belux

Profil

  • Diplômé(e) récemment d'un master en marketing, business, statistiques, data ou discipline apparentée.
  • Maîtrise avancée de Microsoft Excel (formules complexes, tableaux croisés dynamiques, etc.).
  • Connaissances de base en Power BI ou volonté affirmée d'apprendre rapidement.
  • Esprit analytique structuré et orientation solution.
  • Capacité à comprendre des écosystèmes marketing & data complexes.
  • Curiosité, proactivité et envie d'évoluer dans un environnement marketing orienté data.
  • Excellent. communicante

Compétences bonus (non obligatoires)

  • Stage ou projet académique dans un rôle lié à la data, au CRM ou à la performance marketing.
  • Familiarité avec Microsoft Dynamics, HubSpot ou d'autres outils CRM.
  • Intérêt pour l'usage de l'IA en marketing (outils GPT, scoring prédictif, moteurs de personnalisation…).

Compétences Techniques

Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point…). Très bonnes connaissances en Excel

  • Maîtrise orale et écrite de FR + ENG

Chez Stellantis, nous évaluons les candidats selon leurs qualifications, leurs mérites et les besoins du métier. Nous accueillons les candidatures des personnes de tout genre, âge, ethnie, nationalité, religion, orientation sexuelle, et handicap. La diversité de nos équipes nous permettra de mieux appréhender l'évolution des besoins de nos clients et de notre environnement futur.

Durée du contrat

24 mois

Diverse teams will allow us to better meet the evolving needs of our customers and care for our future.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Title: Freelance Data Engineer

Location: Belgium (Remote/Hybrid)

Contract Type: Freelance

Languages Required: Fluent in French or Dutch (English is a plus)




Role Overview

Our client, a leading organization based in Belgium, is looking for an experienced Freelance Data Engineer to design, build, and optimize data pipelines and infrastructure. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with modern data platforms and tools, and be fluent in French or Dutch to effectively collaborate with local teams.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and maintain scalable ETL/ELT pipelines to support analytics and data-driven applications.
Build and optimize data architecture for ingestion, processing, and storage of large-scale datasets.
Collaborate with data architects, analysts, and business stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
Implement and monitor data quality, security, and compliance (including GDPR).
Work with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) to manage infrastructure and deployment.
Document data flows, architecture, and operational procedures.




Required Skills and Experience

3+ years of experience in a Data Engineering role.
Strong programming skills in Python, Scala, or Java.
Solid experience with ETL tools (e.g., Apache Airflow, dbt, Talend).
Proficiency with SQL and relational/non-relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Snowflake, MongoDB).
Experience working with cloud environments and data services (AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory, GCP Dataflow, etc.).
Understanding of data governance, data quality, and security standards.
Fluent in French or Dutch; good knowledge of English is a plus.




Nice to Have

Experience with streaming data technologies (e.g., Apache Kafka, Spark Streaming).
Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Familiarity with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker).
Prior work experience with Belgian or EU clients.
