Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quantitative analyst

About US (GEMS):

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales (GEMS) provides energy supply solutions and risk management services to support its clients through their decarbonization journey, while optimizing ENGIE’s assets and contributing to value creation.

ENGIE is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services with a leading energy management business, piloted by its entity "Global Energy Management & Sales" who built its savoir-faire managing the Group’s large and diverse asset portfolio over 20+ years.

3,600 employees around the world develop our solutions, through +20 international business platforms. We cover the full energy mix: renewable and thermal power, natural gas & LNG, biomass, environmental products. Our experts provide tailor made solutions based on a wide range of savoir-faire in energy management with a strong focus on decarbonation and decentralization.

Our 190,000 clients span the entire value chain: producers, asset developers, financial players, utilities, distributors and industrials. Our global reach and strong local presence enable us to offer these diverse clients tailor-made services and respond to rapid changes in mature or emerging markets alike.

Our 4 areas of expertise :


Asset management
Energy transition services
Energy supply & global commodities
Risk management & market access


At GEMS we encourage breakthrough results, team spirit, curiosity and innovation while preserving the right work/life balance for you.

More info on GEMS Hub ( https://gems.engie.com ) or LinkedIn ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/engie-global-energy-management-solutions ).

Context: The Expertise Center (EC) Quantitative Research and Modeling (QRM) within GEMS is a team of around 40 quantitative analysts. It’s mission is to provide advanced quantitative expertise to all Business Platforms (BP) of GEMS. The quantitative analyst will be part of the “Power & Emissions” quant team (approximately 10 people) and will be supporting the different local business platforms, with a focus on the US Business Platform located in Houston. Role:

The quantitative analyst should design and provide robust quantitative tools that have a concrete impact on the power business:


Work very closely with the BP US, mainly with the Renewable and Batteries Trading teams. He / She needs to understand their business needs, and needs to provide them with high-quality quantitative support in their day to day activities.
Participate in enhancing the existing pricing and managing framework.
Deliver ad hoc tactical solutions as well as develop new pricers in the official pricing library.
Play a key role for developing new products, linked for example to the renewable and battery business (pricing, managing strategies, various risk indicators, …).
Promote best coding practices that comply with general rules and standards.
Document and share knowledge across GEMS on the different models used within GEMS.


Hard skills:


Must have:

Strong Financial Mathematical background (probability, stochastic calculus, various numerical methods such as Monte Carlo, finite differences, …)
Experience on different optimization methods
Strong coding experience (preferably C# and python), object oriented programming skills
Experience in a trading environment
Familiar with Git




Good to have:

Experience on the power markets

Soft skills:


Must have:

Practical and conceptual thinking
Ability to explain and convey messages about complex issues
Ability to deliver concrete solutions
Autonomy
Working together

Education and professional background:


Engineering or university degree (Master of PhD) in Computer Sciences, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Financial Engineering.
3 to 15 years of experience in a similar role.


Languages:


English


Travels: Regular travels to the US (Houston) are needed

If you meet these requirements, then you are the talent we are looking for. Do not waste time!

Apply by attaching your updated CV, regardless your gender.

ENGIE Global Energy Management & Sales is committed to create a gender-neutral environment that unlocks the potential of everyone and provides equal employment opportunities for all individuals. All our positions are open to people with disabilities, please let your recruiter know if you need reasonable accommodations to be able to participate in the recruitment process, they will be happy to assist you.

About ENGIE:

Our group is a global reference in low-carbon energy and services. Our purpose (“raison d’être”) is to act to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world, through reduced energy consumption and more environmentally-friendly solutions, reconciling economic performance with a positive impact on people and the planet. We rely on our key businesses (gas, power, renewable energy, services) to offer competitive solutions to our customers. With our 96,000 employees, our customers, partners and stakeholders, we are a community of Imaginative Builders, committed every day to more harmonious progress.

Business Unit: GEMS

Divisie: GEMS - EC QUANTITATIVE RESEARCH & MODELING

Juridische entiteit: ENGIE GLOBAL MARKETS, BELGIAN BRANCH

Professionele werkervaring: Ervaren, (3-15 jaar ervaring)

Opleidingsniveau: WO / Master opleiding

Title: Data Analyst AWS
Description:
Wij zijn op zoek naar een analytische en gedreven Data Analyst die ervaring heeft met Amazon Web Services (AWS). In deze rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het verzamelen, analyseren en visualiseren van data om waardevolle inzichten te bieden aan verschillende afdelingen binnen onze organisatie. Je werkt nauw samen met onze data engineers, business stakeholders en IT-teams om datagedreven besluitvorming te ondersteunen.

Wat ga je doen?


Verzamelen, transformeren en analyseren van grote datasets met behulp van AWS-diensten zoals Athena, Redshift, Glue, S3 en QuickSight.
Ontwikkelen van dashboards en rapportages die strategische inzichten bieden.
Meedenken over het verbeteren van datastructuren en processen.
Samenwerken met verschillende teams om data te vertalen naar concrete acties.


Wat breng je mee?


Minimaal 2-3 jaar ervaring als Data Analyst of in een vergelijkbare rol.
Sterke ervaring met AWS-diensten zoals S3, Redshift, Glue, Athena, en QuickSight.
Vaardig in SQL en idealiter ook Python of R.
Ervaring met datavisualisatietools (Power BI, Tableau, of QuickSight).
Analytisch sterk en in staat complexe vraagstukken eenvoudig te vertalen.


🔍 Interesse?

Stuur je CV naar armend.haxhijaj@oliverjames.com.

Apply Now
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Data Analyst

Job Location: Geneva, Switzerland

Job Term: Full-Time

The Opportunity

Picarro is transforming gas utility operations with innovative solutions for methane emissions management, risk-informed leak prioritization, and pipeline asset optimization. As a Data Analyst in Picarro's Gas Business Unit, you will play a critical role in developing analytical tools, generating insights from complex datasets, and driving operational improvements.

Reporting to the Sr. Director of Climate and Safety Solutions, you will work with cross-functional teams to develop ETL pipelines, automate data processing, and create reports that enhance internal decision-making and customer outcomes. The role is ideal for candidates with 1-2 years of experience or a recent Master's or Ph.D. graduate with strong data analysis skills.



Roles and Responsibilities


Data Processing and ETL Development – Build and optimize automation tools and ETL pipelines for cleaning, normalizing, and structuring large-scale sensor and operational data.
Analysis and Insights – Conduct data analysis on time-series, sensor, and geospatial datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and operational improvements.
Collaboration – Work with product management, engineering, and customer success teams to ensure data workflows meet business needs.
Automation – Develop scripts and processes in Python and SQL to improve data ingestion, processing, and reporting.
Documentation and Reporting – Maintain clear documentation of methodologies, workflows, and results to support internal teams and customers.
Customer Support – Assist in generating analytical deliverables and visualizations to support customer projects and business objectives.




Skills and Abilities


Technical Proficiency – Strong Python and SQL skills for data automation and analysis.
Statistical and Analytical Skills – Solid foundation in statistics, including hypothesis testing and uncertainty quantification.
Data Engineering Exposure – Experience with ETL, data cleaning, and automation techniques.
GIS (Preferred but Not Required) – Familiarity with GIS tools (e.g., ESRI ArcGIS, QGIS) for geospatial analysis is a plus.
Communication – Ability to translate technical findings into actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Problem-Solving – Proactive approach to improving data processes and solving data quality challenges.


Qualifications


Master's or Ph.D. in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field (or Bachelor's with 1-2 years of experience in a relevant role).
Experience in Python, SQL, and data automation workflows.
Exposure to geospatial, time-series, or measurement data.
Industry experience in natural gas, utilities, or infrastructure is a plus.
Experience with ETL development, reporting automation, or cloud-based data processing is preferred.

Title: Data Analyst (f|m|d) (80-100%) - Zurich - Hybrid Work
Description:
Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG

We are a pioneering network of online marketplaces and an innovative European digital company that simplifies people's lives with future-oriented products.

Job Description

Join our General Marketplaces team as our new Data Analyst and become a part of SMG!

We are currently looking for a Data Analyst who will actively contribute to improving our business analytics capabilities, ensure tracking and data consistency, define and spot optimization potential in our buying and selling conversion funnels across our different platforms, and work as a data evangelist across our company by facilitating knowledge sharing sessions and training. As a member of our Data Team, you will spend time gathering insights and recommendations about our users' behavior, democratizing data access at the company, and promoting the correct use of data and analytics.

About The Position


Perform business and feature analysis and deep dives for management and product stakeholders
Own the Tableau self-service platform and main reports
Creation and maintenance of the different user conversion funnels on Google Analytics for the brands within General Marketplaces
Define GA tracking together with our front-end engineers, including testing the implementation and maintaining an events track book
Carrying reporting and analytics onboarding training for other employees of the company (especially PMs) to allow them to become self-sufficient and build their own, more specific reports and funnels
Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools


Qualifications

What we are looking for


3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
Fluency in English mandatory
German is a plus


Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you’ll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You’ll Love


Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
Hybrid work set-up
40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-apéros, and regular company-wide events
Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
Gender-neutral fair-pay
18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)


Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people’s lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobilière and General Atlantic.

Disclaimer

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

  • Performing internal data quality audits and reviews on internal tools

Qualifications

What we are looking for

  • 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, storytelling, visualization, and effectively presenting insights about (complex) topics to stakeholders
  • 3+ years of experience working with Google Analytics: building funnels and reports on the analytical side, and tracking implementation on the tech side
  • Experience with the GA4 and Firebase apps tracking and GA events tracking test tools such as XTag or GTM
  • Knowledge of A/B testing frameworks
  • Knowledge of Tableau and SQL is a big plus
  • Analytical and problem solving mindset, ability to dig into potential issues and propose solutions for optimization
  • Ability to quickly onboard and understand our business model, including how various events and transactions are captured in our data structures
  • Proactive approach to learn and find solutions outside direct area of competence
  • Fluency in English mandatory
  • German is a plus

Additional Information

Why you should join us

At SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG, you’ll be part of an international and diverse team of friendly and supportive colleagues. We embrace a hybrid work model, giving you the flexibility to work from our modern office in Zurich Oerlikon and your own home office.

Benefits You’ll Love

  • Flexible working hours and a culture of trust
  • Hybrid work set-up
  • 40-hour week (flexitime with a cap at 45 hours)
  • 6 weeks of vacation (with the possibility to buy 10 additional days)
  • Great office facilities with opportunities for plenty of social interactions, after-work-apéros, and regular company-wide events
  • Free SBB half-fare card and you travel 1st class between SMG locations in Switzerland
  • Gender-neutral fair-pay
  • 18 weeks maternity and 6 weeks paternity leave (also in case of adoption)
  • Choose your hardware (Mac or Windows + Monitor for home) and cell phone (iPhone, Samsung or Google Pixel)

Ready to make an impact?

Then apply now with your current CV, and feel free to submit any additional documents you find helpful to boost your application.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

About Us

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies people’s lives with innovative products.

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Flatfox, alle-immobilien.ch, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24, moneyland.ch).

The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La Mobilière and General Atlantic.

Disclaimer

SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.

Title: Data Analyst Power BI / Looker
Description:
Be your best with bechtle

Avec plus de 14 000 employés, nous sommes l'une des entreprises informatiques les plus prospères et les leaders du marché dans notre secteur.

L’association de la vente directe de produits informatiques et d'une gamme complète de prestations de services proposée par les différentes sociétés de services informatiques fait de nous un partenaire informatique fort et porteur d’avenir (« zukunftsstark ») pour les entreprises moyennes, les grands groupes et le secteur public. Nous sommes chez nous dans toute l’Europe et toujours près de chez vous.




Data Analyst Power BI / Looker (f/m/d)




Pour le compte de notre client du canton de Neuchâtel, nous recherchons un Ingénieur Power BI / Looker.







Ta mission




Concevoir et faire évoluer des rapports Power BI complexes : modélisation, DAX, performance
Assurer la fiabilité des modèles de données tabulaires et optimiser les requêtes
Participer à la documentation, l’industrialisation et la gouvernance des rapports BI
Travailler en lien étroit avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre et répondre aux besoins
Accompagner progressivement la migration vers Looker pour les rapports identifiés comme éligibles







Ton profil

Expérience confirmée avec Power BI (modèle de données, mesures DAX, Power Query)
Une bonne expérience de Looker / LookML est un réel atout
Maîtrise du SQL pour l’extraction et la transformation de données
Bonne compréhension des architectures BI (data warehouse, modèles tabulaires)
Capacité à évoluer dans un environnement structuré, exigeant et collaboratif




Notre proposition

Diversité : des tâches intéressantes et changeantes dans un secteur tourné vers l’avenir
Conditions de travail avantageuses : 6 semaines de vacances par an et un plan de prévoyance attractif
Développement et mise en valeur du potentiel : vaste gamme de formations professionnelles et personnelles proposées par l'Académie Bechtle




#BechtleCH-FR

Numéro d'emploi : YPVEP102

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Senior ERP Data Analyst

Location: Geneva, Switzerland (Hybrid)




Job Description

Experience Level:

7+ years of experience in ERP data analysis, with hands-on exposure to end-to-end business processes across finance (Record-to-Report), procurement (Procure-to-Pay), and sales (Order-to-Cash)​
Demonstrated history of analyzing and optimizing data in these functional areas is expected.




Preferred Industry Background:

Experience working in large enterprises or industries with complex worldwide financial operations (e.g. manufacturing, retail, or consumer goods) is preferred.
Candidates should be familiar with multi-department ERP environments and high transaction volumes, as this role spans P2P, O2C, and R2R processes.




Certifications:

ERP certification(s) preferred




Technical Skills:

Strong expertise in enterprise ERP systems (SAP ECC experience is strongly preferred)​.
Deep knowledge of key ERP modules in Finance, Procurement, and Sales and how data flows through these processes.
Proficiency in SAP data analytics and querying tools: SAP Query, SAP ABAP Query, SAP Data Browser.
Ability to generate reports and perform data validation across P2P, O2C, and R2R data.
Skilled in process mapping and analysis – capable of documenting end-to-end process flows (e.g. mapping how purchase orders to payments, or orders to cash receipts flow through the system) and identifying data dependencies/improvement opportunities.
Familiarity with business intelligence and reporting tools (such as SAP BW, Power BI) for building dashboards and visualizing ERP data insights.​




Soft Skills:

Strong interpersonal communication skills in English; other languages are an advantage.
Excellent stakeholder engagement and communication skills – able to collaborate with finance, procurement, IT, and sales stakeholders and translate data findings into business insights​
A problem-solving, analytical mindset is critical for investigating data issues and identifying root causes or trends​
The candidate should be detail-oriented yet able to see the big picture, and adept at troubleshooting process/data problems. Additionally, strong organizational skills and the ability to work under deadlines in cross-functional teams (often acting as a bridge between technical teams and business users) are important​













About Us

We are a Brazilian company with over 35 years of experience in delivering IT services worldwide, ranging from IT outsourcing to application development or IT staffing. We have a direct presence in 41 countries, through our 70 offices located throughout the world. We have managed to become the preferred partner of many small-to-midsize local and regional companies as well. Most of our clients come from industries such as financial services, manufacturing, telecommunications, chemical, services, technology, public sector and utilities.

Stefanini has career opportunities locally and around the world for professionals interested in a vibrant, passionate, team-oriented workplace. If you are a customer-centric person with a "get it done" attitude, come over for coffee and a talk on your future career with us! Learn more about us on www.stefanini.com and join us on LinkedIn , Facebook and Instagram where we regularly post insights from our colleagues.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
📈 We’re Hiring: Data Analyst (Remote within Switzerland)

Are you passionate about turning raw data into actionable insights? We’re looking for a Data Analyst to help us make smarter decisions and drive real impact — fully remote, based in Switzerland.




What You’ll Do:

Collect, clean, and analyze data to uncover trends and opportunities
Build dashboards and visual reports to support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams on data-driven projects
Interpret results and communicate findings clearly to stakeholders
Assist in setting KPIs and tracking business performance




What You Bring:

2+ years of experience as a Data Analyst or similar role
Strong skills in SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Familiarity with Python or R for data manipulation is a plus
Sharp analytical mindset and attention to detail
Fluent in English; German or French is a plus
Based in Switzerland with valid work authorization




Why Join Us?

✅ 100% Remote Work

✅ High-impact, analytical role

✅ Collaborative and data-driven culture




📩 Ready to turn data into action? Apply now and help us make smarter moves!

Title: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)
Description:
Job Location

Petit-Lancy

Job Description

Position: Analytics & Insights - Paid Internship (m/f/x)

Location: Geneva

Do you have passion to influence business strategy, product design, commercial vision, media landscape? Passion to drive the change, through deep consumer understanding and front-edge advanced analytics? And finally, are you available for a 6-months internship?

Then, this role is perfect for you!

In Analytics & Insights (A&I), we use our boundless curiosity to discover what consumers want, why they want it & how we can we influence them, through immersive exploration and data analytics.

We uncover unexpected insights and innovate the way P&G runs business.

A career in A&I will build your ability to influence and think strategically, across a breadth of experiences on multiple P&G business.

Your role as an Analytics & Insights Intern :


You will act as a business strategy consultant, guiding decisions of P&G management in several business domains (consumer, costumer, digital, …);
You will be part of a multi-functional business team, working closely with Marketing, Finance, Sales, R&D and others, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth;
You will combine analytical expertise and deep consumer understanding, to anticipate opportunities and answer critical business questions;
You will grow your skills day-in, day-out, improving your mastery in data analytics as well as immersive in-depth research. You will have the opportunity to explore new ways to learn and to connect with internal & external guides worldwide.


What we offer:


Responsibilities as of Day 1 – You will be given concrete projects and feel the ownership for them from the beginning
Continuous Growth through working on real business challenges and mentoring– you will work with a team and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager, ensuring your skillset will grown day in-day out.
Opportunity to work in a dynamic and respectful work environment – We live our Purpose, Values, and Principles daily. We value every individual and encourage initiatives promoting agility and work/life balance.


Job Qualifications

What we are looking for:

Masters Students with:


Strong analytical skills and Integrative thinking
Proven leadership and teamwork skills, with a “can-do” approach and an unusual skew to innovate
Ability to play a key role and influence across levels and functions.
Boundless curiosity and un-sane passion to generate results
Data Analytics background a plus


Additional expertise/certifications on the following areas will be valued but not required:


Work experience or certification in Market Research Techniques (Quantitative or Qualitative methods)
Work experience or certification in Visualization, Data transformation tools and/or programming (Tableau, Spotfire, PowerBI , JMP, SQL, R or Python, Alteryx, KNIME, RapidMiner)


WHO WE ARE:

P&G is one of the world’s largest consumer goods companies and home to iconic, loved and trusted brands, such as Dash®, Gillette®, Pantene®, Oral-B®, Swiffer®, Head & Shoulders®, Braun®, Fairy®.

For over 180 years, Procter & Gamble has grown in the market and changed the way business is done, thanks to Talents. We value leadership as well as mastery and offer fulfilling career opportunities that make us an unbeatable force in our industry.

At P&G #weseeequal

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. At P&G we strive to build a culture where everyone feels welcome, included, and able to bring their full selves to work.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. Please click here if you require an accommodation during the application process. Please make sure to wait to hear back from us regarding your accommodation before proceeding with the online assessment, we thank you in advance for your patience.

Due to legal restrictions, immigration sponsorship is available only for EU/EFTA nationalities. All candidates with nonEU/EFTA nationalities are encouraged to check out opportunities in countries where they can obtain a work permit.

Job Schedule

Full time

Job Number

R000114493

Job Segmentation

Internships (Job Segmentation)

Title: Logistics Data Analyst Intern
Description:
CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities


Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.


HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
The L’OCCITANE Group is a leading international manufacturer and retailer of premium and sustainable beauty and wellness products. The Group operates in 90 countries worldwide and has 3,000 retail outlets, including over 1,300 of its own stores. Within its portfolio of premium beauty brands that champion organic and natural ingredients are: L’OCCITANE en Provence, Melvita, Erborian, L’OCCITANE au Brésil, LimeLife by Alcone, ELEMIS, Sol de Janeiro and Dr. Vranjes Firenze.

With its nature-positive vision and entrepreneurial ethos, L’OCCITANE Group is committed to investing in communities, biodiversity, reducing waste and to finding sustainable solutions to create a better and healthier planet. The mission statement of the Group is: With empowerment we positively impact people and regenerate nature.

L’OCCITANE is also committed to sustainability for business, people & the planet, as well as respect of human rights, ethics principles and labour protection. All employees at L’OCCITANE must therefore implement the company’s mission and integrate the social, environmental, economic and legal effects of their actions in their day-to-day job. In practice, this means that any employee at L’OCCITANE shall contribute to growing sales, regenerating nature, caring for our consumers & partners and supporting our employees. The L'OCCITANE Group is a certified B CorporationTM.

Context

L’Occitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

Main Responsibilities


Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
Support brands including L’Occitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins
Support the deployment of Power BI solution


How You Can Fit


Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
A first professional experience in Data Analytics is preferred
Proficiency in Excel and Power BI
Fluent in English and French
Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline


STARTING DATE: July 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)

LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

L'OCCITANE is an equal opportunities employer. This means that, when making decisions about our employees' careers with us, our main considerations are their ability to do their jobs and develop in their roles. One way we cultivate change is by creating a more diverse and inclusive workplace and organizational culture. As part of this, we are committed to building an environment that is free from discrimination and harassment where everyone feels respected and valued. We recruit positive-minded people who share our core values - entrepreneurship, team spirit, leading by example and authenticity - and our commitment to sustainability.

The Group operates in 90 countries worldwide and has 3,000 retail outlets, including over 1,300 of its own stores. Within its portfolio of premium beauty brands that champion organic and natural ingredients are: L’OCCITANE en Provence, Melvita, Erborian, L’OCCITANE au Brésil, LimeLife by Alcone, ELEMIS, Sol de Janeiro and Dr. Vranjes Firenze.

With its nature-positive vision and entrepreneurial ethos, L’OCCITANE Group is committed to investing in communities, biodiversity, reducing waste and to finding sustainable solutions to create a better and healthier planet. The mission statement of the Group is: With empowerment we positively impact people and regenerate nature.

L’OCCITANE is also committed to sustainability for business, people & the planet, as well as respect of human rights, ethics principles and labour protection. All employees at L’OCCITANE must therefore implement the company’s mission and integrate the social, environmental, economic and legal effects of their actions in their day-to-day job. In practice, this means that any employee at L’OCCITANE shall contribute to growing sales, regenerating nature, caring for our consumers & partners and supporting our employees. The L'OCCITANE Group is a certified B CorporationTM.

Context

L’Occitane Group Travel Retail team is looking for an Intern, based in Geneva (Switzerland). Reporting to RGM (Revenue Growth Management) Global Travel Retail Director, your mission will be to drive data-centric decisions for Pricing, Promotion and Assortment within the Travel Retail environment (airports, airlines, cruises and ferries).

Main Responsibilities

  • Collaborate in the gathering, refining and structuring of data sourced from diverse channels
  • Design and implement new dashboards tailored to meet the evolving requirements of the Management team, focusing on aspects such as sell-out and sell-in performance
  • Support brands including L’Occitane, Sol de Janeiro, ELEMIS, Erborian, and Melvita in formulating annual pricing strategies
  • Take charge of regular monitoring and analysis of competitor pricing dynamics
  • Ensure the precision and reliability of collected data through rigorous quality control measures
  • Leverage data-driven insights to deliver actionable analyses aimed at enhancing both sales performance and profit margins
  • Support the deployment of Power BI solution

How You Can Fit

  • Student with Bachelor ou Masters' Degree within University or Business School (an internship agreement provided by your school is mandatory)
  • A first professional experience in Data Analytics is preferred
  • Proficiency in Excel and Power BI
  • Fluent in English and French
  • Proactiveness and working autonomously, with excellent organization and project management skills
  • Entrepreneurial, solution oriented, with ability to adapt
  • Strong team spirit, good coordination skills
  • At ease in a fast-paced and multi task environment, working with short-term deadline

STARTING DATE: July 2025 for 6 months (full-time position)

LOCATION: Geneva (Plan-les-Ouates), Switzerland

L'OCCITANE is an equal opportunities employer. This means that, when making decisions about our employees' careers with us, our main considerations are their ability to do their jobs and develop in their roles. One way we cultivate change is by creating a more diverse and inclusive workplace and organizational culture. As part of this, we are committed to building an environment that is free from discrimination and harassment where everyone feels respected and valued. We recruit positive-minded people who share our core values - entrepreneurship, team spirit, leading by example and authenticity - and our commitment to sustainability.

Title: VIE - DATA ANALYST SUISSE - (F/H/X)
Description:
💻 Les équipes de CANAL+ Suisse ? Situé à Lausanne, CANAL+ Suisse distribue ses offres de télévision payante sur le territoire suisse et gère le développement B2C (en direct avec ses offres SAT et OTT ou via les partenariats telco), B2B, et la commercialisation des espaces publicitaires Suisses. CANAL+ Suisse travaille en étroite collaboration avec les équipes françaises mais également les équipes des autres pays d’Europe dont le siège est au Luxembourg.   

🎯 Et vos missions :

En tant que Data Analyst, vous serez responsable de l’analyse et de l’exploitation des données pour optimiser la performance des activités de l’entreprise. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec un autre Data Analyst afin de transformer les données en insights stratégiques et opérationnels. Vous jouerez un rôle clé dans le suivi des objectifs, dans l’aide à la décision. Vous serez rattaché / rrattachée au Responsable PROJET & DATA de CANAL+ Suisse.

Suivi statistique mensuel des KPIs suivants : portefeuille abonnés, ventes, résiliations, usage des abonnés et comparer les performances réelles vs objectifs.
Travailler les atterrissages et prévisions avec le contrôle de gestion et les services en interne suisse (Marketing, Opérations, Service Client, Projets).
Analyse de performance des opérations et projets : interpréter les tendances et formuler des recommandations pour améliorer les résultats.
Organiser et animer des comités internes pour partager les analyses et suivre les plans d’actions.
Reporting et Visualisation : concevoir des tableaux de bord et des rapports automatisés en utilisant des outils comme Power BI pour faciliter la prise de décision.
Segmentation Client : identifier et segmenter les populations clients en utilisant des bases de données et des triggers, à déterminer en collaboration avec les services marketing.
Contribution dans les projets techniques en lien avec la data : En collaboration avec les différents services BI et DATA, contribuer aux avancées de projets data tels que la mise en place d’un DATALAKE, l’optimisation des outils de Marketing Automation, et la construction de modèle de prédiction de comportement clients. 

🏆 Et si on parlait de vous ?  

Diplôme BAC+5 spécialisé en BigData, Statistiques, Informatique, ou domaine équivalent.
Connaissance des stratégies marketing et CRM serait un plus.
Maitrise d’un outil de visualisation : Power BI en priorité (Tableau en backup).
Maîtrise des outils d'analyse de données : SQL en priorité. La maîtrise d'un autre langage information type Python ou R est un plus. 
Expertise Excel : Gestion de macros, langage VBA, VLookup, Tableau croisé dynamique, illustrations graphiques…
Une expérience avec la plateforme Power Automate est nécessaire.
Des connaissances sur les plateformes Dataiku et Snowflake sont un atout supplémentaire.
Esprit analytique et rigueur méthodologique.
Compétences en communication et capacité à vulgariser des analyses complexes.
Agilité et Adaptation au Changement : être flexible et réactif face aux évolutions et aux nouveaux défis.
Langues : français et anglais indispensables.  

🎁 Les + 

Environnement dynamique avec des projets innovants.
Mix Travail en présentiel et Télétravail.
Compte CANAL+ collaborateur offert le temps de la mission.

 

 

En tant que média, producteur et distributeur de contenus, le Groupe CANAL+ a une responsabilité particulière. En interne ou à l’écran, nous soutenons une création ambitieuse, inclusive et respectueuse des limites planétaires. 

👊 On agit pour l’égalité entre les femmes et les hommes, contre toute forme de discrimination ou harcèlement 

🤝 On agit pour l’égalité des chances et l’inclusion de tous et toutes 

🌍 On agit pour réduire notre impact environnemental et éco-concevoir nos produits 

 

Si vous voyez cette annonce, c’est que vous avez votre chance et que nous n’avons pas encore trouvé la perle rare! 

 

👉 Seulement chez CANAL+ Suisse !

Show more

Si vous voyez cette annonce, c’est que vous avez votre chance et que nous n’avons pas encore trouvé la perle rare! 

 

👉 Seulement chez CANAL+ Suisse !

Title: Data analyst (H/F)
Description:
CARESILIUM est une société de conseils en ingénierie 100% suisse romand. Notre flexibilité, ainsi que les valeurs que nous portons : l'honnêteté, la franchise et la simplicité, nous permettent de créer des accompagnements sur mesures qui tiennent comptes de tous les besoins, les enjeux et les contraintes de nos partenaires. Une collaboration de confiance, c'est avant tout un recrutement bienveillant et transparent.

Avec CARESILIUM, rejoignez une équipe où vos attentes professionnelles ET personnelles sont au centre des décisions. Chaque parcours est accompagné individuellement par un manager technique qui saura vous guider vers votre but.

Et rappelez-vous toujours : chez CARESILIUM, notre plus belle valeur, c'est vous

Vous avez des questions ? Besoin de précision ? N'hésitez pas à prendre contact avec nous!

Le Poste

Pour notre département Achats, soutien & infrastructures / secteur Performance & Progrès nous recherchons un data analyst (H/F), dont la mission principale est d'exploiter et interpréter les données pour en dégager des observations utiles afin d'orienter les stratégies des différents secteurs au sein d'ASI. Pour cela, il va créer et administrer les modèles de données ainsi qu'en assurer la mise à jour régulière automatique.

Responsabilités


Sélectionner et extraire des données pertinentes et de qualité provenant de sources diverses pour en calculer des tendances et indicateurs.
Traiter, nettoyer et intégrer des données pour les rendre exploitables.
Créer des dashboards, mettre en place des KPIs et du reporting pour donner une vision cohérente des résultats aux différentes équipes.
Mettre en place un processus afin de recueillir les sollicitations externes.
Produire des analyses robustes et des recommandations au management.
Gérer les outils d'analyses pour que les décideurs / les clients internes puissent suivre l'évolution de leur service.
Accompagner et former les utilisateurs sur la consultation et l'interprétation des indicateurs mis à disposition.
Coordonner les acteurs autour des données et indicateurs, animer les échanges, encourager l'amélioration continue et développer notre culture Data.
Réaliser la veille technologique autour des nouveaux outils visant à améliorer l'analyse des données.


Profil


Titulaire d'un diplôme universitaire / ingénieur en science des données ou titre jugé équivalent.
Idéalement complémenté par une expérience professionnelle dans le domaine.
A l'aise avec les outils informatiques permettant de recueillir, traiter et publier des données.
Expérience en gestion de projets et en conduite du changement.
Excellente culture générale digitale.
Bon esprit d'équipe, alliant dynamisme et proactivité.
Aisance dans les contacts humains, la communication et le reporting.
Polyvalent et autonome, animé de curiosité et d'un bon esprit d'analyse.
Show more

  • Polyvalent et autonome, animé de curiosité et d'un bon esprit d'analyse.

Title: Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%
Description:
Du suchst eine spannende Herausforderung in einem dynamischen, europaweit führenden Unternehmen? Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Umgang mit Datenmodellen gesammelt und möchtest deine analytischen Fähigkeiten und dein technisches Verständnis gewinnbringend einsetzen? Effizienz und strukturierte Arbeitsweise sind für dich selbstverständlich und du möchtest deine Stärken in einem engagierten Team entfalten?

Dann bist du bei uns als




Pricing & Data Analyst (m/w/d) - Pensum 50%




genau richtig! Als europaweit führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen im Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk sowie in der Industrie bieten wir dir die Möglichkeit, Verantwortung zu übernehmen und die Zukunft aktiv mitzugestalten.

Werde Teil eines traditionsreichen Familienunternehmens, das Innovation grossschreibt und Kundenorientierung lebt. Gemeinsam arbeiten wir an wegweisenden Lösungen und schaffen nachhaltigen Mehrwert – für unsere Kunden, für dich und für die Zukunft.

Was dich erwartet

Regelmässiges Reporting und Ad hoc Analysen für Marketing & Vertrieb
Aufbereiten grosser Datenmengen
Selbstständige Weiterentwicklung der Reporting-Landschaft
Laufende Preis-, Konditions- und Provisionsspeicherungen in SAP inkl. Datenaufbereitung
Erstellen von Kunden- und Umsatzlisten sowie Verkaufshistorien
Pricing-Restrukturierung: Preiskalkulation & Konditionsmanagement
Abweichungsanalysen (Plan-Ist)
Auswertungen und Analyse von Sonderprojekten inkl. Aufbereitung der Daten




Was dich auszeichnet

Abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung oder betriebswirtschaftliches Studium
Mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im (Marketing-/Vertriebs-) Controlling
Technisches und analytisches Verständnis
Umfangreiche IT-Kenntnisse (SAP, MS Office)
Offenheit und Kommunikationsfähigkeit zählen zu deinen Stärken
Du arbeitest gerne selbstständig und strukturiert, hast eine rasche Auffassungsgabe und verfügst über eine ausgeprägte analytische Denkweise
Eine gewissenhafte und exakte Arbeitsweise ist für dich selbstverständlich
Du kommunizierst auf Deutsch, Englisch und Französisch




Was wir bieten

Die Werte und Nachhaltigkeit eines Familienunternehmens. Gleichzeitig stellen wir uns heute für die Zukunft auf: Kundenzufriedenheit und Digitalisierung stehen dabei für uns stark im Vordergrund. Werde Teil dieses einzigartigen Wandlungsprozesses und ebne mit deiner erfolgreichen Arbeit den Weg für deine und unsere Weiterentwicklung.




Wer wir sind

165 Mitarbeiter und Mitarbeiterinnen schweizweit. Über 36.000 Artikel für das Bau- und Kfz-Handwerk. Professionelle Beratung und individueller Service mit über 50 Jahren Erfahrung. Kurzum: ein führendes Multikanalvertriebsunternehmen. So viel zu den reinen Fakten. Aber hinter der Marke BERNER steckt etwas noch viel Wertvolleres: ein Familienunternehmen mit ebenso viel Herz wie Verstand.

Wir freuen uns auf deine detaillierte Bewerbung (Lebenslauf mit Foto, Zeugnisse und Arbeitszeugnisse) mit Lohnvorstellung, bevorzugt per E-Mail an: jobs.berner-ch@berner-ag.ch

Show more

Title: Circularity Data Analyst Intern
Description:
At Nespresso, we believe that we can elevate the world of coffee to drive a positive impact and be a force for good. We place our people at the heart of our success – all 14,000 of them. To achieve this, we live by four behaviors. We Inspire, we Care, we Act, and we iNnovate. Want to be part of this exciting journey? Join the Nespresso team- Reimagine what coffee can be. Reimagine what you can become.

Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Nespresso HQ

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

Start date: Mid-July 2025

Deadline for applications: May 19th

What We Offer At Nespresso

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration

A culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging where individuality is celebrated, and you can be the real you!

Quality and sustainability at the core of who we are and a critical vision of driving positive change

The opportunity to be part of a B Corp certified company and one of the world’s most trusted brands

Don’t hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Circularity Data Analyst Intern, you will support data collection and analysis related to material usage and waste generation in our operations. You will assist in identifying data sets, analyzing material flows, creating visualizations, and researching industry benchmarks. This internship provides valuable experience in sustainability practices and data analysis within a collaborative team.

A Day in the Life of a Circularity Data Analyst Intern


Assist in identifying and sourcing relevant data sets on material usage and waste generation within operations and factories.
Support data collection efforts by collaborating with team members to ensure accurate information.
Help analyze material flows to identify basic trends and patterns in usage and waste.
Create simple visualizations (charts, graphs) to present findings to the team.
Assist in proposing basic metrics for measuring circularity, such as material recovery rates.
Contribute to the process of updating and reporting on circularity metrics as needed.
Research industry benchmarks for circularity and summarize findings for team review.
Observe and learn about best practices from industry leaders to support improvement initiatives.


What Will Make You Successful


Student or fresh graduate in a Bachelor Master’s Degree in Data Science, Business Administration, Economics, or Sustainability
Passion and interest in Sustainability
Strong analytical mind, comfortable with data, curious and autonomous
Excellent presentation skills as well as a methodical and rigorous approach to tasks
Ability to navigate challenges effectively while maintaining a proactive and positive attitude.
Consolidated experience on Sharepoint and PowerBi would be a plus as well as a solid experience with Excel
Fluent in French and advanced-level English proficiency


Nespresso is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nespresso, we’ve built a culture of care and inclusion, making sure everyone can be their bold selves, while growing with the company. We innovate, dare to try, learn and scale up in a fast paced, digital and connected environment. With a diverse workforce made up of over 90 nationalities across 58 countries, you can be a part of an innovative culture, where supportive people help each other. One where anyone is encouraged to challenge the status quo and have an impact on the future for one of the biggest sustainable companies. Whatever your role, you’ll find you can drive real change and spread your enthusiasm. Join the place where you can thrive, you feel, you belong, you are inspired to be and do your best.
Show more
HTML:
At Nespresso, we believe that we can elevate the world of coffee to drive a positive impact and be a force for good. We place our people at the heart of our success – all 14,000 of them. To achieve this, we live by four behaviors. We Inspire, we Care, we Act, and we iNnovate. Want to be part of this exciting journey? Join the Nespresso team- Reimagine what coffee can be. Reimagine what you can become.

Position Snapshot

Location: Vevey, Switzerland

Company: Nespresso HQ

Act. Rate: Full-Time

Type of contract: Internship, 6 months

Start date: Mid-July 2025

Deadline for applications: May 19th

What We Offer At Nespresso

Exciting opportunities to develop your career your way

Flexible working arrangements - facilitating creativity and collaboration

A culture of diversity, inclusion and belonging where individuality is celebrated, and you can be the real you!

Quality and sustainability at the core of who we are and a critical vision of driving positive change

The opportunity to be part of a B Corp certified company and one of the world’s most trusted brands

Don’t hesitate to connect with us during the recruitment process to learn more.

Position Summary

As a Circularity Data Analyst Intern, you will support data collection and analysis related to material usage and waste generation in our operations. You will assist in identifying data sets, analyzing material flows, creating visualizations, and researching industry benchmarks. This internship provides valuable experience in sustainability practices and data analysis within a collaborative team.

A Day in the Life of a Circularity Data Analyst Intern

  • Assist in identifying and sourcing relevant data sets on material usage and waste generation within operations and factories.
  • Support data collection efforts by collaborating with team members to ensure accurate information.
  • Help analyze material flows to identify basic trends and patterns in usage and waste.
  • Create simple visualizations (charts, graphs) to present findings to the team.
  • Assist in proposing basic metrics for measuring circularity, such as material recovery rates.
  • Contribute to the process of updating and reporting on circularity metrics as needed.
  • Research industry benchmarks for circularity and summarize findings for team review.
  • Observe and learn about best practices from industry leaders to support improvement initiatives.

What Will Make You Successful

  • Student or fresh graduate in a Bachelor Master’s Degree in Data Science, Business Administration, Economics, or Sustainability
  • Passion and interest in Sustainability
  • Strong analytical mind, comfortable with data, curious and autonomous
  • Excellent presentation skills as well as a methodical and rigorous approach to tasks
  • Ability to navigate challenges effectively while maintaining a proactive and positive attitude.
  • Consolidated experience on Sharepoint and PowerBi would be a plus as well as a solid experience with Excel
  • Fluent in French and advanced-level English proficiency

Nespresso is committed to the accessibility of its recruitment process. If you require an adaptation during the recruitment process, please do let us know so we can support you effectively. All information will be treated confidentially.

At Nespresso, we’ve built a culture of care and inclusion, making sure everyone can be their bold selves, while growing with the company. We innovate, dare to try, learn and scale up in a fast paced, digital and connected environment. With a diverse workforce made up of over 90 nationalities across 58 countries, you can be a part of an innovative culture, where supportive people help each other. One where anyone is encouraged to challenge the status quo and have an impact on the future for one of the biggest sustainable companies. Whatever your role, you’ll find you can drive real change and spread your enthusiasm. Join the place where you can thrive, you feel, you belong, you are inspired to be and do your best.

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Systematic Quantitative Researcher - Entry/Junior Level - London/Paris/Zurich Office Locations




My client is a leading quantitative hedge fund with offices across Europe, North America and Asia. Their teams trade all traditional asset classes and cover a mix of MM/HFT, Stat Arb, Quant Macro, and Event-Driven strategies. The firm is looking for Junior Quantitative Researchers to be responsible for end-to-end strategy research. This is an excellent opportunity for PhD and Master’s graduates with a background in mathematics, statistics, computer science or a related field.




Successful candidates will work in a collaborative environment where they will gain exposure to the full research pipeline from the front office while working with developers and traders to optimize, implement, monitor and manage strategies.




The Role:

Collaborate with other quantitative researchers and developers to clean datasets, discuss research, and optimise systematic trading strategies.
Involvement in all aspects of the strategy research/trading pipeline, from research based on large datasets to the development, backtesting and monitoring of strategies in live trading.




Requirements:

The ideal candidate will have a Master's or PhD in a numerate field of study, such as Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, or Engineering.
Excellent coding ability in at least one language. Previous successful candidates are proficient users of Python, C++, Java, MATLAB, etc.
Experience/knowledge of finance from academic studies, internships or professional work.
Strong attention to detail, excellent problem-solving abilities, and the ability to work well in a collaborative environment.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description de l'entreprise

Le présent et le futur d’Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l’idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l’avenir et en quête continue d’excellence dans tous nos métiers.

Si notre mission vous inspire, venez poursuivre votre parcours au sein de notre famille pour que l’on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !

Description du poste

Au sein de notre Data Office, nous recherchons notre futur Data Engineer. Vous serez responsable de la conception et de la mise en œuvre d'architectures de données robustes, tout en assurant la conformité aux réglementations et en améliorant la performance des systèmes de traitement des données. Vous travaillerez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées.

Vos missions principales :


Vous élaborez et mettez en œuvre des architectures de données solides, incluant bases de données, entrepôts de données et systèmes de traitement des données en temps réel
Vous planifiez et créez des structures de bases de données relationnelles pour garantir une récupération efficace et rapide des informations
Vous développez des systèmes capables de traiter des flux de données en temps réel pour répondre aux besoins opérationnels immédiats et assurer une prise de décision rapide
Vous assurez la conformité aux réglementations sur la protection des données et améliorez la performance des systèmes de traitement des données
Vous travaillez en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de Data, les équipes IT et les autres départements pour comprendre les besoins en données et fournir des solutions adaptées
Vous créez et mettez à jour la documentation technique, incluant guides d'utilisation et schémas techniques, pour faciliter la compréhension et la maintenance des solutions


Qualifications


Vous avez un diplôme de Master en informatique, en gestion des données, ou dans un domaine connexe
Vous justifiez de plus de 3 ans d'expérience en tant que Data Engineer
Vous justifiez d’une solide expérience avec les bases de données relationnelles, NoSQL, DBT, ETL (Talend ou équivalent), Python, Pyspark
Vous avez des compétences et connaissances avérées en conception et mise en œuvre d'architectures de données, des réglementations sur la protection des données et des meilleures pratiques en matière de sécurité des données
Vous possédez une expérience de développement dans le Cloud – la connaissance d’Azure Databricks est un plus
Vous avez des notions dans les concepts et technologies suivants : Spark, agilité, AI/GenAI


Informations supplémentaires

Ce que nous offrons :


La prise en charge des assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
5 semaines annuelles de vacances et 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles
Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
Un restaurant d’entreprise
Une LPP avantageuse


Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.
Show more

  • Une contribution à vos activités sportives ou culturelles
  • La possibilité selon la fonction de travailler à distance
  • Un restaurant d’entreprise
  • Une LPP avantageuse

Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d’Audemars Piguet ? N’hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.

Le masculin vaut pour le féminin.

Title: Lead Analyst
Description:
Lead Quant/Data Analyst

Front Office | Commodities Trading

Geneva (or Dubai)




Our client, a leading player in the commodities trading space, is looking to bring on a Quant or Data Analyst to work directly with their traders — shaping tools, insights, and tech solutions that drive performance on the desk.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Partnering closely with traders to understand workflows and deliver effective, tech-enabled solutions
Developing and enhancing tools using Python to support data manipulation, analysis, and decision-making
Leading efforts in data gathering and transformation, ideally within a Triple Point environment
Exploring opportunities to apply AI and quant methods internally (early-stage thinking)
Supporting front-office innovation with a practical, delivery-focused mindset




What We’re Looking For:

Industry experience in a quantitative and data or front-office IT function
Solid understanding of commodities trading and front-office processes
Strong Python programming skills
Excellent communication — able to translate trader needs into actionable solutions
Experience working on or directly with trading desks
Familiarity with Triple Point or other ETRM systems is a plus
Open to candidates willing to relocate to Geneva




**For roles based in Switzerland, we work with a licensed local recruitment partner to ensure all placements are managed in line with Swiss regulations.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
80% - 100%

Nous allons réaliser ensemble

Dans le cadre de notre transformation digitale et de l’adoption d’une architecture Data Mesh, nous recherchons un·e Business Data Analyst passionné·e par la donnée et par la compréhension fine des enjeux métier. Vous serez le lien direct entre les équipes opérationnelles et les équipes techniques, en transformant les besoins métiers en cas d’usage data concrets et en accompagnant leur mise en œuvre au sein de notre plateforme de données moderne basée sur Microsoft Azure (Databricks, Fabric, Power BI, dbt).

Intégré·e à l’unité « Données et Innovation » (rattachée à la direction informatique de SIG), vous participerez activement à l’identification, la formalisation et la priorisation des cas d’usage, à la définition des modèles de données et à la conception des livrables.

La donnée est désormais au cœur de la transformation digitale de l’entreprise. Elle devient un actif stratégique à forte valeur ajoutée. Votre rôle sera de détecter cette valeur et de faciliter son exploitation par nos équipes métiers.

Vous êtes convaincu·e que la donnée est un levier de performance et d’innovation ? Vous souhaitez travailler au plus proche des métiers tout en collaborant avec des experts data et IT ? Alors ce poste est fait pour vous.

Votre énergie au service d’une Genève durable

En tant que Business Data Analyst, votre mission principale consiste à :


Analyse et cadrage des besoins métiers
Animer des ateliers de cadrage avec les équipes métiers (interviews, co-construction, Data/Event Storming, etc.) afin d’identifier les cas d’usage à forte valeur ajoutée et les traduire en exigences fonctionnelles claires ;
Contribuer à la structuration des données métiers en lien avec les principes du Domain-Driven Design ;
Participer activement à la conception des couches Silver et Gold de l’architecture en médaillon, en lien avec les ingénieurs de données et les experts en modélisation de données.



Gouvernance et documentation métier
Formaliser et maintenir des glossaires, dictionnaires de données, référentiels métier et autres artefacts favorisant une compréhension partagée des données ;
Contribuer à la qualité des données, en collaborant à la mise en place de tests de validation et à la définition de data contracts entre producteurs et consommateurs ;
Accompagner les équipes dans la conformité réglementaire et participer à la documentation et à la classification des données ;
Promouvoir une culture data partagée au sein de l’entreprise.



Interface entre métiers et data platform
Traduire les besoins métier en spécifications exploitables pour les équipes data et IT ;
Participer aux choix d’outils, de modèles et de bonnes pratiques pour renforcer l’intégration des usages métiers dans la plateforme de données SIG.

Votre personnalité et vos compétences

Techniques et méthodologiques


Bonne compréhension des principes du Domain-Driven Design (DDD) et capacité à collaborer avec les équipes métiers et data pour identifier les événements clés (via des ateliers tels que Data/Event Storming) ;
Maîtrise des fondamentaux de la modélisation analytique (ex. modèles en étoile, data marts) et bonne culture générale des architectures de données de type Data Mesh ;
Capacité à formaliser des data contracts pour structurer les échanges entre producteurs et consommateurs de données ;
Sensibilité à la qualité des données et participation à la définition de règles de validation fonctionnelles (data tests) ;
Connaissance des environnements Azure, Databricks, Fabric ou des outils de datavisualisation (Power BI), sans besoin de développement technique avancé.


Outils et méthodes


Capacité à produire ou relire des modèles UML ou logiques pour s'assurer de la cohérence entre les besoins métiers et les solutions mises en œuvre.


Qualités personnelles et relationnelles


Excellentes capacités d’analyse, de synthèse et de vulgarisation ;
Aisance dans l’animation de groupes de travail, la conduite d’interviews ou d’ateliers métiers :
Forte orientation client et esprit collaboratif pour faire le lien entre métiers, IT et gouvernance ;
Rigueur, autonomie, sens du détail et curiosité, avec une volonté constante de faire progresser les pratiques data ;
Capacité à accompagner le changement grâce à une communication claire, pédagogique et structurée.


Votre parcours académique

Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme universitaire, EPF ou équivalent en informatique, systèmes d’information, data science, ingénierie ou gestion, avec une expérience confirmée dans l’analyse de besoins métiers liés à la donnée.

Vous avez déjà œuvré en tant que Business Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire, en lien direct avec les utilisateurs métiers et les équipes data/techniques, dans des projets où la donnée est un levier de transformation. Vous êtes à l’aise dans des environnements complexes et en évolution, et savez faire preuve de curiosité, d’adaptabilité et d’autonomie.

Une connaissance des architectures de type Data Mesh, des principes de gouvernance data, ou une sensibilité aux enjeux du secteur de l’énergie constitue un véritable atout.

Rejoindre SIG, c’est participer au changement !

SIG est une entreprise publique de proximité au service de la population, des entreprises et des collectivités publiques genevoises. Elle fournit un large panel de prestations dans la distribution des énergies, de l’eau et de la valorisation des déchets. Elle s'engage, en tant que bras industriel de l'Etat de Genève, en faveur d'une transition écologique ambitieuse.

SIG favorise l’équilibre entre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle par plus de flexibilité dans les horaires, les taux d’activité et les espaces de travail. Convaincue que les différences sont une force, SIG adopte une politique de recrutement visant à promouvoir la diversité et l’inclusion au sein de ses équipes.

Mise au concours n° 7597

Délai de postulation

26 mai 2025

Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist
Description:
Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist

Location: Basel (Hybrid working)

Length of Contract: 7 months




Haybury have partnered with a leading global pharmaceutical organization within Switzerland who are seeking a talented Content Insight and Taxonomy Specialist to generate actionable insights to marketing campaigns alongside providing accurate dashboards and reports for business decision making.




This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual familiar with using systems such as Veeva supporting the analytics and growth frameworks for the digital content, ensuring accuracy and integrity is maintained on each activity.




Responsibilities:




Drive the development and rollout of dashboards that measure content performance across multiple brands and markets
Build and maintain scalable content tagging frameworks aligned to business needs
Lead taxonomy design and expansion to support new channels and campaigns
Support onboarding of global stakeholders as new brands/countries join the program
Collaborate with cross functional data teams and platform teams (e.g., Veeva Vault) to ensure data and system readiness
Facilitate continuous feedback loops to extract insights and guide strategic improvements
Contribute to training programs and documentation to support consistent adoption across teams







Qualifications:




Experience in content strategy, insights, or digital marketing analytics
Strong understanding of tagging, metadata, and taxonomy best practices
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with enterprise content platforms (e.g., Veeva Vault) is a plus
Excellent collaboration skills across business and technical teams

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets




Location: Geneva, Switzerland




Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.




About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.




The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.




Key Responsibilities

Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams




Required Qualifications

Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills in English; German proficiency is a plus




What Our Client Offers




An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.




For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.
