Title: Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst

Our company in Schachen employs a diverse group of highly skilled scientists, engineers, technicians, and process specialists from more than 15 nations and provides an important contribution to our company’s endeavor to bring new innovative medicines to patients as fast as possible, while applying highest quality standards to all activities.

Are you a highly talented biotechnology graduate seeking for a first or new challenge where you are free to take initiative? Would you like to experience working in one of the biggest multinationals in the pharmaceutical industry? We are looking for a graduate student in the field of Biotechnology/Bioinformatics, Data Science or a related discipline, who is searching for a challenging early career position in our innovative company. This role is part of our Future Career Graduate Program which consists in 1 year project-based contract.

Graduate Project

The Schachen Biotech Process Automation team is providing a strategic link between our early and late-stage pipeline and responsible to develop and maintain a ‘Line of Sight’ between the stages.

The Data Analyst Graduate Project will consist in creating an innovative solution for finding and visualizing correlations between multiple sets and levels of real production process and analytical data. Implementation of PowerBI dashboards for visualization of real time data, focused on representing the key process parameters, key metrics and visualization of out-of-range values for the batches or campaigns. As an extended implementation, creating PowerBI Dashboards to represent a contextualized real time data from SAP (Bill Of Materials, Bill Of Parameters, Inventory) and MES data (Parameter Value Lists) for an overview and possible de-bottlenecking of the Batch/Campaign running.

This will also include working with intelligent automation solutions using AWS and Azure cloud capabilities and tooling, implementation of Power BI dashboards representing the process data and as well possibility of implementation of machine learning algorithms as well as Python or R programming.

As a graduate you should bring energy, knowledge, innovation to carry out the following


Collaborating with various business teams in an international setting to generate business understanding and identifying relevant data sources.
Assess the process and analytical data, collect, clean, and interpret the data available.
Prepare data for analysis and representation in PowerBI Dashboards.
Providing a fresh perspective within the department your opinion matters.
Participate and actively learn about Digital Transformation initiatives involving system integrations, data connectivity and value-based optimization of manufacturing via process supporting analyzation.


The above-mentioned responsibilities are an indication of what you will be doing after proper onboarding and initial learning and development. This provides you with the opportunity to learn and hereafter perform tasks independently. In consultation with your supervisor or peers, you could take on additional tasks and responsibilities.

What Skills You Will Need

In order to excel in this role, you will more than likely have


A graduate student in Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Data Science.
Passionate about Process Data Science and Data Analysis.
Proven experience in bioprocess engineering, analytical methods, and process data interpretation.
Basic knowledge in Python and/or R.
Basic knowledge in Power BI, Databricks, or Dataiku is preferred but not required.
You are searching for a program where you have the freedom to take initiative.
Effective oral / written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

Being an intern at our company means you will work together with a team on healthcare in an international environment. As a student, you will get the opportunity to develop yourself. In addition, we offer


The possibility to gain experience within the pharmaceutical industry.
The chance to show your potential.
A challenging and dynamic work environment with lots of space to develop yourself.
Professional guidance by an experienced specialist.


What We Look For

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace

Current Employees apply HERE

Current Contingent Workers apply HERE

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Requisition ID R348035

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Pflegewegweiser – Essentielle Entlastung für pflegende Angehörige

Pflegewegweiser entlastet pflegende Angehörige schnell und spürbar – in einem System, das oft langsam reagiert. Warten ist für uns keine Option.

Was uns ausmacht: Wir liefern aussergewöhnlich gute Hilfe für Familien – schnell, persönlich und wirksam. Geschwindigkeit ist unser Werkzeug, radikaler Fokus unser Antrieb. Wir erhöhen Standards konsequent, streichen alles Unnötige und vereinfachen das Wesentliche. Dabei handeln wir unternehmerisch: mutig, pragmatisch und lösungsorientiert und genau das erwarten wir auch von Dir.

Wenn du beim Lesen innerlich denkst: Let’s go – schneller, besser, weiter, dann bist du bei uns richtig.

Deine Aufgaben


Entwicklung und Optimierung von SQL-Abfragen in Databricks zur Erstellung täglicher Reports und Forecasts
Analyse operativer Spitex-Daten zur Erkennung von Trends, Engpässen und Optimierungspotenzialen
Automatisierung von Datenprozessen mit Python
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Management, Pflegeleitung und Tech-Team
Kontinuierliche Steigerung der Betreuungs- und Prozessqualität durch datenbasierte Transparenz und Fokus auf das Wesentliche


Fachliche Anforderungen


Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und Erfahrung mit Databricks SQL oder vergleichbaren Plattformen
Fundierte Python-Skills, insbesondere für Datenanalyse & Automatisierung
Grundverständnis relationaler Datenbanken und Umgang mit strukturierten Daten
Erste Erfahrung mit Daten (Beruf, Studium, Projekte) – auch motivierte Berufseinsteiger*innen willkommen
Idealerweise Erfahrung mit Zeitreihen, Forecasting oder KPI-Tracking
Gute Deutschkenntnisse (mind. B1) sowie grundlegende Englischkenntnisse zur Verständigung mit weiteren Abteilungen


Was Dich Erwartet


Eine sinnstiftende Aufgabe mit echtem gesellschaftlichem Impact
Ein Team mit Tempo, Fokus und Umsetzungskraft
„Speed is King“ – Kultur statt Bürokratie
Verantwortung und Gestaltungsspielraum


Ready für Tempo mit Sinn?

Dann freuen wir uns über deine Bewerbung!

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy’s most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we’re as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Business Intelligence Data Warehouse Consultant
Description:
Position Title: BI & DWH Specialist

Functional Area: Information Technology

Reporting to: Director - IT

Location: Lugano ( On-Site )

Job Description:

As a BI & DWH Specialist, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our Oracle data warehouse and business intelligence solutions. You will work closely with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Key Responsibilities:

Data Warehouse Design and Development:
Design and implement a robust data warehouse architecture.
Skill-set Oracle Data Integrator, Oracle Warehouse Builder, Oracle BI Suite, Oracle Database, Oracle Business Intelligence Suite Enterprise Edition, OR OBIEE, PL/SQL, UNIX
Good knowledge of data warehouse designs, including top-down, bottom-up, and hybrid designs.
Develop ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into the data warehouse.
Ensure data quality and consistency through data profiling and cleansing techniques.
Technology expertise includes in-depth skills in designing and developing applications with Oracle Technologies.
Good knowledge of PL/ SQL programming, creating Stored Procedures, Functions, Triggers, cursors, and packages.
Proficiency in Software Development Life Cycle SDLC and AGILE development process methodologies, such as requirement analysis, definition, prototyping, proof of concept, designing, coding, testing, and implementation.




Business Intelligence Development:
Design and develop interactive dashboards and reports using BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) to provide insights into key business metrics.
Collaborate with business users to understand their reporting needs and translate them into actionable insights.
Create data visualizations that are easy to understand and interpret.
Data Analysis and Reporting:
Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Prepare regular and ad-hoc reports to support decision-making.
Provide data-driven insights to improve business performance.
Data Governance:
Establish and maintain data governance policies and procedures.
Ensure data security and privacy compliance.
Monitor data quality and accuracy.

Qualifications and Experience:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience in data warehousing and business intelligence, and experience working with globally distributed technology teams. Handled multiple roles: Team Lead, Data Warehouse Developer, Business Analyst, Data Modeler, and Back-End Developer.
6+ years of experience in data warehousing and business intelligence.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data modeling techniques.
Experience with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts, ETL processes, and data mining techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.




Technical Skills:

ETL

Oracle Data Integrator (ODI), Oracle Warehouse Builder, PL/ SQL scripts.

Databases

Oracle 8i/ 9i/ 10g/ 11g, Sybase Version ASE 15, SQL Server.

Reporting

Oracle BI Suite, Cognos Reporting, and Actuate Reporting.

Version Control

Visual Source Safe 6.0, Clear Case.

Other Tools

Toad, SQL Navigator, Microsoft Visio, Excel, Rapid SQL, SQL Advantage, HP Service Desk, SQL Developer.

Title: Data- & Insights-Analyst (a)
Description:
Mit Insights Impact generieren. Du brennst für Daten, möchtest den Getränkemarkt im Detail verstehen und willst mit datenbasierten Insights echte Wirkung entfalten? Dann ist diese Rolle bei Red Bull AG genau das Richtige für dich. In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive – und die Möglichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.




Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterstützt zusätzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu präsentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!




Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
Du unterstützt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
Du bist Sparringpartner für das Aussendienst-Team und ermöglichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops überzeugend auf den Punkt
Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekräftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings – und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein




Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld – ergänzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumgüter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich «on the job» einzuarbeiten
Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus – und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verständlich aufzubereiten
Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gespür für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse überzeugend präsentieren
Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse – Französisch ist ein schönes Extra
Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation für eigene Lösungswege mit




Du möchtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick fürs grosse Ganze aus?




Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Show more
HTML:
Mit Insights Impact generieren. Du brennst für Daten, möchtest den Getränkemarkt im Detail verstehen und willst mit datenbasierten Insights echte Wirkung entfalten? Dann ist diese Rolle bei Red Bull AG genau das Richtige für dich. In einem dynamischen, internationalen Umfeld erwartet dich nicht nur eine spannende Marke, sondern auch ein modernes Office direkt beim Bahnhof Baar ZG, ein motiviertes Team mit Drive – und die Möglichkeit, dein analytisches Talent auf ein neues Level zu bringen.


Deine Herausforderung

Als Data- & Insights-Analyst bist du Teil des Category Management Teams und unterstützt zusätzlich das Field Sales Team. Deine Hauptaufgabe besteht darin mittels Datenanalysen & -visualisierungen Handlungsempfehlungen abzuleiten. Diese bist du auch in der Lage zu präsentieren und es macht dir Freude, diese mit unterschiedlichen Stakeholdern zu diskutieren!


  • Du analysierst Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen (NielsenIQ Paneldaten, interne BI Daten wie z.B. Aussendienst Performance oder auch Daten aus Marktforschungsstudien) und leitest daraus strategisch relevante Erkenntnisse ab
  • Du unterstützt das Category Management mit Visualisierungen, Dashboards (z. B. in Power BI) und Modellen zur datenbasierten Sortiments-, Platzierungs- und Promotionsoptimierung
  • Du bist Sparringpartner für das Aussendienst-Team und ermöglichst durch smarte Analysen effizientere Verkaufsprozesse und wirkungsvollere Massnahmen im Feld
  • Du analysierst Marktforschungsstudien zu Konsumverhalten und Shopper Insights und bringst die Resultate in Kundenworkshops überzeugend auf den Punkt
  • Mit deinem technologischen Know-how in Python, R, SQL und Snowflake entwickelst du automatisierte Reports, aussagekräftige Visualisierungen und smarte Entscheidungshilfen
  • Du wirkst aktiv mit in internen und externen Meetings – und bringst dein Wissen in internationale Austauschformate mit anderen Red Bull Insights Experts ein


Deine Qualitäten und Begabungen

  • Hochschulabschluss (FH/Uni) in Wirtschaftsinformatik, BWL/VWL, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Feld – ergänzt durch Know-how in Statistik oder Data Engineering
  • Idealerweise hast du erste Erfahrung mit Data Analytics im FMCG-, Retail-, Konsumgüter-, Versicherungs- oder Gastronomieumfeld gesammelt oder bist motiviert dich «on the job» einzuarbeiten
  • Du kennst dich mit Tools wie Python, R, Power BI, SQL und Snowflake aus – und hast Spass daran, komplexe Inhalte klar und verständlich aufzubereiten
  • Du bist analytisch stark, hast ein gutes Gespür für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge und kannst deine Erkenntnisse überzeugend präsentieren
  • Deine Muttersprache ist Deutsch und du verfügst über sehr gute Englischkenntnisse – Französisch ist ein schönes Extra
  • Dich zeichnet eine proaktive und selbstständige Arbeitsweise aus, du bringst Drive und Motivation für eigene Lösungswege mit


Du möchtest einen echten Mehrwert bei einer internationalen Unternehmung mit lokalem Spirit schaffen? Dich zeichnet ein analytisches Vorgehen mit Blick fürs grosse Ganze aus?


Dann freut sich Stefan Fritschi auf deine Bewerbungsunterlagen! Ein Motivationsschreiben, warum dich diese Position und Unternehmen anspricht, kann den Unterschied machen!

Title: Energy Data Portfolio Intern
Description:
Contexte et environnement

About us:

TotalEnergies has developed a strong expertise in oil and biofuels, natural gas and electricity trading. Trading entities are based in Geneva, Paris, Houston and Singapore. TotalEnergies installed its European trading hub across in Geneva, which now bring together very large teams around trading activities: TotalEnergies Trading & Shipping (T&S) and TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP).

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies. As such, it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution.

The Trading division in Geneva is responsible for optimising the purchase & sales portfolios of gas, electricity, CO2 emissions, dry bulk, and LNG in all recognised markets worldwide, in compliance with the Company trading guidelines.

In such context, TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

Context & Environment

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst is responsible for data retrieval within their portfolio, coordinating with IT and the T/DSOs. This role includes controlling and analysing the retrieved volumes, addressing any disputes, and updating the deals in the ETRM. The team supports business development across additional markets and less-carbonized commodities.

The team acts as the direct liaison to market system operators, ensuring continuous data collection from various sources. They are responsible for comparing volumes, performing controls and analysis, and cleaning the data. This enables seamless and flexible access to accurate and robust data, which is then shared with both internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team collaborates with relevant departments to ensure the accuracy of volumetric data when implementing it into the trading system and reviews the robustness of all internal systems related to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Intern will work closely with the Energy Data Portfolio analysts on the French renewables scope.

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:


Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner in the EDM system and communicating to TSO/DSO to retrieve missing volumes
Analysing and controlling volumetric data daily to identify anomalies and inconsistencies before updating the ETRM.
Assisting and building with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, dashboards, reports and alerts on volumetric data to improve the data quality.
Producing key performance measures and indicators around data quality of the assets.
In coordination with Energy Data Portfolio Analysts, request Guarantees of Origins issuance to EEX every month.
Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.



Profil du candidat

Your profile:


Educational standard required: Engineering or Finance background preferred.
Strong operational and data visualisation skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
Fluent in English and secondary language is nice to have – French, Spanish and Italian.



Informations supplémentaires

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

TotalEnergies valorise la diversité, promeut le développement individuel et offre des opportunités d'emploi égales à tous les candidats.

Title: Trainee - Artificial Intelligence & Data
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva

Work Pattern Percentage: 80% - 100%

You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices

Are you close to completing a bachelor / master's in science, Information Technology, or a related quantitative discipline, eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and Data? Our AI & Data team is on the lookout for passionate, innovative minds ready to explore the vast possibilities of AI and data analytics. As a trainee with us, you will embark on a journey of learning and discovery, gaining hands-on experience in shaping the future of technology. Join us to transform your academic knowledge into real-world impact, and kickstart your career in one of the most exciting and fast-evolving fields today.

About The Position

We are looking for Trainees starting September 2025 for a 12-month program. Top performers may be offered full-time roles as Business Analysts or Consultants right after the program or within a year of finishing studies.

How You Can Make An Impact


Work with our clients to modernize their data landscape using next generation cloud-enabled platforms and (Gen)AI technology to deliver high quality actionable insights
Implement large-scale data ecosystems including data management, governance, and the integration of internal and external data
Leverage traditional data visualization and next generation algorithms to generate predictions and insights from structured and unstructured data, and augment decision-making
Jointly develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their objectives ranging from satisfying regulatory requirements to improving customer experience by leveraging the power of modern data stack
Guide clients in executing complex data transformations that have organizational and cultural implications and require data-driven mindset



Who We Are Looking For


You have a strong academic background, preferably with a degree in Science, Information Technology, or another quantitative field
You have a strong drive for excellence and high career ambitions
You have gained first relevant practical data-related and/or consulting-like experience through internships/traineeships and enjoy working methodically and with great attention to detail.
You grasp new concepts quickly and are both client and goal oriented
You can manage multiple activities and are used to work in high pace environment
You’re fluent English, fluency in German and/or French highly preferred
You show a foundational understanding of at least one of the following disciplines – data management, data platforms, data analytics & (Gen)AI
Practical experience with SQL, Python/Spark, GenI, and Cloud Data Platforms is highly beneficial



Your Team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 60+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & Data – empowering clients to harness it for creating human-centric solutions, driving growth and efficiency. Clients benefit from our expertise in data, analytics, modern platforms, and advanced technologies like Generative AI. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Careers at Deloitte. Choose your impact.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates. If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch


We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.



We do not accept applications from recruitment agencies for this position.

Deloitte Consulting AG and Deloitte AG are affiliates of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee (“DTTL”)

Requisition ID: 17999

Title: Senior Data Quality Analyst / Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Stellenbeschreibung: Datenmanagement-Spezialist (m/w/d)

Aufgaben:

Durchführung von Qualitätskontrollen von Dateneingaben in umfangreichen Listen mit unterschiedlichen Formaten.
Erarbeitung von automatisierbaren Daten-Export- und Import-Lösungen mit Microsoft Excel, AccessDBs und PowerBI.
Datenimport und -export von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quell- und Zielsystemen über API-Schnittstellen.
Mapping von Datenobjekten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen/Formaten mit Erstellung von Korrelationen.
Generierung von automatisierten Reports zur Kontrolle der aktuellen Datenqualität.
Aufbau einer Data Fabric Lösung auf PowerBI mit Definition und Umsetzung der notwendigen Datenstrukturen.
Erstellung neuer und Harmonisierung bestehender Reports nach Einführung des „Data Fabric" Layers.
Kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung und Qualitätssicherung der Reports nach Bedarf.

Anforderungen:

Erfahrungen mit relationalen Datenbanken und Modellen.
Erfahrungen mit Design und Programmierung von SQL-Abfragen mit Microsoft Produkten.
Erfahrungen mit Datenexporten und -importen (Microsoft Access DB, Excel, PowerBI).
Erfahrungen mit Design und Umsetzung von „Data Fabric" Lösungen auf MS PowerBI.
Erfahrungen mit Definition und Umsetzung von Reports auf MS PowerBI.
Gute Programmierkenntnisse mit Microsoft SQL-Datenbanken und Microsoft Access.
Gute Programmierkenntnisse mit Microsoft PowerBI für Reports und Auswertungen.
Erfahrungen mit Microsoft Excel Makros (Erstellen und Weiterentwickeln).
Sehr gute Microsoft Excel Anwenderkenntnisse zur Datenvalidierung.
Sehr gute Kenntnisse mit Schnittstellen für Datenmappings.

Rahmenbedingungen:

Vertragsart: Personalverleihvertrag oder Dienstleistungsvertrag.
Einsatzort: Remote sowie Vor-Ort (2-3 Tage pro Woche) in Baden.
Arbeitszeit: 80-100% Pensum (Anzahl Stunden pro Woche je nach Vereinbarung).
Einsatzbeginn/Zeitraum: Befristet, baldmöglichst bis ca. Ende 2025 mit Option auf Verlängerung je nach Projektfortschritt.

Wir suchen eine engagierte und detailorientierte Person, die Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten hat und über die notwendigen technischen Fähigkeiten verfügt, um komplexe Datenprozesse effizient und genau zu verwalten. Wenn Sie eine Leidenschaft für Datenqualität und Automatisierung mitbringen und Teil eines dynamischen Teams sein möchten, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.




Sthree Switzerland is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

  • Arbeitszeit: 80-100% Pensum (Anzahl Stunden pro Woche je nach Vereinbarung).
  • Einsatzbeginn/Zeitraum: Befristet, baldmöglichst bis ca. Ende 2025 mit Option auf Verlängerung je nach Projektfortschritt.

Wir suchen eine engagierte und detailorientierte Person, die Freude an der Arbeit mit Daten hat und über die notwendigen technischen Fähigkeiten verfügt, um komplexe Datenprozesse effizient und genau zu verwalten. Wenn Sie eine Leidenschaft für Datenqualität und Automatisierung mitbringen und Teil eines dynamischen Teams sein möchten, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Bewerbung.


Sthree Switzerland is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

Title: DATA MANAGER / ANALYST (MID LEVEL)
Description:
Job Type

Full-time

Description

Nemean Solutions, headquartered in Sierra Vista, AZ, is a certified SBA 8(a) Native Hawaiian Organization (NHO) and veteran-operated company providing advanced Military Intelligence, Enterprise and Cloud IT services, Cybersecurity, Special Operations Forces (SOF) Exercise and Training, and niche Program Support and Professional Services to Federal and State Agencies supporting the US Government Defense, Intelligence and Aerospace sectors.

Job Overview

The Data Manager / Analyst (Mid Level) supports the Tethered Aerostat Radar System (TARS) Program by managing, organizing, and analyzing program-related data to inform decisions and improve operational effectiveness. This role ensures data integrity, produces detailed reports and dashboards, and supports the development of performance metrics and data governance policies.

Support Hours: Applicant shall be available during core work hours as established the Government customer.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and maintain datasets to support program reporting and analytics.
Analyze operational, financial, and performance data to support decision-making.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations using tools such as Excel, Power BI, or Tableau.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data requirements and streamline reporting processes.
Ensure adherence to data quality, integrity, and security standards.
Assist in the development of standard operating procedures (SOPs) for data management and reporting.
Support audits, evaluations, and ad hoc data requests.


Competencies


Strong analytical and data interpretation skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and one or more data visualization tools.
Ability to manage multiple datasets and perform detailed analysis.
Familiarity with data governance and federal reporting requirements.
Excellent communication and organizational skills.


Requirements

Minimum Requirements/Education:


Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Information Systems, or a related field.
3-5 years of experience in data management, analysis, or reporting within a federal program or government contracting environment.
Proficient in Excel, data visualization software, and data management platforms.
Familiarity with DHS or DoD environments preferred.
U.S. Citizenship required.


Security Requirement


Favorably adjudicated CBP Background Investigation (BI) and Secret Security Clearance required.


Travel Required: 10-15%

Physical Demands/Requirements: Work is performed in an office environment. Mostly sedentary work. Repetitive motion. Substantial movement (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer screen; extensive reading.

What Nemean Solutions, LLC Offers

Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance plans, Paid Time Off, sick leave, 401k Retirement Savings plan with company match, and more.

Nemean Solutions is proud to be a Veteran friendly employer and provides Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, and local laws. Equal Opportunity for VEVRAA Protected Veterans. Nemean Solutions, LLC will not discriminate against employees and job applicants who inquire about, discuss or disclose compensation information.

Salary Description

$150,000 and above

Title: BI Developer and analyst
Description:
💼 Job Title : BI Developer and analyst

📍 Localisation : Geneva or Zurich

⏳ Activity rate : 100%

🗓️ Starting date : July 2025




Job purpose :




The BI Developer in close cooperation with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager serves the Applications Engineering Division (and on opportunity also other business users in the Technical Department) by developing BI visuals (KPI dashboards, trend graphs, …) of data out of the software development and deployment processes of the division. These visuals will be part of a structured Cockpit for the division allowing at different levels of granularity to monitor the performance and output of the division. The overall cockpit shall enable the division to identify and address improvement areas. He or she will work closely with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager to implement this cockpit.




He or she is responsible to analyze complex information and data flows as well as existing data structures with the target to optimize BI data models including the associated process and data flow logic. The reporting tool is Power BI where solutions will be developed.




He or she will be involved in the contact with stakeholders, customers and users for the determination of their needs.

He or she will further interact with these persons during the development of the reports in a closed feedback loop.




The to be developed visuals shall support the division management and other stakeholders to

understand the status of a process, the organization, the product quality, …
easily identify trends and areas requiring measures for improvement,
take decisions about improvement measures,
monitor progress after implementation of improvement measures.




The BI developer is accountable for applying best practices in his/her work and for striving for common look and feel and user friendliness of the visuals.







Responsabilities :




Supports the division in building up a visual data driven cockpit of relevant KPIs for the processes and products of the division.
Collaborates with the Continuous Improvement Manager closely on the overall concept, as well as on the implementation of the individual KPI visuals.
Collaborates with other stakeholders and team members who provide or maintain basic data.







Tasks :




Elicit requirements for Visuals
Identify and analyze data sources
Establish means for automatic collection
Develop data model within the BI tool according to best practices
Job Description Page 2 of 2 Profile-BI Developer-and-analyst-final
Apply solution-oriented data transformation
Develop visualization within the BI tool considering style guides
Where appropriate or needed evolve existing style guides
Test visual
Provide user description or info about each visual
Provide technical description for maintenance of each visual(support) rollout of new visuals
Improve visuals in feedback driven collaboration with stakeholders and users of the visuals







Knowledge/experience :




3+ years of experience as BI developer, preferably with Power BI
Very good verbal and written English
French and/or German language skills a plus
Data modelling and analysis
Problem solving mindset
Power BI desktop tool expertise
Data transformation with M language
DAX knowledge (Data Analysis Expressions)
Visualization and design
Deployment of Power BI visuals
Reporting process automation (data collection, transformations and refresh)
Practical knowledge of collaboration tools like Jira, Confluence a plusv




Softskills :




Collaborative, team player
Organized and methodic
Good communication skills
Proactive and outgoing personality







------------------------------------------------------------------




🌍 Founded in 2007, Antaes is a Swiss management and technology consulting company 🇨🇭, ranked among the top 10 consulting firms in Switzerland. We have over 300 experienced engineers who share our passion.




📍 With offices in Switzerland, Singapore, Hong Kong, and France, we support our Swiss and international clients in the following areas:

Organisation & Transformation Consulting
Industrial Engineering
Information Systems Management




By joining our team, you will discover:

A dynamic team with a start-up spirit
A human-centric approach & personalized career follow-up
Education & Training to keep developing your skills
Exciting events: team building, meet-ups, workshops, afterworks, and Winter + Summer Events




🏆 A company certified @HappyAtWork and committed to CSR (Ecovadis 2023 Gold Medal 🥇)




You too can be part of the Antaes adventure !

Title: Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Fluency in English.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (exclusive of bank holidays)
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

Do you have a question about the role?

Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

Title: Data Engineer junior (H/F)
Description:
StarQube développe une suite de solutions Front Office dédiées à l'organisation des données et à la construction de portefeuilles, conçues pour rationaliser les processus d'investissement, depuis l'acquisition des données, en passant par le backtesting rapide des stratégies définies par le client et la gestion des risques, jusqu'au rééquilibrage du portefeuille, à l'envoi des ordres et à la production de rapports. StarQube offre aux gestionnaires d'actifs un moyen agile d'automatiser chacun des processus de gestion de portefeuille tout en économisant sur les coûts de structure et de données.




Nous cherchons à pourvoir un poste de Data Engineer junior (H/F) localisé dans la région de Genève.


Vos missions



Acquérir l’expertise de l’utilisation de nos outils de manière à pouvoir accompagner nos clients dans la création de leurs processus d’investissement et de leurs rapports.


Analyser, comprendre et intégrer de manière élégante de nouveaux jeux de données à nos outils selon les besoins de nos clients.


Gérer la relation avec les clients sur les projets confiés (possibilité de déplacements chez les clients) et coordination avec les autres équipes de StarQube.


Utiliser l’expérience ainsi acquise pour contribuer à l’évolution de nos solutions en général.


Participer à la création continue de modèles financiers pour nos clients et prospects.


Participer aux efforts commerciaux de l’équipe de Business Development.



Vos compétences



Autonomie et rigueur avec un fort niveau d'exigence (orientation résultats, sens aigu des responsabilités). Vous aimez organiser et faire parler les données.


Master (ou équivalent) en computer science, ingénierie ou autre diplôme scientifique.


Connaissance d’un langage de programmation (p.ex. Java, Python).


Excellentes capacités de communication en français et en anglais.


À l’aise dans un environnement start-up.

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Job Description




On behalf of our client, a prestigious Wealth Management firm specialised in alternative investment solutions, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced SQL Developer to join our client's IT Data and Application Management team. The role will focus on developing, optimizing, and maintaining their data reconciliation platform while also supporting the management of the Master Data Management (MDM) system.




Responsibilities




Oversee the full development lifecycle of the SQL-based data reconciliation platform, from gathering requirements to development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance.
Design and implement additional integrations to enhance the reconciliation platform.
Contribute to the ongoing development of the central Master Data Management (MDM) system, focusing on integrations with other systems; act as a deputy for the MDM application manager.
Identify and resolve performance issues to ensure the platform’s scalability.
Collaborate with application owners, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand new requirements and implement appropriate solutions.







Requirements




Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or a related IT-focused discipline.
Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL).
Proficiency in data reconciliation and integration with databases and file-based systems.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Solid understanding of data architecture and data modeling principles.
Enthusiastic about new technologies with a willingness to learn and adapt.
Strong analytical mindset with a goal-oriented, solution-driven approach.
Organized and detail-oriented with a structured working style.
Experience in the financial sector and knowledge of asset management is a plus.
Effective communication skills in English and German as a strong advantage.







Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Title: Lead Analyst
Description:
Lead Quant/Data Analyst

Front Office | Commodities Trading

Geneva (or Dubai)




Our client, a leading player in the commodities trading space, is looking to bring on a Quant or Data Analyst to work directly with their traders — shaping tools, insights, and tech solutions that drive performance on the desk.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Partnering closely with traders to understand workflows and deliver effective, tech-enabled solutions
Developing and enhancing tools using Python to support data manipulation, analysis, and decision-making
Leading efforts in data gathering and transformation, ideally within a Triple Point environment
Exploring opportunities to apply AI and quant methods internally (early-stage thinking)
Supporting front-office innovation with a practical, delivery-focused mindset




What We’re Looking For:

Industry experience in a quantitative and data or front-office IT function
Solid understanding of commodities trading and front-office processes
Strong Python programming skills
Excellent communication — able to translate trader needs into actionable solutions
Experience working on or directly with trading desks
Familiarity with Triple Point or other ETRM systems is a plus
Open to candidates willing to relocate to Geneva




**For roles based in Switzerland, we work with a licensed local recruitment partner to ensure all placements are managed in line with Swiss regulations.

Title: Data Analyst 80-100%
Description:
Jobs mit Zukunft am Puls der Lebensmittelindustrie

Die 1895 gegründete HOCHDORF entwickelt, produziert und vermarktet technologisch anspruchsvolle, funktionelle Nahrungsmittel. Mit unseren «Food for Life» Produkten ermöglichen wir ein gesundes und genussreiches Leben für Jung und Alt. Wir setzen auf modernste Produktionstechnologien, qualitativ hochwertige Rohstoffe und Mitarbeitende mit marktnahem Nutrition-Know-how.

Weitere Informationen über die HOCHDORF-Gruppe finden Sie unter www.hochdorf.com.

Ihre Aufgaben


Datenaufbereitung & Analyse: Sicherstellung der Verfüg- barkeit, Qualität und Strukturierung der Daten zur Nutzung in Power BI.
Schnittstelle zwischen IT & Fachbereichen: übersetzen von Business-Anforderungen in technische Lösungen, um datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu ermöglichen.
Koordination mit dem externen IT-Partner: Anforderungsmanagement und Unterstützung beim Betrieb des Data Warehouses (DWH).
Optimierung der Datenprozesse: Entwicklung und Ver- besserung von Datenmodellen und Dashboards für eine effiziente Berichterstattung.
Qualitätssicherung & Dokumentation: Erstellen von Richtlinien für die Datenverarbeitung, Dokumentation der Prozesse und Durchführung von Schulungen für Fachabteilungen.
Projektarbeit & Support: Mitarbeit an datenbezogenen Projekten und Unterstützung der Endnutzer bei der Nutzung von Power BI und anderen BI-Tools.


Ihr Profil


Abgeschlossenes Studium oder Berufsausbildung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Business Intelligence (BI) oder Data Engineering.
Gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie Erfahrung mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Reporting-Tools.
Verständnis für Data-Warehouse-Architekturen und ETL- Prozesse.
Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit IT-Teams und Fachabteilungen zur Ableitung datengetriebener Lösungen.
Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, um komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich aufzubereiten.
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse, Englischkenntnisse von Vorteil.


Wir sind ein dynamisches Unternehmen, das Wert auf kurze Entscheidungswege, eine offene Unternehmenskultur und innovative Lösungen legt. Zur Unterstützung unserer datengetriebenen Prozesse suchen wir eine analytisch starke Persönlichkeit, die als Bindeglied zwischen unseren internen Fachabteilungen und unserem externen IT-Partner fungiert. Dein Arbeitsplatz befindet sich überwiegend an unserem Hauptsitz in Hochdorf (LU) und projektbasiert auch an unserem modernen Produktionsstandort in Sulgen (TG)

Wir freuen uns auf Ihre elektronische Bewerbung. Auskunft zur Stelle erhalten Sie bei Sybille Broch, HR Business Partner HOCHDORF Swiss Nutrition AG, 6281 Hochdorf, Schweiz, Tel. +41 41 914 65 58. Data Analyst 80 - 100 %

Wir bieten ein dynamisches Umfeld mit kurzen Wegen, flexibler Arbeitszeitgestaltung inklusive Home-Office-Möglichkeiten und Freiraum für eigene Ideen. Ihr Arbeitsplatz liegt direkt beim Bahnhof Hochdorf. Auch Ihr neuer Arbeitsplatz ab September im D4 in Root überzeugt in allen Belangen. Ein eingespieltes Team freut sich auf Sie.

Für unseren Hauptsitz in Hochdorf - ab September 2025 in Root – suchen wir einen

HTML:
Jobs mit Zukunft am Puls der Lebensmittelindustrie

Die 1895 gegründete HOCHDORF entwickelt, produziert und vermarktet technologisch anspruchsvolle, funktionelle Nahrungsmittel. Mit unseren «Food for Life» Produkten ermöglichen wir ein gesundes und genussreiches Leben für Jung und Alt. Wir setzen auf modernste Produktionstechnologien, qualitativ hochwertige Rohstoffe und Mitarbeitende mit marktnahem Nutrition-Know-how.

Weitere Informationen über die HOCHDORF-Gruppe finden Sie unter www.hochdorf.com.

  • Koordination mit dem externen IT-Partner: Anforderungsmanagement und Unterstützung beim Betrieb des Data Warehouses (DWH).
  • Optimierung der Datenprozesse: Entwicklung und Ver- besserung von Datenmodellen und Dashboards für eine effiziente Berichterstattung.
  • Qualitätssicherung & Dokumentation: Erstellen von Richtlinien für die Datenverarbeitung, Dokumentation der Prozesse und Durchführung von Schulungen für Fachabteilungen.
  • Projektarbeit & Support: Mitarbeit an datenbezogenen Projekten und Unterstützung der Endnutzer bei der Nutzung von Power BI und anderen BI-Tools.

Ihr Profil

  • Abgeschlossenes Studium oder Berufsausbildung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation.
  • Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse, Business Intelligence (BI) oder Data Engineering.
  • Gute Kenntnisse in SQL sowie Erfahrung mit Power BI oder vergleichbaren Reporting-Tools.
  • Verständnis für Data-Warehouse-Architekturen und ETL- Prozesse.
  • Erfahrung in der Zusammenarbeit mit IT-Teams und Fachabteilungen zur Ableitung datengetriebener Lösungen.
  • Gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, um komplexe Sachverhalte verständlich aufzubereiten.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
80% - 100%

Nous allons réaliser ensemble

Dans le cadre de notre transformation digitale et de l’adoption d’une architecture Data Mesh, nous recherchons un·e Business Data Analyst passionné·e par la donnée et par la compréhension fine des enjeux métier. Vous serez le lien direct entre les équipes opérationnelles et les équipes techniques, en transformant les besoins métiers en cas d’usage data concrets et en accompagnant leur mise en œuvre au sein de notre plateforme de données moderne basée sur Microsoft Azure (Databricks, Fabric, Power BI, dbt).

Intégré·e à l’unité « Données et Innovation » (rattachée à la direction informatique de SIG), vous participerez activement à l’identification, la formalisation et la priorisation des cas d’usage, à la définition des modèles de données et à la conception des livrables.

La donnée est désormais au cœur de la transformation digitale de l’entreprise. Elle devient un actif stratégique à forte valeur ajoutée. Votre rôle sera de détecter cette valeur et de faciliter son exploitation par nos équipes métiers.

Vous êtes convaincu·e que la donnée est un levier de performance et d’innovation ? Vous souhaitez travailler au plus proche des métiers tout en collaborant avec des experts data et IT ? Alors ce poste est fait pour vous.

Votre énergie au service d’une Genève durable

En tant que Business Data Analyst, votre mission principale consiste à :


Analyse et cadrage des besoins métiers
Animer des ateliers de cadrage avec les équipes métiers (interviews, co-construction, Data/Event Storming, etc.) afin d’identifier les cas d’usage à forte valeur ajoutée et les traduire en exigences fonctionnelles claires ;
Contribuer à la structuration des données métiers en lien avec les principes du Domain-Driven Design ;
Participer activement à la conception des couches Silver et Gold de l’architecture en médaillon, en lien avec les ingénieurs de données et les experts en modélisation de données.



Gouvernance et documentation métier
Formaliser et maintenir des glossaires, dictionnaires de données, référentiels métier et autres artefacts favorisant une compréhension partagée des données ;
Contribuer à la qualité des données, en collaborant à la mise en place de tests de validation et à la définition de data contracts entre producteurs et consommateurs ;
Accompagner les équipes dans la conformité réglementaire et participer à la documentation et à la classification des données ;
Promouvoir une culture data partagée au sein de l’entreprise.



Interface entre métiers et data platform
Traduire les besoins métier en spécifications exploitables pour les équipes data et IT ;
Participer aux choix d’outils, de modèles et de bonnes pratiques pour renforcer l’intégration des usages métiers dans la plateforme de données SIG.

Votre personnalité et vos compétences

Techniques et méthodologiques


Bonne compréhension des principes du Domain-Driven Design (DDD) et capacité à collaborer avec les équipes métiers et data pour identifier les événements clés (via des ateliers tels que Data/Event Storming) ;
Maîtrise des fondamentaux de la modélisation analytique (ex. modèles en étoile, data marts) et bonne culture générale des architectures de données de type Data Mesh ;
Capacité à formaliser des data contracts pour structurer les échanges entre producteurs et consommateurs de données ;
Sensibilité à la qualité des données et participation à la définition de règles de validation fonctionnelles (data tests) ;
Connaissance des environnements Azure, Databricks, Fabric ou des outils de datavisualisation (Power BI), sans besoin de développement technique avancé.


Outils et méthodes


Capacité à produire ou relire des modèles UML ou logiques pour s'assurer de la cohérence entre les besoins métiers et les solutions mises en œuvre.


Qualités personnelles et relationnelles


Excellentes capacités d’analyse, de synthèse et de vulgarisation ;
Aisance dans l’animation de groupes de travail, la conduite d’interviews ou d’ateliers métiers :
Forte orientation client et esprit collaboratif pour faire le lien entre métiers, IT et gouvernance ;
Rigueur, autonomie, sens du détail et curiosité, avec une volonté constante de faire progresser les pratiques data ;
Capacité à accompagner le changement grâce à une communication claire, pédagogique et structurée.


Votre parcours académique

Vous êtes titulaire d’un diplôme universitaire, EPF ou équivalent en informatique, systèmes d’information, data science, ingénierie ou gestion, avec une expérience confirmée dans l’analyse de besoins métiers liés à la donnée.

Vous avez déjà œuvré en tant que Business Analyst ou dans un rôle similaire, en lien direct avec les utilisateurs métiers et les équipes data/techniques, dans des projets où la donnée est un levier de transformation. Vous êtes à l’aise dans des environnements complexes et en évolution, et savez faire preuve de curiosité, d’adaptabilité et d’autonomie.

Une connaissance des architectures de type Data Mesh, des principes de gouvernance data, ou une sensibilité aux enjeux du secteur de l’énergie constitue un véritable atout.

Rejoindre SIG, c’est participer au changement !

SIG est une entreprise publique de proximité au service de la population, des entreprises et des collectivités publiques genevoises. Elle fournit un large panel de prestations dans la distribution des énergies, de l’eau et de la valorisation des déchets. Elle s'engage, en tant que bras industriel de l'Etat de Genève, en faveur d'une transition écologique ambitieuse.

SIG favorise l’équilibre entre vie personnelle et vie professionnelle par plus de flexibilité dans les horaires, les taux d’activité et les espaces de travail. Convaincue que les différences sont une force, SIG adopte une politique de recrutement visant à promouvoir la diversité et l’inclusion au sein de ses équipes.

Mise au concours n° 7597

Délai de postulation

26 mai 2025

Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist
Description:
Title: Digital Content Insight Specialist

Location: Basel (Hybrid working)

Length of Contract: 7 months




Haybury have partnered with a leading global pharmaceutical organization within Switzerland who are seeking a talented Content Insight and Taxonomy Specialist to generate actionable insights to marketing campaigns alongside providing accurate dashboards and reports for business decision making.




This is a fantastic opportunity for an individual familiar with using systems such as Veeva supporting the analytics and growth frameworks for the digital content, ensuring accuracy and integrity is maintained on each activity.




Responsibilities:




Drive the development and rollout of dashboards that measure content performance across multiple brands and markets
Build and maintain scalable content tagging frameworks aligned to business needs
Lead taxonomy design and expansion to support new channels and campaigns
Support onboarding of global stakeholders as new brands/countries join the program
Collaborate with cross functional data teams and platform teams (e.g., Veeva Vault) to ensure data and system readiness
Facilitate continuous feedback loops to extract insights and guide strategic improvements
Contribute to training programs and documentation to support consistent adoption across teams







Qualifications:




Experience in content strategy, insights, or digital marketing analytics
Strong understanding of tagging, metadata, and taxonomy best practices
Ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights
Familiarity with enterprise content platforms (e.g., Veeva Vault) is a plus
Excellent collaboration skills across business and technical teams







Reach out to Rory.pitts@hayburysearch for a confidential discussion an further insight to the position.

Title: Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas
Description:
Senior Quantitative Analyst - Power & Gas Markets




Location: Geneva, Switzerland




Our client is looking for an experienced Quantitative Analyst to join their dynamic energy trading and analytics team in Geneva, Switzerland. This role combines market expertise with quantitative skills to drive power and gas market strategies forward.




About Our Client

Our client is a leading expert in the energy markets, providing critical analysis, forecasting, and modelling services. Their work supports key stakeholders in navigating the energy transition while identifying valuable investment opportunities in sustainable energy systems.




The Role

As a Senior Quantitative Analyst, you will apply sophisticated quantitative methods to model European power and gas markets, create price scenarios, and develop actionable insights for trading desks and clients.




Key Responsibilities

Model fundamental power and gas markets using proprietary systems and data analysis
Design and integrate new datasets to enhance trading strategies
Support trading desks in utilizing data for production systems
Develop and improve analytical products and methodologies
Manage data sourcing projects from acquisition through production
Communicate insights to clients and internal stakeholders
Collaborate with research and consulting teams




Required Qualifications

Degree in a technical or quantitative field (Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Data Science, or Economics)
Minimum 3 years of experience in quantitative analysis, data engineering, or similar roles
Strong programming skills in Python and familiarity with data analysis packages
Understanding of European energy markets and trading dynamics
Experience with financial data platforms is advantageous
Ability to work independently while collaborating in a global team environment
Excellent analytical thinking and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills in English; German proficiency is a plus




What Our Client Offers




An opportunity to join a team at the forefront of the energy transition, where your analytical expertise will contribute to sustainable market solutions while generating value for their clients and stakeholders.




For a confidential discussion about this exciting opportunity in Geneva, please submit your application with a detailed CV.

Title: Business Analyst / Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data - (Data Management & Data Platforms focus)
Description:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact


Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.





Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:


Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
Drive to learn new topics and master them
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
Consulting and Communication Skills:
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.



Technical design:


Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Technical expertise:
First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
Familiarity with SQL and Python.



Language Proficiency:


Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.



Industry Experience:


First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.



Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

Requisition ID:17116

HTML:
Job Description

Location: Zurich, Geneva, Basel

Work Pattern Percentage: 80-100%

Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.

For this role, we are currently offering start dates from February 2025.

How You Can Make An Impact

  • Design and implement modern data solutions in the areas of data management (e.g. data quality, master and reference data, catalogues, data platforms) that deliver high-quality, usable data
  • Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars.
  • Design complex data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations, which have significant organizational implications.
  • Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
  • Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally.
  • Support business development opportunities to generate new projects.
  • Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence.
  • Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent.




Who we are looking for

Drive and Motivation:

  • Passionate individuals looking to make a career in AI & Data space.
  • Drive to learn new topics and master them
  • Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently.
  • Consulting and Communication Skills:
  • Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations.
  • Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems.
  • Business-IT Translator: Ability to act as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions.


Technical design:

  • Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
  • Technical expertise:
  • First practical experience with Data management or Data Platform solutions is highly recommended.
  • Familiarity with SQL and Python.


Language Proficiency:

  • Fluent in English; fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders.


Industry Experience:

  • First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields.
  • Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous.


Your team

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data – how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

Life at Deloitte

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .

How To Apply

We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on “apply now” to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.

If you have any questions, please contact Julia at talent@deloitte.ch

  • We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria; don’t hold yourself back – apply today.
