Requisition ID:17116

Title: Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Graduate Program Junior Data Analyst

Our company in Schachen employs a diverse group of highly skilled scientists, engineers, technicians, and process specialists from more than 15 nations and provides an important contribution to our company’s endeavor to bring new innovative medicines to patients as fast as possible, while applying highest quality standards to all activities.

Are you a highly talented biotechnology graduate seeking for a first or new challenge where you are free to take initiative? Would you like to experience working in one of the biggest multinationals in the pharmaceutical industry? We are looking for a graduate student in the field of Biotechnology/Bioinformatics, Data Science or a related discipline, who is searching for a challenging early career position in our innovative company. This role is part of our Future Career Graduate Program which consists in 1 year project-based contract.

Graduate Project

The Schachen Biotech Process Automation team is providing a strategic link between our early and late-stage pipeline and responsible to develop and maintain a ‘Line of Sight’ between the stages.

The Data Analyst Graduate Project will consist in creating an innovative solution for finding and visualizing correlations between multiple sets and levels of real production process and analytical data. Implementation of PowerBI dashboards for visualization of real time data, focused on representing the key process parameters, key metrics and visualization of out-of-range values for the batches or campaigns. As an extended implementation, creating PowerBI Dashboards to represent a contextualized real time data from SAP (Bill Of Materials, Bill Of Parameters, Inventory) and MES data (Parameter Value Lists) for an overview and possible de-bottlenecking of the Batch/Campaign running.

This will also include working with intelligent automation solutions using AWS and Azure cloud capabilities and tooling, implementation of Power BI dashboards representing the process data and as well possibility of implementation of machine learning algorithms as well as Python or R programming.

As a graduate you should bring energy, knowledge, innovation to carry out the following


Collaborating with various business teams in an international setting to generate business understanding and identifying relevant data sources.
Assess the process and analytical data, collect, clean, and interpret the data available.
Prepare data for analysis and representation in PowerBI Dashboards.
Providing a fresh perspective within the department your opinion matters.
Participate and actively learn about Digital Transformation initiatives involving system integrations, data connectivity and value-based optimization of manufacturing via process supporting analyzation.


The above-mentioned responsibilities are an indication of what you will be doing after proper onboarding and initial learning and development. This provides you with the opportunity to learn and hereafter perform tasks independently. In consultation with your supervisor or peers, you could take on additional tasks and responsibilities.

What Skills You Will Need

In order to excel in this role, you will more than likely have


A graduate student in Biotechnology, Bioinformatics, Data Science.
Passionate about Process Data Science and Data Analysis.
Proven experience in bioprocess engineering, analytical methods, and process data interpretation.
Basic knowledge in Python and/or R.
Basic knowledge in Power BI, Databricks, or Dataiku is preferred but not required.
You are searching for a program where you have the freedom to take initiative.
Effective oral / written communication skills in English.


What We Offer

Being an intern at our company means you will work together with a team on healthcare in an international environment. As a student, you will get the opportunity to develop yourself. In addition, we offer


The possibility to gain experience within the pharmaceutical industry.
The chance to show your potential.
A challenging and dynamic work environment with lots of space to develop yourself.
Professional guidance by an experienced specialist.


What We Look For

In a world of rapid innovation, we seek brave Inventors who want to make an Impact in all aspects of our business, enabling breakthroughs that will affect generations to come. We encourage you to bring your disruptive thinking, collaborative spirit and diverse perspective to our organization. Together we will continue Inventing For Life, Impacting Lives while Inspiring Your Career Growth.

INVENT.

IMPACT.

INSPIRE.

We are proud to be a company that embraces the value of bringing diverse, talented, and committed people together. The fastest way to breakthrough innovation is when diverse ideas come together in an inclusive environment. We encourage our colleagues to respectfully challenge one another’s thinking and approach problems collectively. We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace

Current Employees apply HERE

Current Contingent Workers apply HERE

Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully

Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, NJ, USA, also known as Merck Sharp & Dohme LLC, Rahway, NJ, USA, does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs / resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Requisition ID R348035

Title: BI Developer and analyst
Description:
💼 Job Title : BI Developer and analyst

📍 Localisation : Geneva or Zurich

⏳ Activity rate : 100%

🗓️ Starting date : July 2025




Job purpose :




The BI Developer in close cooperation with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager serves the Applications Engineering Division (and on opportunity also other business users in the Technical Department) by developing BI visuals (KPI dashboards, trend graphs, …) of data out of the software development and deployment processes of the division. These visuals will be part of a structured Cockpit for the division allowing at different levels of granularity to monitor the performance and output of the division. The overall cockpit shall enable the division to identify and address improvement areas. He or she will work closely with the division's Continuous Improvement Manager to implement this cockpit.




He or she is responsible to analyze complex information and data flows as well as existing data structures with the target to optimize BI data models including the associated process and data flow logic. The reporting tool is Power BI where solutions will be developed.




He or she will be involved in the contact with stakeholders, customers and users for the determination of their needs.

He or she will further interact with these persons during the development of the reports in a closed feedback loop.




The to be developed visuals shall support the division management and other stakeholders to

understand the status of a process, the organization, the product quality, …
easily identify trends and areas requiring measures for improvement,
take decisions about improvement measures,
monitor progress after implementation of improvement measures.




The BI developer is accountable for applying best practices in his/her work and for striving for common look and feel and user friendliness of the visuals.







Responsabilities :




Supports the division in building up a visual data driven cockpit of relevant KPIs for the processes and products of the division.
Collaborates with the Continuous Improvement Manager closely on the overall concept, as well as on the implementation of the individual KPI visuals.
Collaborates with other stakeholders and team members who provide or maintain basic data.







Tasks :




Elicit requirements for Visuals
Identify and analyze data sources
Establish means for automatic collection
Develop data model within the BI tool according to best practices
Job Description Page 2 of 2 Profile-BI Developer-and-analyst-final
Apply solution-oriented data transformation
Develop visualization within the BI tool considering style guides
Where appropriate or needed evolve existing style guides
Test visual
Provide user description or info about each visual
Provide technical description for maintenance of each visual(support) rollout of new visuals
Improve visuals in feedback driven collaboration with stakeholders and users of the visuals







Knowledge/experience :




3+ years of experience as BI developer, preferably with Power BI
Very good verbal and written English
French and/or German language skills a plus
Data modelling and analysis
Problem solving mindset
Power BI desktop tool expertise
Data transformation with M language
DAX knowledge (Data Analysis Expressions)
Visualization and design
Deployment of Power BI visuals
Reporting process automation (data collection, transformations and refresh)
Practical knowledge of collaboration tools like Jira, Confluence a plusv




Softskills :




Collaborative, team player
Organized and methodic
Good communication skills
Proactive and outgoing personality







------------------------------------------------------------------




🌍 Founded in 2007, Antaes is a Swiss management and technology consulting company 🇨🇭, ranked among the top 10 consulting firms in Switzerland. We have over 300 experienced engineers who share our passion.




📍 With offices in Switzerland, Singapore, Hong Kong, and France, we support our Swiss and international clients in the following areas:

Organisation & Transformation Consulting
Industrial Engineering
Information Systems Management




By joining our team, you will discover:

A dynamic team with a start-up spirit
A human-centric approach & personalized career follow-up
Education & Training to keep developing your skills
Exciting events: team building, meet-ups, workshops, afterworks, and Winter + Summer Events




🏆 A company certified @HappyAtWork and committed to CSR (Ecovadis 2023 Gold Medal 🥇)




You too can be part of the Antaes adventure !

Title: Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science)
Description:
CT_Technology & Innovation-E122

Internship R&D Engineer (Data Science) - Full Time - Oberwinterthur, Switzerland

Sulzer is a leading engineering company with a proud heritage of innovation. Join our global team to grow your expertise and develop innovative solutions that enable a prosperous and more sustainable society.

We are looking for an R&D Engineer, Data Science Intern to join our Chemtech, Technology and Innovation, team in Oberwinterthur.

Join our R&D team for six months and develop innovative solutions for the chemical industry and sustainable technologies, including carbon capture and emission control. Focused on digitalization, you will help drive data-driven product development from ideation to market-ready solutions within our Separation Technology business unit.

Your main tasks and responsibilities:


Collaborate in Contribute to data-driven product development within the Separation Technology business unit.
Collect, organize, and analyze experimental data from our pilot plants and production facilities.
Identify opportunities to enhance our experimental design and critical parameters for product optimization.
Play an active role in implementing new analytical technologies to support digital transformation.


To succeed in this role, you will need:


Student or recent graduate in Chemical, Process, or Mechanical Engineering (related disciplines welcome).
Experience in data evaluation, modeling, visualization, and data-driven analysis.
Previous experience with programming languages such as Python or R.
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office is expected.
Curious, motivated team player with a knack for problem-solving and a desire to advance your career in a dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment.
Fluency in English.


What we offer you:


25 days holiday (exclusive of bank holidays)
Defined contribution pension scheme
Employee Assistance Program/health care
On-site car parking/public transport allowance
Access to a wide range of discounts


No visa or work permit support can be provided for this role.

Do you have a question about the role?

Reach out to Alexi Donadoni at Alexi.Donadoni@sulzer.com . Our team is looking forward hearing from you!

Sulzer is an equal opportunity employer. We believe in the strength of a diverse workforce and are committed to offering an inclusive work environment.

We are proud to be recognized as a Top Employer 2025 in Brazil, China, Finland, Germany, Ireland, Switzerland, South Africa, the UK and the USA.

Title: Data Engineer (100%)
Description:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities


Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.


Requirements


Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
Knowledge of Python programming language.
Experience with Pandas or Polars (Dataframes), SQLAlchemy (database toolkit), Streamlit is a plus.
Hands-on experience with SQL.
Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
Good understanding of NoSQL databases: Apache Solr, MongoDB.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organisational skills.
Technical expertise in data mining and modelling techniques.
Basic understanding of Machine Learning models.
Proven ability to work independently and within a team.


What We Offer


The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
Flexible working hours;
Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
Company retreat facility;
Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
And more


If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:


A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
Copy of ID and Diplomas
If available: reference letters and certificates.


About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Initiatives

At MDPI, We Develop And Maintain Various Platforms In Order To Better Serve The Scientific Community. Please Find Here-below a List Of Our Main Platforms

https://www.mdpi.com

https://www.mdpi.com/books/

https://sciprofiles.com

https://sciforum.net

https://www.scilit.net

https://www.preprints.org

https://encyclopedia.pub


Show more
HTML:
To strengthen our AI / Data team, we are looking for a Data Engineer that will play a key role in supporting us data modeling, quality, validation, analysis, governance, warehouse and ETL pipelines. The position of Data Engineer is a full-time and permanent position based in our office in the Basel, Switzerland. As part of our commitment to fostering a collaborative team environment, this role requires working fully on-site.

Tasks & Responsibilities

  • Data modelling: design and implement data models that support business requirements and optimise for performance and scalability on large datasets.
  • Data quality and validation: provide support and solutions to develop data quality checks within the pipelines to ensure data is always within its expectations.
  • Data integration: integrate data from all sources within the company and make it equally available for local and remote organisations.
  • Data analysis: develop and maintain insightful reports and dashboards to provide business metrics, trends and performances.
  • Data governance: support ensuring data compliance and harmonisation by developing strong and meaningful collaboration with data governance team policies and regulations.
  • Extract-Transform-Load (ETL) pipelines: create and maintain fast and efficient data pipelines from different relational and non-relational sources - MySQL, Apache Solr, MongoDB, APIs into a centralised data lake and data warehouse, using the Apache Airflow orchestrator.
  • Data Warehouse tuning and optimisation: contribute to the optimisation and performance of the orchestrator and data warehouse to ensure durable environment health and scalability.
  • Cross-functional collaboration: collaborate within an international environment to provide your expertise to data scientists, analysts and business stakeholders.

Requirements

  • Degree in computer science or data engineering certification.
  • Knowledge of Python programming language.
  • Experience with Pandas or Polars (Dataframes), SQLAlchemy (database toolkit), Streamlit is a plus.
  • Hands-on experience with SQL.
  • Experience with relational databases. Knowledge of MySQL and PostgreSQL-specific features is a plus.
  • Good understanding of NoSQL databases: Apache Solr, MongoDB.
  • Excellent problem-solving, communication, and organisational skills.
  • Technical expertise in data mining and modelling techniques.
  • Basic understanding of Machine Learning models.
  • Proven ability to work independently and within a team.

What We Offer

  • The opportunity to contribute to the academic/scientific community;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Team bond strengthening through team-building events;
  • Professional growth opportunities with our global training system;
  • Working in a collaborative, diverse, and socially responsible team;
  • Company retreat facility;
  • Full-coverage insurance for accidents/daily sickness;
  • Prime location near Basel train station and city center;
  • And more

If you are interested in this position, we look forward to receiving:

  • A motivational letter(EN) that briefly describes your motivations for joining MDPI
  • A resume(EN) including personal information, past & current education,
  • Copy of ID and Diplomas
  • If available: reference letters and certificates.

About MDPI

A pioneer in scholarly open access publishing, MDPI has supported academic communities since 1996. Our mission is to foster open scientific exchange in all forms, across all disciplines. We operate more than 400 diverse, peer-reviewed, open access journals supported by over 66,000 academic editors. We serve scholars from around the world to ensure the latest research is openly and broadly available.

MDPI is headquartered in Switzerland with additional offices in Europe, Asia and North America. We are committed to ensuring that high quality research is made available as quickly as possible. We also support sustainability projects, with sustainability as a key theme in many journals and through the MDPI Sustainability Foundation.

Title: Online Data Analyst (Switzerland)
Description:
Job description




Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.




A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.




Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!




TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the world’s largest brands.










Qualification path




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.




Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German languages
Being a resident in Switzerland for the last 2 consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Switzerland
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software




Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, you’ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.




Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicants’ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Data Engineer junior (H/F)
Description:
StarQube développe une suite de solutions Front Office dédiées à l'organisation des données et à la construction de portefeuilles, conçues pour rationaliser les processus d'investissement, depuis l'acquisition des données, en passant par le backtesting rapide des stratégies définies par le client et la gestion des risques, jusqu'au rééquilibrage du portefeuille, à l'envoi des ordres et à la production de rapports. StarQube offre aux gestionnaires d'actifs un moyen agile d'automatiser chacun des processus de gestion de portefeuille tout en économisant sur les coûts de structure et de données.




Nous cherchons à pourvoir un poste de Data Engineer junior (H/F) localisé dans la région de Genève.


Vos missions



Acquérir l’expertise de l’utilisation de nos outils de manière à pouvoir accompagner nos clients dans la création de leurs processus d’investissement et de leurs rapports.


Analyser, comprendre et intégrer de manière élégante de nouveaux jeux de données à nos outils selon les besoins de nos clients.


Gérer la relation avec les clients sur les projets confiés (possibilité de déplacements chez les clients) et coordination avec les autres équipes de StarQube.


Utiliser l’expérience ainsi acquise pour contribuer à l’évolution de nos solutions en général.


Participer à la création continue de modèles financiers pour nos clients et prospects.


Participer aux efforts commerciaux de l’équipe de Business Development.



Vos compétences



Autonomie et rigueur avec un fort niveau d'exigence (orientation résultats, sens aigu des responsabilités). Vous aimez organiser et faire parler les données.


Master (ou équivalent) en computer science, ingénierie ou autre diplôme scientifique.


Connaissance d’un langage de programmation (p.ex. Java, Python).


Excellentes capacités de communication en français et en anglais.


À l’aise dans un environnement start-up.
Show more

Title: SQL Developer
Description:
Job Description




On behalf of our client, a prestigious Wealth Management firm specialised in alternative investment solutions, we are seeking a highly motivated and experienced SQL Developer to join our client's IT Data and Application Management team. The role will focus on developing, optimizing, and maintaining their data reconciliation platform while also supporting the management of the Master Data Management (MDM) system.




Responsibilities




Oversee the full development lifecycle of the SQL-based data reconciliation platform, from gathering requirements to development, testing, deployment, and ongoing maintenance.
Design and implement additional integrations to enhance the reconciliation platform.
Contribute to the ongoing development of the central Master Data Management (MDM) system, focusing on integrations with other systems; act as a deputy for the MDM application manager.
Identify and resolve performance issues to ensure the platform’s scalability.
Collaborate with application owners, business analysts, and stakeholders to understand new requirements and implement appropriate solutions.







Requirements




Master’s degree in computer science, mathematics, engineering, or a related IT-focused discipline.
Strong hands-on experience with Microsoft SQL Server (T-SQL).
Proficiency in data reconciliation and integration with databases and file-based systems.
Familiarity with ETL processes and data transformation techniques.
Solid understanding of data architecture and data modeling principles.
Enthusiastic about new technologies with a willingness to learn and adapt.
Strong analytical mindset with a goal-oriented, solution-driven approach.
Organized and detail-oriented with a structured working style.
Experience in the financial sector and knowledge of asset management is a plus.
Effective communication skills in English and German as a strong advantage.







Due to immigration restrictions in Switzerland, we will only be able to consider applications from Swiss or EU citizens or from candidates holding a valid Swiss work permit.

Title: Consultant - Forensic Technology and eDiscovery
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The Forensic Technology & eDiscovery team is a group of technical specialists that leverages data and technology to investigate high-profile financial crime matters related to fraud, corruption, money-laundering, misconducts and support the enforcement of regulatory requirements.

The nature of our work requires the collection, processing and management of large sets of communications, documents and records from a wide array of information systems. We combine deep investigation expertise with Forensic, eDiscovery and artificial intelligence (“AI”) technology to accelerate the fact-finding process.

The opportunity


The rapidly growing Forensic department is currently seeking the right candidates for an excellent career opportunity in the Forensic Technology and eDiscovery team.
You will be responsible for providing critical support to our teams of investigators, clients, legal counsels and regulators in fact-finding activities.
Our methodology incorporates advanced data analysis technologies such as Generative AI (“GenAI”), natural language processing, machine learning, predictive coding, social network analysis and automation. You will receive training on our forensic technologies and the opportunity to contribute to innovation.
You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the growth and strategy of the team.


Your Key Responsibilities


Working in engagement teams, carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of unstructured and structured data.
Collaborating with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations.
Working in our dedicated Forensic Technology & eDiscovery lab and secure platform to help clients secure and uncover facts with the use of technology.
Innovating and developing new solutions to answer current and future needs of our clients.
Supporting the leadership team and the project manager on the operational level and acting as a role model and coach for more junior team members.


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role you must have


Degree (Bachelor or Master) in all fields related to Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering and other technical majors
Strong problem solving, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and “can-do” approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German or French is a plus).


Ideally, you’ll also have


Solid programming skills with Python, R, SQL or other main programming languages
Solid knowledge of IT infrastructure and security topics
Experience with Relativity, Nuix, and other state-of-the-art Forensic Technology & eDiscovery tools
Experience using Generative AI and engineering prompts


What We Offer


International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
Constant personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*
exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position (ID: 814785) online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.

Title: Stagiaire Data Science & ML Ops (h/f) 100% - temporaire 6 mois
Description:
Tu souhaites rejoindre une équipe au cœur de la transformation digitale par la donnée et l’IA ? Intègre l'équipe Advanced Analytics, au sein du secteur Strategy & Data Analytics, dont la mission est de concevoir des solutions concrètes et innovantes en combinant analytique avancée, machine learning et intelligence artificielle générative (GenAI). Si tu es passionné(e) par la data, l’IA et les technologies émergentes, et que tu souhaites contribuer à une transformation digitale ambitieuse dans une équipe dynamique et diversifiée, rejoins-nous !

TA MISSION


Tu analyses des données concrètes liées au secteur de l’assurance-maladie pour en extraire des insights à forte valeur ajoutée
En contribuant activement aux thématiques clés de l’équipe, telles que la détection de fraudes et d’erreurs, la mise en place d'un chatbot basé sur des technologies IA, l’optimisation de l’efficience opérationnelle via des modèles prédictifs ou génératifs, et les analyses clients pour mieux comprendre les besoins et comportements, tu joues un rôle essentiel
Tu participes à la préparation, au traitement et à la visualisation des données (nettoyage, transformation, dashboards) Aider à la conception et au déploiement de modèles de machine learning dans un cadre structuré (ML Ops, automatisation, monitoring) fait partie de tes responsabilités
En coopérant avec les équipes data, IT et métiers, tu relis les enjeux business aux solutions data
Tu développes tes compétences techniques (Python, SQL, ML), mais aussi méthodologiques et relationnelles, en évoluant dans un environnement collaboratif et stimulant


Tes qualités


Tu maîtrises le français (C1)
Tu as des bases en programmation et data science : Python (pandas, scikit-learn, etc.), IDE, Git et SQL te sont familiers
Manipuler des données, les visualiser et appliquer des techniques de machine learning, c'est ton terrain de jeu
Autonome et proactif(ve), tu es prêt(e) à apprendre et à construire une carrière dans la donnée
Tu sais comprendre un enjeu métier et y répondre avec des solutions orientées données
Ton esprit d’équipe et ton goût pour le travail collaboratif font de toi un(e) collègue idéal(e)


Ta formation


Tu es étudiant(e) en cours de Bachelor ou de Master, ou récemment diplômé(e) dans un domaine tel que l’informatique, les systèmes de communication, la data science, ou équivalent


Pour nous rejoindre


Partage-nous ton parcours avec ton CV et tu peux volontiers y ajouter quelques mots pour nous parler de toi et de tes motivations


Fonction : Temporaire

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

Si toi aussi tu aimes l’entre-aide, la bienveillance et la proactivité, tu es à la bonne place !

Ici, au Groupe Mutuel, nous t’offrons la possibilité d’exercer une activité variée tout en favorisant un environnement de travail stimulant qui concilie ta vie privée ainsi que professionnelle. Tu te retrouveras dans une équipe où travail, rigueur mais surtout plaisir sont les mots d’ordre.

Entrée en fonction: Aussi vite que possible, mais aussi lentement que nécessaire!
Show more

Pourquoi rejoindre notre équipe?

Si toi aussi tu aimes l’entre-aide, la bienveillance et la proactivité, tu es à la bonne place !

Ici, au Groupe Mutuel, nous t’offrons la possibilité d’exercer une activité variée tout en favorisant un environnement de travail stimulant qui concilie ta vie privée ainsi que professionnelle. Tu te retrouveras dans une équipe où travail, rigueur mais surtout plaisir sont les mots d’ordre.

Entrée en fonction: Aussi vite que possible, mais aussi lentement que nécessaire!

Title: Consultant - Forensic Technology and eDiscovery
Description:
At EY, we’re all in to shape your future with confidence.

We’ll help you succeed in a globally connected powerhouse of diverse teams and take your career wherever you want it to go.

Join EY and help to build a better working world.

The Forensic Technology & eDiscovery team is a group of technical specialists that leverages data and technology to investigate high-profile financial crime matters related to fraud, corruption, money-laundering, misconducts and support the enforcement of regulatory requirements.

The nature of our work requires the collection, processing and management of large sets of communications, documents and records from a wide array of information systems. We combine deep investigation expertise with Forensic, eDiscovery and artificial intelligence (“AI”) technology to accelerate the fact-finding process.

The opportunity


The rapidly growing Forensic department is currently seeking the right candidates for an excellent career opportunity in the Forensic Technology and eDiscovery team.
You will be responsible for providing critical support to our teams of investigators, clients, legal counsels and regulators in fact-finding activities.
Our methodology incorporates advanced data analysis technologies such as Generative AI (“GenAI”), natural language processing, machine learning, predictive coding, social network analysis and automation. You will receive training on our forensic technologies and the opportunity to contribute to innovation.
You will have a unique, career changing opportunity to play a key role in the growth and strategy of the team.


Your Key Responsibilities


Working in engagement teams, carrying out both reactive and proactive data analysis of large volumes of unstructured and structured data.
Collaborating with clients, fraud investigators, internal and external auditors, lawyers and regulatory authorities in sensitive and sometimes adversarial situations.
Working in our dedicated Forensic Technology & eDiscovery lab and secure platform to help clients secure and uncover facts with the use of technology.
Innovating and developing new solutions to answer current and future needs of our clients.
Supporting the leadership team and the project manager on the operational level and acting as a role model and coach for more junior team members.


Skills And Attributes For Success

To qualify for the role you must have


Degree (Bachelor or Master) in all fields related to Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering and other technical majors
Strong problem solving, analytical, technical, and interpersonal skills
Consulting-oriented mindset, flexibility and “can-do” approach
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (German or French is a plus).


Ideally, you’ll also have


Solid programming skills with Python, R, SQL or other main programming languages
Solid knowledge of IT infrastructure and security topics
Experience with Relativity, Nuix, and other state-of-the-art Forensic Technology & eDiscovery tools
Experience using Generative AI and engineering prompts


What We Offer


International multi-cultural team of highly motivated professionals
Constant personal development with a steep learning curve – a system of trainings, mentoring, counselling and on-the-job learning
Modern working environment and equipment, fostering mobile working flexibility
Transparent performance-based recognition and progression system
Acquire a fully accredited corporate MBA (EY Tech MBA) from Hult International Business School, whilst working with EY, completely free*
exception of EY contractors, interns and alumni.


If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Make the next step and apply for this position (ID: 814785) online. For further information please contact our recruitment team (recruitment.switzerland@ey.com / +41 58 286 33 66).

The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.

EY | Building a better working world

EY is building a better working world by creating new value for clients, people, society and the planet, while building trust in capital markets.

Enabled by data, AI and advanced technology, EY teams help clients shape the future with confidence and develop answers for the most pressing issues of today and tomorrow.

EY teams work across a full spectrum of services in assurance, consulting, tax, strategy and transactions. Fueled by sector insights, a globally connected, multi-disciplinary network and diverse ecosystem partners, EY teams can provide services in more than 150 countries and territories.
Show more

Title: Business intelligence and data analytics specialist 50-60%
Description:
Business intelligence and data analytics specialist

Referenznummer 65997

Über uns

Bucher Municipal AG ist ein weltweit führender Hersteller von Kommunalfahrzeugen zur effizienten Reinigung von öffentlichen und privaten Verkehrsflächen. Das Produktangebot umfasst Kompakt- und Grosskehrfahrzeuge, Kanalreinigungsfahrzeuge, Winterdienstausrüstungen, Müllfahrzeuge und Digital Services.

Zur Unterstützung der Geschäftsentwicklung und des Wachstums unserer Division durch datenbasierte Geschäfts- und Marktanalysen suchen wir dich als Business intelligence and data analytics specialist / 50-60%.

Diese vielseitigen und verantwortungsvollen Aufgaben möchten wir dir übertragen:


Geschäfts- und Marktanalysen, Marktforschung und Intelligence
Datenbasierte Erkenntnisse, z.B. aus CRM- und CXM-Systemen zur Unterstützung von Entscheidungsprozessen und Geschäftswachstum
Sammlung und Verwaltung von Marktdaten
Entwicklung von Business-Intelligence-Tools, KPIs und Dashboards sowie deren Leistungsmessung und Administration
Unterstützung bei der Nachfragegenerierung und Erweiterung der Vertriebspipeline
Verwaltung von CXM-Systemen sowie Anwenderunterstützung und Durchführen von Schulungen


Deine Qualifikationen


Abgeschlossene Ausbildung im Bereich Data Science und/oder Business Intelligence und Analytics
Erfahrung mit MS Dynamics 365 CRM- und ERP-Modulen, Microsoft Power BI und Power Automate sowie Kenntnisse in CX-Systemen
Englischkenntnisse sind zwingend erforderlich, weitere Sprachen, insbesondere Deutsch, sind von Vorteil
Teamorientierte Persönlichkeit mit einer selbständigen und exakten Arbeitsweise


Deine Perspektiven

Möchtest du Teil eines engagierten, professionellen und hilfsbereiten Teams werden? Wir bieten dir eine interessante Herausforderung in einem globalen, erfolgreichen und innovativen Industrieunternehmen. Gute und faire Anstellungsbedingungen sind für uns selbstverständlich. Zudem ist dein zukünftiger Arbeitsplatz mit den öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln (Bus oder S-Bahn ab Baden und Zürich) sehr gut erreichbar. Zusätzlich stehen unseren Mitarbeitern kostenlose Parkplätze und für die Verpflegung ein Personalrestaurant zur Verfügung.

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt? Wir freuen uns darauf, dich bald kennen zu lernen!

Lukas Büchi, Human Resources Director, freut sich über deine vollständige Bewerbung mit Bezug auf die Referenz 65997 an PERSONAL.CH@BUCHERMUNICIPAL.COM
Show more

Title: Expert for data analysis and processing
Description:
Mission

In this joint position between the Center for Imaging and CIME, you will serve the EM community for exploiting measurements made on the electron microscopy platform. You will identify bottlenecks for data analysis in electron microscopy and create robust image and data analysis pipelines for typical CIME workloads

Main Duties And Responsibilities


Support EPFL researchers for electron microscopy data analysis
Analyse the needs for data processing workflows of the EPFL’s EM community
Implement (possibly ML/AI-driven) data analysis pipelines within EM imaging
Contribute to the research and development of new data analysis techniques and workflows in EM
Acting as a bridge between the CIME and the Center of Imaging.


Profile


Master or PhD in Science (Physics, Materials Science, Chemistry, Computer Science).
Expertise in the following fields/techniques :
Large scale data analysis
Development of data processing techniques/workflows
Quantitative Imaging
Experience in machine learning, AI etc.

We offer


Excellent working conditions in a dynamic multi-disciplinary environment
Possibility to increase your competences and extend your horizon.


Informations

Contract Start Date : to be discussed

Activity Rate : 100.00

Contract Type: CDD

Duration: 1 year, possibly renewable

Reference: 1560

For additional information: Please contact M. Marco Cantoni by e-mail: marco.cantoni@epfl.ch
Show more

Title: Internship Digital Chemistry Bayesian optimisation
Description:
Company Description

As a world market leader in crop protection, we help farmers to counter these threats and ensure enough safe, nutritious, affordable food for all – while minimizing the use of land and other agricultural inputs. Syngenta Crop Protection keeps plants safe from planting to harvesting. From the moment a seed is planted through to harvest, crops need to be protected from weeds, insects and diseases as well as droughts and floods, heat and cold. Syngenta Crop Protection is headquartered in Switzerland.

Job Description

Join our Data Manufacturing Excellence and Chemistry Research teams as a Data Analytics Intern. We offer two internships: one optimizing global production processes for cost and sustainability, and another enhancing chemical target selection in research.

Both projects use cutting-edge Bayesian statistical modeling techniques to improve decision-making. You'll develop predictive models to boost manufacturing efficiency and candidate selection accuracy.

This opportunity provides exposure to real-life data from research and production, involves high-impact projects on operational efficiency and sustainability, and offers insight into a large organization's research and manufacturing operations.

Ideal for those passionate about data analysis, data science, and development.

Planned duration of the internship: 4-6 months starting from March 2025.

Main Responsibilities


Work with Research and Production departments
Develop a methodology to optimize cost, sustainability impact and chemical yield
Work on a concrete case study, on one of our Active Ingredient currently on market
Identify key drivers of chemical process to be optimized
Analyze variable production cost data from 5 international manufacturing sites based in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil
Develop predictive models to anticipate cost variations
Build predictive models in R or Python (eg using PyMC and SciPy optimize packages for Bayesian inference)
Create and maintain data flows and interactive dashboards to visualize variable product cost KPIs
Participate in the development of decision support tools for cost optimization
Collaborate with international teams to standardize data collection and analysis practices
Make larger analysis on other sites including 5 sites in UK, Switzerland, France, USA & Brazil


Qualifications


BAC+5 student, Master's or Engineering School, specialized in Data Science, you are looking for a 6-month end-of-year internship.
You have knowledge of programming languages, Python, SQL
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and statistical analysis
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite and statistical methods is required
Rigorous and organized, you respect quality/deadline constraints and know how to adapt your work organization according to the priorities given.
Good communicator and naturally curious, you easily discuss the progress of your activities, the problems encountered and work in a spirit of continuous service improvement.
Your interpersonal skills allow you to integrate easily into teams.
Given the company's international environment, an intermediate level of written/read English (email exchanges, meetings, technical documents...) is required at minimum.
Valid driver's license required for site access.


Additional Information

What we offer


An international experience in a multicultural environment
Exposure to concrete large-scale cost optimization projects
Possibility to publish on methodologies utilized while keeping confidential information on Syngenta knowledge
Mentoring by data experts
Opportunity to travel to different production sites


Interested? We are looking for your application! Along with your Cover letter and CV please provide a Research Summary of 2-5 pages.

Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.

Health Promotion Switzerland recognizes Syngenta's commitment to the health and well-being of its employees and awards the "Friendly Work Space" label to all its Swiss sites. At Syngenta, employee health and well-being are key to the company.
Show more

Title: Member of Technical Staff, AI Data
Description:
Overview

Help b uild the w orld’s m ost a dvanced m ultimodal d ataset at Microsoft AI.

We are on a mission to create the largest and most advanced multimodal dataset in the world. This dataset , spanning all modalities from across the web and beyond , will power the training of the world’s most capable AI frontier models , pushing the boundaries of scale , performance , and product deployment.

The AI Data team at Microsoft AI is responsible for all aspects of data preparation to support our model pre-training operations, including collecting data from the source, extracting and transforming the most useful data, and understanding the impact of changes to data by training and evaluating new models . We are an interdisciplinary team of engineers and scientists, learning from each other, and collaborating to create the best models and products. We work closely with the teams that transform pre-trained models into the models that power the consumer Copilot experience .

About

We are looking for outstanding individuals excited about contributi ng to the next generation of systems that will transform the field. In particular, we are looking for candidates who :


Are pa ssionate about the role of data in large-scale AI model training
Will thrive in a highly collaborative, fast-paced environment
Have a high degree of craftsmanship and pay close attention to details
Demonstrate a proactive attitude and enthusiasm for exploring new methods and technologies
Effectively manage multiple responsibilities and can adjust to shifting priorities .


Responsibilities


Design and develop data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video).
Build and maintain cutting-edge infrastructure that can store and process the petabytes of data needed to power models.
Partner with the pretraining and post-training teams to improve our data recipe by rigorous and careful experimentation.
Collaborate with the product team and other engineers and researchers across Microsoft AI to identify gaps in the current generation of models.
Embody our culture and values .


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science , Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
OR Master's Degree in Computer Science , Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
OR equivalent experience.
Experience u sing data processing technologies for Multimodal dataset scalability, parellel processing, data handling, streaming/batch processing, etc.
Experience working with distributed computing tools such as; Spark, Kubernetes, TensorFlow, Flink and Pyspark.
Experience conducted research in Machine Learning or worked as an ML Engineer/ MLOps/ SWE.
Experience designing and developing data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video) AND have the skills to be able to build infrastructure to support this work from ground up.


Preferred


Experience working with large scale of data ideal Petabyte scale or above.


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.
Show more

 Required/Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science , Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, data modeling or data engineering work
  • OR Master's Degree in Computer Science , Math, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field AND experience in business analytics, data science, software development, or data engineering work
  • OR equivalent experience.
  • Experience u sing data processing technologies for Multimodal dataset scalability, parellel processing, data handling, streaming/batch processing, etc.
  • Experience working with distributed computing tools such as; Spark, Kubernetes, TensorFlow, Flink and Pyspark.
  • Experience conducted research in Machine Learning or worked as an ML Engineer/ MLOps/ SWE.
  • Experience designing and developing data pipelines that ingest enormous amounts of multi-modal training data (text, audio, images, video) AND have the skills to be able to build infrastructure to support this work from ground up.

Preferred

  • Experience working with large scale of data ideal Petabyte scale or above.

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .

Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

Title: Business Analyst IT
Description:
Itecor est une société internationale de conseil en transformation digitale dont le siège est situé en Suisse. Nos consultants relèvent au quotidien le défi de travailler sur des projets pour de prestigieux clients issus aussi bien des secteurs technologiques, bancaires et financiers que du secteur public, de l'enseignement et des produits de grande consommation. Grâce à nos communautés de pratique, nous les accompagnons pour devenir les meilleurs dans leur domaine. Être proche de nos clients, fournir des services à haute valeur ajoutée, incarner l'innovation appliquée - ensemble avec nos consultants : voilà ce qui fait notre ADN. S'il est important pour vous de travailler pour une entreprise attachée au respect, à la qualité et au service, avec une approche tournée vers l'humain, consciente de sa responsabilité sociale, nous aimerions faire votre connaissance : rejoignez une communauté qui valorise le savoir, qui fait preuve d'audace et qui vous inspirera.

Pour renforcer notre équipe d'experts en solutions digitales à Lausanne nous recrutons un(e)

Business Analyst

Si vous êtes passionné par la business analyse, que vous cherchez constamment à apprendre et à enrichir vos compétences, alors vous êtes celui/celle que nous recherchons ! Vous ferez partie de notre équipe d'experts et serez impliqué dans des projets ambitieux.

votre rôle


En collaboration avec le chef de projet, assurer la mise en œuvre d'une solution pour un service bénéficiaire.
Décrire le périmètre fonctionnel et non fonctionnel matérialisé par le référentiel d'exigences, le cahier des charges et les spécifications.
Accompagner les services bénéficiaires dans la description et la priorisation des exigences.
Assurer la traçabilité du besoin à l'exigence et de l'exigence à la fonctionnalité.
Escalader au chef de projet les écarts si nécessaires, pour faire évoluer les besoins et la solution itérativement dans une démarche agile.
Décrire une solution viable qui tienne compte du cadre et des directives/concepts en vigueur : architecture, sécurité, produits et services, cyberadministration, archivage, protection des données, tests, etc... Intégrer les compétences associées à la relecture des exigences, du cahier des charges et des spécifications.
En collaboration avec les utilisateurs, élaborer les cas d'usage et les maquettes fonctionnelles.
Favoriser l'analyse de l'expérience utilisateur.
Rédiger des livrables tel que le dossier d'exigences, le cahier des charges, les spécifications générales et détaillées, les processus détaillés, user stories, maquettes, acceptation de la solution, stratégie de changement, stratégie de tests, bilan de projet.
Soutenir le chef de projet dans ses activités de pilotage, d'analyse prospective des risques et d'accompagnement au changement
Soutenir le Responsable du SI dans la description de l'architecture fonctionnelle et les processus du SI.
Soutenir l'équipe qualité et tests dans la définition et la réalisation de scénarios et tests fonctionnels ainsi que leur acceptation par le métier


vos connaissances


Bachelor en Informatique ou équivalent
Certification en Business Analyst, IIBA, IREB ou équivalent souhaitée
Minimum 5 ans d'expérience en tant que Business Analyst
Expérience de conception de solution et du cycle de vie du logiciel
Pratique des concepts et méthodologies agiles


ce que nous offrons


Faire partie d'une entreprise multinationale et diversifiée ayant des bureaux en Suisse, en France, en Macédoine, au Mexique et en Espagne
Bénéficier de notre gestion des connaissances grâce à un large éventail de compétences et de conseils
Se développer sur le plan personnel et professionnel
Bénéficier d'un environnement de travail convivial et respectueux
Profiter d'événements internes réguliers et divertissants pour favoriser les échanges
Oser être soi-même, faire preuve d'engagement personnel et de responsabilité, obtenir un respect mutuel, une ouverture d'esprit et des souvenirs inoubliables
Parrainer de nouveaux employés et être récompensé



itecor, trusted advisor for your digital transformation

Itecor est une entreprise indépendante et solide qui s'est développée dans le respect de ses valeurs humaines et sociétales depuis sa création en 1992. Aujourd'hui, Itecor International SA emploie plus de 220 collaborateurs dans 8 bureaux différents à travers le monde (Vevey, Genève, Zurich, Paris, Barcelone, Skopje, Mexico, Durango), et propose des services basés sur les trois piliers que sont la gouvernance et la gestion de services, les solutions digitales et l'assurance qualité-testing. Des équipes locales et transversales tissent des liens de qualité, durables, avec leurs clients.

Nous nous réjouissons de votre candidature.

Nous vous informons que seuls les candidats sélectionnés recevront une réponse. Nous vous remercions de votre compréhension.

Title: Database Engineer
Description:
Job Opportunity: Database Engineer




We are looking for highly skilled Database Engineer (m/w/d) to join our customer team on a temporary basis. In this position, you will have the opportunity to actively participate in exciting database projects and contribute to the continuous improvement of processes at our client in the telecommunications industry. If you have a technical background and are interested in the design and optimization of modern database systems, then this could be the right opportunity for you.







Your responsibilities:

Administration, installation, configuration and maintenance of PostgreSQL and MariaDB databases.
Database performance optimization, including query tuning, indexing and configuration settings.
Implementation and management of high availability and replication solutions for databases.
Backup and recovery management to ensure data integrity and security.
Monitoring and analyzing system performance to identify bottlenecks and proactively resolve issues.
Support in the planning and implementation of database migration projects.
Administer and configure the Apache web server to support database-driven web applications.
Develop and maintain scripts to automate routine tasks.
Collaborating with developers and other IT teams to optimize database solutions.
Creation and maintenance of technical documentation and operating manuals




Your profile

Degree in computer science, information technology or a comparable qualification. Certificates
Several years of experience in the administration of PostgreSQL and MariaDB under Linux.
Sound knowledge of SQL, database design and performance tuning.
Experience with the configuration and administration of Apache web servers.
Knowledge of shell programming (Bash, Python, Perl) and automation tools.
Experience with high availability solutions (e.g. Patroni, Galera Cluster) and replication mechanisms.
Knowledge of backup strategies and disaster recovery.
Good problem-solving skills and an analytical mindset.
Ability to work in a team as well as independently and in a structured manner.
Certifications such as PostgreSQL Certified DBA, MariaDB Certified Database Administrator or similar an advantage
Experience in DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines an advantage
Knowledge of container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) and cloud environments.
Familiarity with security best practices for databases and web servers.
Languages: German and English (fluent)




What we offer

Duration: ASAP – 31.12.2025
You can expect a modern infrastructure: access to the latest technologies and agile working methods
Flexible working hours with the option of working from home offer you a good work-life balance.
Budget: Market rate
Languages: English (mandatory), German (fluent)
Location: Hybrid – 3 days per week in the office in Bern and / or Zürich
Start Date: ASAP
Work location: Bern and Zürich




This is a unique opportunity to work on a high-impact project with the potential for long-term growth. If you're up for the challenge, let’s connect!




Apply now or reach out for more details.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer (w/m) 80-100% - Hybrid
Description:
Über Franke
Wir, die Firma Franke mit ihren drei Divisionen, sind ein weltweit führender Anbieter von Produkten und Dienstleistungen für die Haushaltsküche, die professionelle Systemgastronomie und den Convenience-Store-Bereich sowie für die professionelle Kaffeezubereitung. Mit rund 60 Gesellschaften sind wir auf fünf Kontinenten zu Hause. Über 8'000 Mitarbeitende nehmen immer wieder neue Perspektiven ein, um Chancen zu erkennen und sie in inspirierende, innovative Lösungen für die Anforderungen von morgen umzusetzen.

Die Division Franke Coffee Systems ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter von modernsten Lösungen für die professionelle Kaffeezubereitung. Gemeinsam mit unseren Handelspartnern sind wir bestrebt, erstklassige Tassenqualität, Konsistenz und Getränkevielfalt zu liefern und durch ständige Innovation ein herausragendes Kundenerlebnis zu gewährleisten.

Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der professionellen Kaffeezubereitung!
Unsere vollautomatischen und traditionellen Kaffeemaschinen setzen Massstäbe in Qualität und Genuss – unterstützt durch intelligente Datenverarbeitung.

Daten und Insights spielen eine immer wichtigere Rolle in der professionellen Kaffeezubereitung. Deshalb suchen wir dich als Data Engineer, um mit modernsten Technologien das Kaffeeerlebnis von morgen zu gestalten. Werde Teil unseres Teams und bringe deine Expertise in ein wachsendes, dynamisches Umfeld ein!

Deine Aufgaben

Implementierung, Instandhaltung und Verbesserung von Data Pipelines
End-2-End Betreuung von bestehenden Datenprodukten
Erstellung und Umsetzung von Funktionen zur Sicherstellung der Datenqualität
Vorantreiben des Themas “Infrastructure as Code”
Überwachung von Datenflüssen und der Gesamtarchitektur im Bereich Data Analytics
Identifikation und Einbringen möglicher Verbesserungsansätze in die bestehende Architektur
Auswerten von strukturierten und halbstrukturierten Daten (Kaffeemaschinen-Daten, Nutzerdaten, Reporting etc.)


Dein Profil

Abschluss in der Informatik oder in Data Science (FH, Uni) oder eine gleichwertige Ausbildung
3 Jahre Berufserfahrung in einer ähnlichen Funktion
Fundierte Programmiererfahrung mit Python und SQL im Kontext der Datenverarbeitung, sowie auch der Versionierung von Artefakten (git)
Tiefgehendes Verständnis von Datenbanksystemen oder Arbeitserfahrung mit SQL, NoSQL oder Data-Warehousing Konzepten
Wissen in der Anwendung von statistischen Methoden zur Datenauswertung
Flair für grosse IoT Datenmengen und idealerweise auch für Kaffee
Erfahrung oder Zertifizierungen auf den Plattformen Azure oder Databricks sind ein Plus
Erfahrungen mit Reporting-Anwendungen wie Tableau oder Power BI sind ein Plus
Fliessende Sprachkenntnisse in Deutsch und idealerweise Englisch
Ausgeprägte Koordinationsfähigkeiten und Förderung einer kooperativen und inklusiven Arbeitsumgebung
Zielgruppengerechte Kommunikation von technischen und nicht-technischen Konzepten
Selbstständige Arbeitsweise mit Eigeninitiative
Offenheit für neue Technologien, kontinuierliches Lernen und Knowledge Sharing im Team
Pragmatische und effiziente Problemlösungsfähigkeiten für datenbezogene Herausforderungen.


Was wir bieten

Flexible Arbeitszeiten
Home Office Möglichkeit
40-Stunden Woche
Mindestens 5 Wochen Ferien
Innovation, Forschung & Entwicklung sowie Produktion am Hauptsitz
Kontinuierliche Investitionen in Forschung & Entwicklung
Kostenlose Kaffeegetränke vom Espresso bis zum Latte Macchiato


Eine Welt voller Möglichkeiten – für unsere Mitarbeitenden und vielleicht auch für dich?
Timo Bantle, HR Manager freut sich auf den ersten Kontakt mit Ihnen.

Bitte bewerben Sie sich über den “Jetzt bewerben” Button. Vielen Dank.

Weitere Informationen findest du unter: www.franke.com

Wichtige Information für alle Executive Search Unternehmen, Headhunters und Personalberater
Die Franke Gruppe akzeptiert keine unaufgeforderte Unterstützung von Headhuntern und Personalberatern für unsere Karriere-Opportunitäten. Alle CVs/Lebensläufe, die von externen Personaldienstleistern an Franke oder ihre Mitarbeiter übermittelt werden, ohne dass eine gültige schriftliche Vereinbarung für eine Personalsuche mit bezahlten Bezug auf die betreffende Stelle besteht, gelten als alleiniges Eigentum unseres Unternehmens. Für den Fall, dass von einer Agentur vorgestellte Kandidaten in unserer Firma eingestellt werden und keine vorgängige Vereinbarung besteht, werden keine Gebühren bezahlt.

Title: Ingénieur base de données
Description:
📣 Qim info, qui sommes-nous ?

Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004 et implantée sur Genève, Lausanne, Annecy, Bâle et Zurich, Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un Système d’Information.




Avec 473 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents !

Fin 2021, Qim info obtient une note de 4.31/5 au label Happy at Work® qui permet de mesurer le bien-être et les facteurs de motivations des collaborateurs.




Et se place en 3ème position du classement ICTJournal en 2022.




📌 En quelques mots

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Base de Données dont la mission est d'administrer et de maintenir l'infrastructure des bases de données. Le poste comprend la mise en œuvre physique des bases, la prise en compte de la sécurité, le respect des contrôles d'intégrité, la surveillance des performances et l'optimisation des ressources, le traitement des demandes de travaux des utilisateurs




🎯Votre mission

Définir l'architecture technique des bases de données, des échanges de données et

des entrepôts de données

Mettre en œuvre les stratégies de sauvegarde et de restauration des données
Mettre en œuvre les prestations d'audit et les outils
Concevoir et implémenter les environnements de base de données et en assurer la

maintenance, la disponibilité et les changements

Gérer les performances des bases de données et optimiser l'utilisation des ressources
Optimiser les systèmes de gestion de données
Concevoir et implémenter les contrôles de sécurité autour des données
Surveiller l'authentification et le type d'accès des utilisateurs aux bases de données
Identifier et classer les données selon le degré de confidentialité
Mener les tests unitaires ; selon les retours, procéder aux ajustements.
En cas d’incident sur un traitement, assurer le diagnostic et la résolution.
Assurer le support et l'expertise auprès de l’équipe interne.
Assurer le traitement des demandes des utilisateurs (Dispatch)
Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données SQL Server à partir

de la version 2016 ainsi que l'architecture Always-On

Maîtriser l'écriture de scripts pour les environnements Windows et Unix




💼 Votre profil

Bonne expérience dans la modélisation des données (modèle conceptuel, modèle

logique et modèle physique, diagramme de flux de données et des outils de mise en

œuvre)

Faire preuve de méthode et de rigueur dans l'administration des bases de données
Savoir rédiger des rapports d'incidents et de synthèse pour sa hiérarchie

Compétences importantes

Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données MongoDB
Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données PostgreSQL
Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données Oracle
Certification ITIL et Microsoft
Forte autonomie technique
Capacité à résoudre des problèmes techniques et être force de proposition
Rigueur dans les réalisations et les livraisons
Capacité à partager ses connaissances / à s'intégrer notre équipe BDD




🏆 Conditions du poste

Localisation 📍: Genève
Type de contrat : CDI
Télétravail : 2 jours par semaine
Date de démarrage : Dès que possible




💥Les étapes pour nous rencontrer

Notre équipe de chargés de recrutement est votre premier point de contact. A votre écoute, leur métier est de comprendre votre parcours, et de tenir compte de votre projet de vie et de vos attentes afin de vous proposer des missions qui vous correspondent.
Selon votre domaine d’expertise, nous vous proposons d’échanger et de parler technique avec l’un de nos collaborateurs.
Contexte, constitution de l’équipe en place, objectifs, expertise technique demandée, challenges à relever : cet entretien avec un Business Manager vous permet de connaître en détail les missions ou projets sur lesquels nous pourrions être amenés à travailler ensemble.
Un nouveau challenge au poste qui vous correspond !




🙌 Pourquoi choisir Qim info ?

🛠 Une expertise reconnue dans le monde du conseil avec une activité tournée autour d’une dizaine de secteurs d’activités et une connaissance de l’ensemble des métiers de l’IT.

🤜🤛 Une proximité et un suivi RH & managérial de qualité avec nos consultants pour les accompagner dans leur montée en compétences et dans leur mission au quotidien.

🥳 Nous rejoindre, c’est aussi partager plus qu’une pause-café ! Qim techs talks, soirées d’entreprises... De nombreux événements sont organisés chaque année, de quoi se créer de beaux souvenirs ensemble !




🔎 Vous souhaitez en savoir plus ?

Nous attendons avec impatience votre candidature 😊

Les informations que vous fournissez au cours de la procédure de candidature seront utilisées conformément à la politique de confidentialité de Qim info. En soumettant votre candidature, vous reconnaissez et acceptez les conditions énoncées dans cette déclaration de confidentialité.

Show more
HTML:
📣 Qim info, qui sommes-nous ?

Société d’ingénierie informatique et de services du numérique créée en 2004 et implantée sur Genève, Lausanne, Annecy, Bâle et Zurich, Qim info c’est surtout un ensemble de consultant.e.s capables d’intervenir à tous les niveaux d’un Système d’Information.


Avec 473 collaborateurs, nous sommes toujours à la recherche de nouveaux talents !

Fin 2021, Qim info obtient une note de 4.31/5 au label Happy at Work® qui permet de mesurer le bien-être et les facteurs de motivations des collaborateurs.


Et se place en 3ème position du classement ICTJournal en 2022.


📌 En quelques mots

Nous recherchons un Ingénieur Base de Données dont la mission est d'administrer et de maintenir l'infrastructure des bases de données. Le poste comprend la mise en œuvre physique des bases, la prise en compte de la sécurité, le respect des contrôles d'intégrité, la surveillance des performances et l'optimisation des ressources, le traitement des demandes de travaux des utilisateurs


🎯Votre mission

  • Définir l'architecture technique des bases de données, des échanges de données et

des entrepôts de données

  • Mettre en œuvre les stratégies de sauvegarde et de restauration des données
  • Mettre en œuvre les prestations d'audit et les outils
  • Concevoir et implémenter les environnements de base de données et en assurer la

maintenance, la disponibilité et les changements

  • Gérer les performances des bases de données et optimiser l'utilisation des ressources
  • Optimiser les systèmes de gestion de données
  • Concevoir et implémenter les contrôles de sécurité autour des données
  • Surveiller l'authentification et le type d'accès des utilisateurs aux bases de données
  • Identifier et classer les données selon le degré de confidentialité
  • Mener les tests unitaires ; selon les retours, procéder aux ajustements.
  • En cas d’incident sur un traitement, assurer le diagnostic et la résolution.
  • Assurer le support et l'expertise auprès de l’équipe interne.
  • Assurer le traitement des demandes des utilisateurs (Dispatch)
  • Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données SQL Server à partir

de la version 2016 ainsi que l'architecture Always-On

  • Maîtriser l'écriture de scripts pour les environnements Windows et Unix


💼 Votre profil

  • Bonne expérience dans la modélisation des données (modèle conceptuel, modèle

logique et modèle physique, diagramme de flux de données et des outils de mise en

œuvre)

  • Faire preuve de méthode et de rigueur dans l'administration des bases de données
  • Savoir rédiger des rapports d'incidents et de synthèse pour sa hiérarchie

Compétences importantes

  • Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données MongoDB
  • Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données PostgreSQL
  • Maîtriser la technologie et l'administration des bases de données Oracle
  • Certification ITIL et Microsoft
  • Forte autonomie technique
  • Capacité à résoudre des problèmes techniques et être force de proposition
  • Rigueur dans les réalisations et les livraisons
  • Capacité à partager ses connaissances / à s'intégrer notre équipe BDD

Title: Data Engineer – Lugano, Switzerland
Description:
Data Engineer - Lugano, Switzerland




Tech stack: Data Engineer; MS SQL, SSIS, C#, Data Governance, Data Security (Data Masking, Encryption), Data Catalogs, Power BI, Tableau, Compliance Management, Financial Data Platforms, KPI Calculation, Data Architecture, Data Structures, Data Loading Optimization, ETL, Database Management, System Reliability, System Scalability, Performance Optimization, Business Intelligence, Integration with Enterprise Systems, SQL Server, .NET, Software Development, Automation, Data Integration, Advanced Analytics, Cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS); Data Engineer.




We're thrilled to present an exciting opportunity for Data Engineers with expertise in MS-SQL and C# to join the cutting edge of fintech innovation! Work alongside the brightest minds in private wealth management and financial software development, driving revolutionary advancements in asset management. Our client's latest product release has sparked a transformative wave in the industry, delivering personalized, scalable wealth management solutions like never before. If you're ready to shape the future of finance, join us on this thrilling journey into the next era of fintech excellence!




Our client is looking for passionate Data Engineer candidates with experience in some or all of the following (full training will be provided to fill any gaps in your skill set): (Tech stack: Data Engineer; MS SQL, SSIS, C#, Data Governance, Data Security (Data Masking, Encryption), Data Catalogs, Power BI, Tableau, Compliance Management, Financial Data Platforms, KPI Calculation, Data Architecture, Data Structures, Data Loading Optimization, ETL, Database Management, System Reliability, System Scalability, Performance Optimization, Business Intelligence, Integration with Enterprise Systems, SQL Server, .NET, Software Development, Automation, Data Integration, Advanced Analytics, Cloud Platforms (Azure, AWS); Data Engineer.




This is your opportunity to be part of a new, technically challenging project and to be involved in the creation of a new application from scratch. Fintech is booming and our client are fast becoming a leader of this market!




All Data Engineer positions come with the following benefits:




3 hours ‘free time’ each week to investigate new technologies.
An annual training allowance of CHF 4,500.
27 days holiday (excluding Public Holidays) plus your birthday off.
Flexible working hours.




Location: Lugano, Switzerland/ Hybrid Working




Salary: CHF 80,000 - CHF 95,000 + Bonus + Pension + Benefits




To apply for this position please send your CV to Charlie Skipper at Noir.

Applicants must be based in Switzerland or Italy and have the right to work in Switzerland even though remote working is available.







NOIRSWITTZERLANDREC

NOIREUROPE

NOIREURNET
